item.title: That's that on imposter syndrome
item.description:
Hey there!
On today’s show: In an 8-and-a-half-minute-long TikTok video, Mikaela Testa has accused Anna Paul of some pretty gnarly things. And US Bachelor star Rachael Kirkconnell has gone on Call Her Daddy to talk all about that weird breakup post… We’re diving into all of it in a jam-packed Welcome To My Algorithm. And later: let’s unpack the viral clip of a successful woman saying she’s never had imposter syndrome: because for some reason, that’s apparently a bit controversial…
Huge thanks to Elite Eleven for making this episode of Shameless possible. Their new performance range, Proform, is available now. Shop it online, in-store or via the app and use SHAMELESS10 for 10% off.
On today’s episode, Mich recommended Bohnanza.
This episode was audio-produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more…
Subscribe to our newsletter Smart, Dumb Stuff: https://tinyurl.com/4yasjphn
Follow us on Instagram: https://tinyurl.com/2mf557ux
Aaaand we’re on TikTok: https://tinyurl.com/2hchchrp
Everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: A fake love story (and a very real one)
item.description:
Hiiii hi hi!
On today’s show: Setting the record straight on those Barack Obama/Jennifer Aniston rumours, Gracie Abrams defends her opening act from bizarre stan culture, and then, Triple J’s Hottest 100 came around again, so how relevant in 2025 is both the countdown and the youth radio station in general? Plus, Robert Pattinson trolls the press once more. And then, 2025’s first Slow News Week!!!!
This week Mich recommended Richard Scolyer’s episode of Patient Zero on Australian Story/ABC iView. Zara recommended reading Mark Manson’s 40 Lessons at 40, as well as ‘How Mecca outfoxed Sephora in Australia’ from Style-ish podcast.
This episode was audio-produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to KX Pilates for making this episode possible. Use the code ‘LETSGO’ on the intro offer you can get 5 classes for $50. Just head to kxpilates.com or download the KX Pilates App to find a class near you.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: A quick and dirty with aplomb!
item.description:
Hi hi hi!
Today on the show, it’s the Quick and Dirty to end all Quick and Dirties! We’re diving into all the headlines we missed over the break. Like… Brad and Ange’s divorce has finally been settled, Vanity Fair are wondering whether or not Harry and Meghan are even interesting anymore, Zendaya and Tom Holland are engaged, Hugh Jackman and Sutton Foster made their public debut as a couple and… Adrian Portelli’s 50k controversy…
On this episode, Zara recommended In Memorium by Alice Winn. Mich recommended Margot’s Got Money Troubles by Rufi Thorpe.
This episode of Shameless is brought to you by Cerave’s Facial Moisturiser with SPF 50.
Listen to The TikTok Flop from The Daily.
This episode was audio-produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more…
Subscribe to our newsletter Smart, Dumb Stuff: https://tinyurl.com/4yasjphn
Follow us on Instagram: https://tinyurl.com/2mf557ux
Aaaand we’re on TikTok: https://tinyurl.com/2hchchrp
Everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Our review of the Molly-Mae documentary
item.description:
Hello hello! It’s the first Saturday review of 2025!
On today’s show: The Molly-Mae documentary. What were we expecting? Did the doco deliver? We unpack it alllll in this episode.
Big thanks to KX Pilates for making this episode possible. Head to kxpilates.com or download the KX Pilates App to find a class near you. And! You can get $10 off their intro offer with the code KX10OFF, making it $50 for 5 classes.
Your hosts today were Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1), Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Annabelle Lee (@annabe11e1ee).
This episode was audio-produced by Annabelle Lee.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: It... doesn't end
item.description:
Hiiii hi hi! We’re back on board, baby!
Which of course means that on today’s show, it’s time for us to unpack all of those It Ends With Us developments. We’ll be discussing everything from Blake Lively’s sexual assault allegations against Justin Baldoni, to Justin Baldoni’s $400 million countersuit. There’s so much to discuss that we’re going to spend a whole damn episode on it.
This week, Mich and Zara came through with a lotttaaaa book recs! They’re all linked below:
The Wedding People by Alison Espach
Rytual by Chloe Elisabeth Wilson
The Safekeep by Yael van der Wouden
Real Americans by Rachel Khong
This episode was audio-produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Airbnb for making this episode possible. Find a ‘Guest Favourite’ and book your next getaway accommodation right here.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Summer Scandal: Brad, Jen, and Angelina
item.description:
Hi!
We’re back again for another scandal summer special, and this time, we’re reminiscing on the Brangelina story. This is the Jen, Brad, and Ange series. Brad and Angelina? They were the golden couple, then the power couple, and then… it all came crashing down. The fallout? It’s still ongoing, and we’ve got the updates for you.
Big thanks to Betty’s Burgers for making this episode of Shameless possible.
Don’t forget to check out Shameless Media’s new interview show, Inherited, out now on Spotify and Apple Podcasts.
Why We Can’t Quit Brad Pitt by Scaachi Koul in Slate
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated. Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

Big thanks to Betty’s Burgers for making this episode of Shameless possible. 


Don’t forget to check out Shameless Media’s new interview show, Inherited, out now on Spotify and Apple Podcasts. 


Why We Can’t Quit Brad Pitt by Scaachi Koul in Slate


Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: The 2024 SEOYAs
item.description:
It’s the event of the year!!! The 2024 SEOYAs!
As you guys know, the 2024 Shameless End of Year Awards acknowledge the celebrity and pop culture stories that shaped the year. We’ve had a brainstrust of 1000 Shameless listeners vote on who they think should win each category, Annabelle has tallied it all up, and today, Mich and Zara will recap the top stories and award our winners for the year.
Big thanks to Four Pillars for making the 2024 SEOYAs possible. Four Pillars Rare Dry Gin is simply the best and it’s proudly made right here in Australia. Head here to check it out.
This episode was audio-produced by Annabelle Lee.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: Do words of the year even mean anything?
item.description:
Hey!
On today’s show: ‘brain rot’, ‘enshittification’, ‘polarisation’, ‘demure’, ‘manifest’ - what do all these words have in common? Well, they’ve each been tapped as candidates for 2024’s Word of the Year. These are the words that, allegedly, encapsulate the vibe and cultural mood of 2024. But do these words actually… mean anything?
This week, Zara recommended The Gentleman From Peru by Andre Aciman. Mich recommended ‘How Does My Divorce Make You Feel?’ in The Cut.
Big thanks to the 2025 Australian Open for making this episode possible. The Ground Pass is a good shout – you can wander the Garden Square eateries by day, or even head in for drinks after work. Purchase your AO25 Ground Pass from just $35 by visiting Ticketmaster.com.au.
This episode was audio-produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more…
Follow us on Instagram: https://tinyurl.com/2mf557ux
Aaaand we’re on TikTok: https://tinyurl.com/2hchchrp
Everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: A recommendation extravaganza!
item.description:
Why hello! It’s time for our December review episode, so we decided to throw a 2024 recommendation EXTRAVAGANZA! This is the ultimate list of TV shows, films, podcasts, books and… recipes?... that we loved this year, all in one place. There’s more than enough brilliant stuff here to see you through the entire festive season!
Big thanks to Drop of Sunshine for making this episode possible. Drop of Sunshine is a brand-new wine created to encourage more meaningful connections through the sharing of stories.
Your hosts today were Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1), Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Eilish Gilligan (@eilishgilligan).
All recommendations from each host are listed below.
MICH Boy Swallows Universe on Netflix ‘I felt myself split into before and after’: how giving birth triggered a life-changing illness by Lauren Bensted in The Guardian Mr Big | Unravel from ABC Listen Tomato Soup recipe from NYT Cooking Personal colour analysis
ZARA Borgen on Netflix Rivals on Disney+ All Fours by Miranda July Long Island Compromise by Taffy Brodesser-Akner Blue Sisters by Coco Mellors The Bee Sting by Paul Murray The Complicated Sisterhood of Jackie Kennedy and Lee Radziwill by Sam Kashner in Vanity Fair
EILISH Agatha All Along on Disney+ My Brother’s Ashes Are In A Sandwich Bag by Michelle Brasier Say Nothing by Patrick Radden Keefe Eric Adams from If Books Could Kill Short n Sweet by Sabrina Carpenter BRAT by Charli xcx Unreal Unearth: Unending by Hozier Eric on Netflix
This episode was audio-produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated. Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Deeping it for 53 minutes
item.description:
Hello hello!
On today’s show: Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco are engaged and eating Taco Bell, fashion it girl Matilda Djerf has been accused of being a bad boss, Harry and Meghan’s creative projects can’t stop flopping, Sydney Sweeney responds to the losers of the internet, and are you on the Cruise coconut cake list?
This week, Zara recommended reading ‘Always Go To The Funeral’ in NPR.
This episode was audio-produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Drop of Sunshine for making this episode possible. Drop of Sunshine provides so many foolproof options for the girlies! Grab a bottle at Dan Murphy’s and remember to drink wise.

item.title: The friends we keep...
item.description:
Hey there!
Today on the show: as more and more allegations against Diddy come to light, it appears that his powerful friends are not immune either. Jay Z, a longtime friend of Diddy’s, has just been accused of rape; and whether or not he’s guilty, it doesn’t change the fact that he’s been friends with Diddy for decades. So we want to know: how much can you judge a person’s character based on the friends they keep?
This episode of Shameless is brought to you by SIX The Musical, which is heading back to Sydney!
On today’s show, Mich recommended Paris Hilton & Nicole Richie: Queens of the 2000s from Call Her Daddy. You can also listen to The Daily’s interview with Alex Cooper here.
You can read “Get in loser, we’re cancelling the assassin for thinking The Anxious Generation was good” from Smart, Dumb Stuff here. While you’re there, you can also subscribe to Smart, Dumb Stuff. ;)
This episode was audio-produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more…
Follow us on Instagram: https://tinyurl.com/2mf557ux
Aaaand we’re on TikTok: https://tinyurl.com/2hchchrp
Everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Baby, it's all one big amoeba
item.description:
Hiiiii hi hi!
On today’s show: The Barry Keoghan, Sabrina Carpenter breakup turns into quite the circus, Jay-Z has been named in a sexual assault lawsuit alongside Diddy, the Eras Tour is over, we need to talk about the astounding career of K-Pop idol Rosé, and then… Hailey Welch needs to Talk Tuah a lawyer. Haha!
This week, Mich recommended ‘The Isolated, Increasingly Radical CEO Murder Suspect’ in New York Magazine’s The Intelligencer and ‘The Internet’s Obsession With Luigi Mangione Signals a Major Shift’ in WIRED. Zara recommended Heidi Gardner on the podcast Not Skinny but Not Fat.
Big thanks to Betty’s Burgers for making this episode possible. Sign up to Betty’s Beach Club Rewards, spend $30 and get a free Betty’s Classic. Even better, if you download the app and spend $30, you’ll not only rack up Betty’s Dollars, but you’ll also get a free Betty’s Classic burger until Dec 24th!
This episode was audio-produced by Annabelle Lee.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: The "sad, beige" influencer lawsuit
item.description:
Well hello!
Today on the show, we’re discussing the "sad, beige" influencer rivalry that has now escalated into a full-blown lawsuit. Can the legal system protect the ‘vibe’ of a creator? Even if that vibe is… kinda basic? And later, we’re talking about whether or not being an influencer is hard work. Again!
This episode of Shameless is brought to you by Elite Eleven, your one-stop shop for all your last-minute Christmas shopping. We also want to thank SIX The Musical, which is heading back to Sydney!
This episode was audio-produced by Eilish Gilligan.

item.title: Bonsoir! Here we are!
item.description:
Hello hello!
On today’s show: after their infamous diss track battle, Drake is suing Kendrick Lamar’s record label… which just so happens to be his own record label. Why did Billboard issue an apology to Taylor Swift?, we give a crash course on the Nepo Baby Ball in Paris, a very important timeline on the reported fallout between Hillary Duff and her sister, and then! We play Slow News Week.
This week, Zara recommended watching Borgen on Netflix. Mich recommended reading ‘An I.V.F. Mix-Up, a Shocking Discovery and an Unbearable Choice’ in The New York Times.
Big thanks to Mejuri’s Holiday Gift Shop for making this episode possible. If you’re looking for last-minute gifts or party season pieces, check out Mejuri! Make sure to order right here by December 16 to get your gifts in time for the holidays.
This episode was audio-produced by Annabelle Lee, Michelle Andrews and Zara McDonald.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: What does a 30-something look like?
item.description:
Hello hello!
On today’s show: we want to talk about a new op-ed that’s just been published on The Cut titled 'What Should a 30-Something Look Like?' Because between all the Botox injections, and the TikTok For You Page, it kind of feels like we’ve lost touch with how we’re supposed to look once we hit thirty. And it’s not just women who feel this way, either!
This episode of Shameless is brought to you by the NEW CeraVe AM Facial Moisturising Lotion with SPF50.
This episode was audio-produced by Eilish Gilligan.
On today’s show, Zara recommended Kiera Knightley: ‘Turning 40? It looks rather great’ from The Times.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: A TOTALLY FLAWLESS ROMCOM
item.description:
Helloooo, everyone!
On today’s show: Hailey Bieber decided to get… messy? We explain why so many are holding space for the lyrics of Defying Gravity, Elle Macpherson explains why she and her husband split, Ana de Armas’s boyfriend is controversial, and then, we watched the Tayvis romcom so you don't have to… but actually, you should.
This week, Mich recommended this Mac and Cheese recipe from RecipeTinEats.
To watch TikTok creator @hellotefi’s full video on Ana de Armas, head here.

item.title: Talking About Talking Talk Tuah
item.description:
Hi hi hi!
On today’s show: John Krasinski was crowned People Magazine’s Sexiest Man Alive and the public has complaints. Molly Mae Hague sat down with British VOGUE to talk about her breakup, the celebrity boxing match of the year was a flop, Mark Zuckerberg has recorded a rap/love song and we’re going to unpack it, and the Snapchat renaissance is here.
This week, Mich recommended Cher is Cher from Celebrity Memoir Book Club. Zara recommended Nicole Kidman Still Feels It All from GQ.

item.title: Ariana, Ethan and the three steps to PR recovery
item.description:
Hiiii, everyone!
On the show: Just over a year ago, the world found out about Ariana Grande and Ethan Slater’s new relationship, and fans were… outraged. It was a PR nightmare that threatened to take the Wicked movie down with it, a la Don’t Worry Darling. But now, one year on… and days ahead of the film’s premiere… have they done the impossible and turned it all around? Plus! Speaking of controversial relationships, we have an update on those Hugh Jackman and Sutton Foster headlines…
This week, Zara recommended watching Press on Amazon Prime!
Big thanks to Australia Post for making this episode possible. The AusPost app automatically adds all of your deliveries to your account, so you can track it all in one place. And with 2-hour delivery notifications you can stay on top of it all! Get on it and download the AusPost app today.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: Rejecting $12 million
item.description:
Hello hello!
On today’s show: Brianna Lapaglia accuses Zach Bryan of emotional abuse and says she rejected his team’s offer of $12 million to keep quiet. Plus, the celeb lookalike contests are out of control, the Grammys noms are out and there are a few key snubs, Paul Mescal doesn’t want to become too famous, and meet the billionaire who just bought The Block.
This week, Mich recommended Heston Blumenthal: ‘I was manic. My wife put me in hospital’ in the Sunday Times. And also! Her new favourite free-to-air show: Deal or No Deal.
Big thanks to Hubbl for making this episode possible. Right now, you can get 50% off Hubbl Hub to celebrate Black Friday! This offer lasts until the 8th of December so now is the perfect time there’s no better time to upgrade your Smart TV.
And thank you to Four Pillars for supporting this episode of Shameless! This summer, enjoy a Four Pillars G&T, with orange. And remember to drink wise.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: The true crime conundrum
item.description:
Hello!
Today on the show, Anna Kendrick told the world that she’s donating the profits from her new film, Woman of the Hour, to charity. Which got us thinking: true crime content has never been more popular, but how ethical is it, really? Oh, and Mich tells us all about Dave Portnoy’s Zach Bryan diss track.
This episode of Shameless is brought to you by Airbnb.
On today’s show, Zara recommended All Those A-List Celebs Couldn’t Save Harris, But Joe Rogan Helped Trump from The Hollywood Reporter.
And here’s Anna Kendrick on Armchair Expert.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more…
Subscribe to our newsletter Smart, Dumb Stuff: https://tinyurl.com/4yasjphn

Aaaand we’re on TikTok: https://tinyurl.com/2hchchrp

Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Red flag hunters
item.description:
Why helloooo, everyone!
On today’s show: Channing Tatum and Zoë Kravitz called off their engagement on the heels of their PR tour. Cynthia Erivo says she should’ve called her friends instead, the public voted for the world’s sexiest musician and in doing so, failed the culture, Olivia Rodrigo’s tip for finding red flags, and can you name the biggest musician in the world right now? We chart his curious rise back to the top.
This week, Zara recommended listening to Rivals: The Official Podcast by Wondery. Mich recommended The Ad Campaign by The Daily.
This episode was audio produced by Eilish Gilligan and Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to CeraVe and their new AM Facial Moisturising Lotion with SPF50 for making this episode possible. Grab CeraVe’s AM Facial Moisturising Lotion with SPF50, exclusively at Chemist Warehouse.
(Now, for the legal stuff! Always read the label and follow the directions for use. Apply 20 minutes before sun exposure, and reapply every 2 hours and after swimming, towelling, or perspiring in accordance with the directions. Remember, sunscreen is only one part of sun protection, always wear protective clothing, seek shade and avoid prolonged sun exposure.)
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: We read Jackie O's memoir
item.description:
Well hi!
Today on the show: infamous radio host Jackie O has just released her memoir, The Whole Truth, and of course we read it as quickly as we could. In this book, Jackie O discusses her struggle with addiction, her relationships and divorces, money, and the ups and downs of The Kyle and Jackie O Show, which has been dominating Australian airwaves for decades.
This episode of Shameless is brought to you by Hubbl, the instant upgrade to your smart TV.
On today’s show, Mich recommended ‘Chris Martin: the rock god who thrives in the face of critical sneers’ from The Guardian. Zara recommended Rivals on Disney+.
This episode was audio-produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more…
Subscribe to our newsletter Smart, Dumb Stuff: https://tinyurl.com/4yasjphn
Follow us on Instagram: https://tinyurl.com/2mf557ux
Aaaand we’re on TikTok: https://tinyurl.com/2hchchrp
Everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Bringing OnlyFans to O-Week
item.description:
Hi hi! Today on the show, everyone in the Shameless Media office is talking about Bonnie Blue, the controversial OnlyFans creator and social media influencer with a… erm… unique approach to her work. This unique approach definitely sets her apart… but is it ethical?
And later, The Hollywood Reporter just published its 2024 Creator A-List, and when it comes to social media, anyone who’s anyone is on that list. But in 2024, what makes an influencer truly influential?
This episode of Shameless is brought to you by the new CeraVe AM Facial Moisturising Lotion with SPF50, now available at Chemist Warehouse.
Your Shameless hosts are Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1). This episode was researched and audio-produced by Eilish Gilligan.
On today’s show, Mich recommended Katie Price on The Louis Theroux Podcast. Zara recommended Spotify’s DJ X feature.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.description:

item.title: The death of Liam Payne
item.description:
Hello!
On today’s show: former One Direction star Liam Payne has died, so how do we make sense of his death as both a beloved teen idol as well as a man accused of inflicting pain on women? And then, the Victoria’s Secret fashion show is back! So what did we make of the spectacle?
This week, Zara recommended Sunday Sports Club with Alison Kuch. Mich recommended Mr Big from ABC Podcasts: new Unravelled series.
This episode was audio produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Big thanks to frank green, Australia’s most loved reusable brand, for making this episode possible.

item.title: Shoutout to our HABs
item.description:
Hey, everyone!
On today’s show: The highlights from Tommy Fury’s new memoir! We have lots to share! Plus, JoJo Siwa puts a bizarre Beyonce conspiracy theory on the mainstream map, is anyone else on the Aspyn Ovard algorithm right now? Did Nicole Kidman and Salma Hayak have a feud at a fashion show, Andrew Garfield’s ex tells us precisely why they split, and then! We play Are You Smarter Than A Clickbaiter.
Big thanks to Yoplait protein-packed yoghurt for making this episode possible. Start your morning right, try Yoplait Protein today, and let the deliciousness do the rest! Available only at Woolies.

item.title: Sabrina Carpenter and how to nail a year
item.description:
Hiiii!
On today’s show: we chart the rise of Sabrina Carpenter’s insane year – has anyone had a better, more perfectly curated, rise to the top than she has? Then, Billie Eilish and FINNEAS gave an interview to Spotify, and we want to unpack the quotes.
This week, Zara recommended The Fin podcast: Succession parts one and two. Mich recommended watching James Acaster’s cold lasagne hate myself 1999.
Big thanks to Elite Eleven’s new Spring/Summer collection for making this episode possible. Shameless listeners can get a cheeky 10% off the new collection when they use the code ‘SHAMELESS10’ at the checkout. There’s no better time to find your next favourite piece on the app, in-store, or online at eliteelevensporting.com.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
This episode was audio produced by Michelle Andrews, Zara McDonald and Annabelle Lee.
Want more? We've got more... Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Remember When... Gossip Girl was it?
item.description:
Happy Saturday, everybody!
Welcome to the final episode of REMEMBER WHEN, where we analyse the most intriguing celebrity stories to ever come out of New York City.
Today, we’re retracing the (Met) steps of a classic: Gossip Girl. The heart of this show lives in New York City, so we thought we’d pay our respects to the most iconic NYC locations as seen in the show, while giving you the goss on what went down behind the scenes.
Big thanks to ING for making this episode possible. Travel and save with an ING Orange Everyday card - search ‘ING Orange Everyday’ before your next trip.
This episode was researched and audio produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Our review of Olivia Rodrigo's Guts Tour
item.description:
Hi! Happy Saturday!
Welcome to our October review episode!!!! If you’ve missed the news, we run a monthly series here in the Shameless feed: reviews of the zeitgeist moments that everyone’s talking about. This month, we went to Olivia Rodrigo’s Guts Tour, and we are soooo so excited to review the whole experience for you today.
Big thanks to Drop of Sunshine for making this episode possible. To pick up a bottle of Drop of Sunshine, head into your local Dan Murphy’s and always remember to drink wise.
Your hosts today were Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1), Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Annabelle Lee (@annabe11e1ee).
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Just a few movie buffs
item.description:
Hello hello!
On today’s show: Kanye West’s marriage to Bianca Censori might be over… maybe… Anne Hathaway announces Princess Diaries 3, Diddy’s legal headaches just got substantially worse, Kamala Harris goes on Call Her Daddy, how Dakota Fanning survived child stardom, more cookie chat, and then! It’s Zara’s turn to play Slow News Week.
Head here to listen to Annabelle’s episode of Inherited.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Four Pillars Gin for making this episode possible. This summer, enjoy a Four Pillars G&T by heading right here, and don’t forget the orange! Always remember to drink wise.

item.title: The most famous gyno in the world
item.description:
Hiyaaaa!
On today’s show: How do we feel about the most famous gynaecologist in the world being profiled by The Cut? Conflicted, I think! And then, Mich has a kind of My Two Cents that she’s been sitting with for a little while now with all of this in mind… how do we feel about celebrities and their flippant comments about surrogacy? But first, Zara, what are you recommending this week?

item.title: Remember When... we went to Late Night?
item.description:
Helloooooo! Happy Saturday!!!!!
Welcome to the third episode of REMEMBER WHEN. This episode is going to be a little different to our last couple of New York eps.
Basically, when we decided to go to NY, we knew we had to get in the audience for a late night talk show. Or, you know, any American talk show. Day or night. And we wanted to take you along for the journey!
Big thanks to Maybelline New York for making this episode possible. To celebrate Australia’s #1 makeup brand, Priceline is taking 50% off the entire Maybelline range but only until the 9th of October, while stocks last. Head here to purchase!
This episode was researched and audio produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Oftentimes, it's useless chat
item.description:
Hello hello!
On today’s show: it turns out Nobody Wants This was the Netflix romcom that, actually, everybody very much wanted. Plus, Lana Del Ray married alligator tour guide Jeremy Dufrene, Chappell Roan cancels more shows, Shawn Mendes says he and Camila Cabello still exist in a private little fire of love, Jeremy Allen White is papped kissing again and then, obviously, we need to talk about Crumbl Sydney.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.

item.title: Are you cool enough for the new Sally Rooney novel?
item.description:
Welcome to our brand new Monday episodes!
Coming up on today’s show: Are you cool enough for the new Sally Rooney novel? Are we cool enough for it? Is anyone? Advance copies of Sally Rooney’s new novel Intermezzo have become a surprise status symbol, and we want to know - what would Sally, someone who famously eschews fame, think about it all?
And then: the column that made us think and feel a lot about womanhood, and writing, and mining your personal life for content.
This episode of Shameless was brought to you by Libra. Libra understands the full reality of your experiences and designs solutions with their real needs in mind.
Read 'Are You Cool Enough For The New Sally Rooney Novel?" from Esquire here. Subscribe to Bri Lee's Substack here.
This week, Zara recommended a talk with suki waterhouse. Mich recommended How Telegram Became The Underworld's Favourite App.
This episode was audio produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more...
Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Remember When... JFK Jr and Carolyn Bessette were papped?
item.description:
Hi! Happy Saturday!
Welcome to the second episode of REMEMBER WHEN, where we analyse the most intriguing celebrity stories to ever come out of New York City.
Today, we’re discussing John F Kennedy Junior, his wife Carolyn Bessette, and the explosive argument they had in NYC’s Battery Park. In broad daylight, mind you.
Big thanks to ING for making this episode possible. Travel and save with an ING Orange Everyday card - search ‘ING Orange Everyday’ before your next trip.
This episode was researched and audio produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: The interview that shouldn't have happened
item.description:
Hi hi hiiii!
On today’s show: the viral and highly controversial Hayden Panettiere interview that fans say should be pulled from the internet. Then, Charlie Puth makes quite the chic groom, Ashton Kutcher’s old quotes about P Diddy’s parties resurface, Olivia Munn and John Mulaney’s surprise baby, Anna Delvey’s dancing in an ankle bracelet, and then we play clickbait of the week.
This week, Mich recommended watching The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives on Disney+, and then reading ‘A Fashion Psychoanalysis of 'The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives'’ in PAPER Magazine. Zara recommended ‘Why You Can’t Get a Restaurant Reservation’ in the New Yorker.
Big thanks to FRANKIE4 for making this episode possible. FRANKIE4 is giving Shameless listeners 20% off the ‘Eternal Summer’ collection. Simply use the code ‘F4_SHAMELESS20’ at the checkout on frankie4.com or at one of their nine retail stores across Australia, until the 13th of October. Conditions apply, so visit frankie4.com for details.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee, Zara McDonald and Michelle Andrews.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Remember When... Diana went to lunch?
item.description:
Why hello! It’s us, in your feeds on a Saturday!
We are so excited to bring you this very special series REMEMBER WHEN, where we analyse the most intriguing celebrity stories to ever come out of New York City.
“Monday, June 23, 1997. The Four Seasons, East Fifty-second Street, between Lexington and Park. At the invitation of Anna Wintour, the editor of Vogue, lunch with the Princess of Wales.”
That is how editor, author and royals expert Tina Brown opened her profile on Princess Diana for The New Yorker, and today, we’re looking back on this fateful lunch - we’re even going to take you right to the exact location it took place.
Big thanks to Maybelline New York for making this episode possible. To celebrate Australia’s #1 makeup brand, Chemist Warehouse is taking 50% off the entire Maybelline range until the 29th of September, while stocks last.
This episode was researched and audio produced by Eilish Gilligan.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Won't somebody think of the children?
item.description:
Hello, everybody!
On today’s show: well we’re in New YAWK, so let’s talk about it! Then, we need to unpack the New Yorker’s think piece on “the desperation of the Instagram photo dump.” Plus, Dave Grohl’s had a baby with someone who… isn’t his wife… Barry Keoghan gives some clunky quotes about his son, JLo and Ben Affleck reportedly kissed at a restaurant, Diddy is officially coming undone, and welcome to Mich’s algorithm.
This week, Zara recommended ‘Born Into Fame, This Actress Could Soon Have More of Her Own’ in the New York Times. Mich recommended Kate Lindsay’s latest Embedded column, ‘Yes, the internet is getting meaner’.
Big thanks to Aperol for making this episode possible. To grab tickets to Shameless Trivia, keep an eye out for our socials! And for those who can't make it, don't worry because Aperol is still shouting everyone an Aperol Spritz. All you have to do is order an Aperol Spritz anywhere in Australia and upload a valid receipt using the MYY APP to get up to $21 digital cashback. Head here for more information and always remember to drink wise.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee, Zara McDonald and Michelle Andrews.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: The Belle Gibson story: Part two
item.description:
Hiiii!
Welcome to the second part of our series tracking Belle Gibson. In part one, she had just launched her app The Whole Pantry, and it was going extremely well for her. She was telling people that she was a 23-year-old mum with terminal brain cancer. And then, it all unfolded.
Just a content note before you listen: this series might be difficult listening to those with cancer, or those with loved ones who have cancer.
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and Chloe Wilson, and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Yoplait Protein for making this episode possible – protein-packed yoghurt that is creamy, fruity, and helps you stay fuller for longer compared to a low-protein food.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more… Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

item.content:encoded:
Hiiii!


Welcome to the second part of our series tracking Belle Gibson. In part one, she had just launched her app The Whole Pantry, and it was going extremely well for her. She was telling people that she was a 23-year-old mum with terminal brain cancer. And then, it all unfolded.


Just a content note before you listen: this series might be difficult listening to those with cancer, or those with loved ones who have cancer.


This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and Chloe Wilson, and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.

On today’s show: what do we make of those headlines about Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift having a relationship contract? item.title: Roboto (with an American accent)
item.description:
G’day!!!!
On today’s show: Literally, so much. Chappell Roan hits the headlines again – so is it a case of fair critique, or an instance of tall poppy syndrome? Elle Macpherson’s new interview is giving us flashbacks to 2014, Lana Del Rey may or may not be in love with an alligator tour guide, Olivia Rodrigo and Louis Partridge are the new Gen Z obsession, is Selena Gomez engaged, and then!!! We play slow news week… despite it really not being a slow news week at all.
This week, Mich recommended The “Ketamine Queen” and Matthew Perry’s Hollywood in Vanity Fair, as well as this piece in The Wall Street Journal. Zara recommended watching the Oasis doco called Supersonic, as well as listening to the podcast, The Rest is Politics.
As we mentioned in this episode, you should subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Aperol for making this episode possible. Spritzes are so back and we’re excited to announce that the first round is on Aperol. For more information on how to redeem your free Aperol Spritz, visit www.spritzonus.com.au and always remember to drink wise.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Katy Perry's confusing career: Part three
item.description:
Hi hiiiiii!
It’s the third and final part of our series on Katy Perry. We’re kicking off this last episode by zooming in on the beginning of 2015. Katy was about 31 years old at this point, she was single, and she was right in the middle of the Prismatic world tour.
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and Chloe Wilson, and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to OnePass for making this episode possible. All you have to do is head here, fill out a quick form and grab that $20 membership. This is a limited-time offer, so make sure to get in quick.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: Let's ride
item.description:
Hiiiii!
On today’s show: Sabrina Carpenter’s new album, Short n' Sweet, is here – and what are those whispers about her love triangle with Shawn Mendes and Camilla Cabello? Then! Hailey and Justin Bieber’s baby is here, and he has a normie name. Martin Short and Meryl Streep hold hands on the red carpet, the blonde woman connected to Tommy Fury has spoken, Lily Allen cops the fury of the internet for her quotes about her puppy, and then! Introducing ‘Welcome to our Algorithm’.
To read that column on Lily Allen, written by Frank, head here.
This week, Mich recommended tbh Skincare’s pimple patches. Zara recommended Evenings and Weekends by Oisin McKenna.
Big thanks to Airbnb for making this episode possible. Head here to book your next relaxing trip.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: She deserves a better man! Or no man at all!
item.description:
Hello hello!!!!
On today’s show: Molly Mae Hague and Tommy Fury’s split, and the curious report from one tabloid that might just give insight into what went wrong. Then! Are Sabrina Carpenter and Barry Keoghan over, there’s an update to the claims that Taylor Swift is “blocking” other artists from the charts, Chappel Roan slams fans for their entitlement, Doja Cat just snagged her long-time internet crush, and then! We play Slow News Week.
This week, Zara had two recommendations! Stormzy’s Day In The Life TikTok, as well as ‘Will Your Friendship Pass the Bridesmaid Test?’ from The Cut. Mich recommended watching Fake on Paramount+.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Thank you so much to AFLW for making this episode possible. The 2024 NAB AFLW Season is starting on Friday, August 30 and we can’t wait to see you at the W! Head here to grab your tickets now.
Also, a shout-out to Strand! Head to Strand online or in-store to shop the NERE Bondi Range today, and enjoy up to 40% off.

item.title: Our review of the It Ends With Us movie
item.description:
Why hello! Happy Saturday!!!
Welcome to the first episode of a monthly series we’ll be running here in the Shameless feed: reviews of the zeitgeist moments that everyone’s talking about.
On today’s show: we saw It Ends With Us. Given this is the film adaptation of the book that’s sold over 8 million copies, gained 1 billion BookTok tags, and spawned about a trillion opinions… what better place to start than right here? If you want background on the drama between the actors, listen to our last episode. Here, we’re reviewing the film itself! So, we’ll only be chatting about Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni in the context of them being actors.
Big thanks to SIX the Musical for making this episode possible. Don’t miss out - get your tickets right here and experience SIX for yourself. Thank us later!
Your hosts today were Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1), Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Eilish Gilligan (@eilishgilligan).
This episode was audio produced by Eilish Gilligan.

item.title: The ‘It Ends With Us’ mess
item.description:
Heeeeey!
On today’s show: obviously, the ‘It Ends With Us’ feud… it feels like the internet has turned on star actress Blake Lively this week, so let's untangle why that’s the case and what we think is going on. Then! Australia has a new face of breakdancing, Raygun, Taylor Swift cancels three Vienna shows, it turns out Drake and Serena Williams were once a thing, and we hope you’re all keeping things very demure, very mindful, very cutesy.
This week, Zara recommended ​​reading ‘Daisy Edgar-Jones Is the Summer’s Breakout Star. Can She Be the Next Julia Roberts?’ in Variety. Mich recommended Orna Guralnik on Armchair Expert.
To read that article in the ABC that Zara mentioned in today’s episode, head here.
Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. Get your CeraVe cleanser online or at your local Chemist Warehouse and start your journey to healthy-looking skin today.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.
Note: A previous version of this episode made reference to 'White Ribbon Foundation' instead of 'White Ribbon Australia'. This has since been amended.

item.title: 13 Reasons Why
item.description:
Hello!
In October 2015, Netflix purchased a 13-episode series adaptation of 13 Reasons Why, executive-produced by none other than then-24-year-old pop star Selena Gomez. Today, we’re deep-diving how it all played out.
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Ruby Hall.
Big thanks to ING for making this episode possible. With ING’s Orange Everyday and Savings Maximiser, you’re all set. Remember, these steps can help you make bank the ING way. Ready to get started? Just search “ING Make Bank” and you’re on your way. (The legal stuff: This figure is based on customer data between April 2023 to April 2024. The potential benefits of these two products depend on variable factors and eligibility criteria. This is not financial advice and ING recommends you seek independent financial advice. T&Cs apply. ING ABN 24 000 893 292 and AFSL 229823.)

item.title: Chart wars
item.description:
Hellooooo!
On today’s show: Charli XCX and Billie Eilish just released the sexiest song we can remember, and is there any truth to the claims Taylor Swift is trying to block them from the charts? Ballerina Farm’s Hannah Neeleman responds to the internet commentary about her trad wife lifestyle, what the hell is the “fake runner influencer” drama, Cardi B is divorcing Offset and having a third baby, Mich has new thoughts on the relevancy death of The Kardashians, and then! We play Clickbait of the Week.
This week, Mich recommended ‘Living with my husband’s dead wife’ by Amy Paturel in The Cut. Zara recommended Laurence Leamer’s book Capote's Women: The book behind TV's FEUD: CAPOTE VS THE SWANS, as well as Lead Us Not by Abbey Lay.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee, Michelle Andrews and Zara McDonald.
Big thanks to Betty’s Burgers and their NEW Luxe $16 Betty’s Bowls for making this episode possible. If you’re ready for a gourmet dining experience, head to your nearest Betty’s Burgers or download the Betty’s app and try their new Luxe $16 Betty’s Bowls today.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Trisha Paytas, the original troll: Part two
item.description:
Hiiiii!
Welcome to the second and final part of our series on Trisha Paytas. Trisha is a known liar and a troll - and a skilled one at that. She has been involved in countless controversies over the last 17 years. In this series, we’re covering the most important and influential moments in Trisha’s career.
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and Chloe Wilson, and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Elite Eleven for making this episode possible. Head here to get shopping! And don’t forget to use the code ‘SHAMELESS10’ for 10% off your next purchase.

item.title: Misty-eyed and ready to unpack the mess
item.description:
Hiiiii hi hi! We’re back!
On today’s show: A LOT. Starting with Ice Spice and Central Cee’s supposed affair, Margot Robbie’s extremely A-lister pregnancy announcement, Stormzy and Maya Jama are over, what’s the deal with those Cody Ko and Tana Mongeau allegations?, Hailey Bieber’s curious quotes about her family, why the TikTokker behind Ballerina Farm is the fixation of the internet right now, Suki Waterhouse hints her relationship with Bradley Cooper was “dark”, and spare your thoughts for the country singer who revealed… a little more than she planned… on stage.
This week, Zara recommended All Fours by Miranda July and Long Island Compromise by Taffy Brodesser-Akner. Mich recommended Here One Moment by Liane Moriarty.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to the new movie ‘It Ends With Us’ for making this episode possible. Mark your calendars because ‘It Ends with Us’ is in cinemas from August 8th. Head here to book!
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: What put Martha Stewart behind bars? Part two
item.description:
Hello hello!
Welcome to the second and final part of our series on Martha Stewart. We’re far from being a true crime podcast. But… what about… celebrity true crime? Because Martha Stewart went from a billion-dollar brand to life behind bars. So, let’s retrace how it happened.
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and Chloe Wilson, and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Disney+ and FX’s The Bear for making this episode possible. All episodes of FX’s The Bear are streaming now, only on Disney+.

item.title: An excuse to yap forever and ever
item.description:
Hello hello!
On today’s show: the popular TikTok that says if you don’t like your mates’ social posts, you’re a bit of a shit friend. Then, a crash course on the Brooke Schofield and Clinton Kane controversy, are Paul Mescal and Gracie Abrams dating? Emma Roberts has a rebuttal to all the nepo baby critique, and what on earth is the deal with Hawk Tuah girl? Then, we play 'Are You SMARTER Than a Clickbait Headline?'
This week, Zara recommended watching A Family Affair on Netflix. Mich recommended reading ‘The Irresolvable Tragedy of the Karen Read Case’ by Jessica Winter in The New Yorker.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Hairhouse and their incredible Electrical Event for making this episode possible. Flaunt Your Power this July with their biggest Electrical Event of the year. Head to your local Hairhouse store or shop online now.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: The web they weave...
item.description:
Oh hiiii!
On today’s show: Charli XCX and Lorde work it out on the remix, why the world is obsessed with Chappell Roan, Travis Kelce went on stage at the Eras Tour and the internet is yet to recover, and Tom Cruise and Katie Holmes’s daughter Suri has ditched “Cruise” from her surname. Then, Zara comes to the table with a ‘My Two Cents’.
This week, Zara recommended an episode of Fashion People called ‘Condéology’. Mich recommended Gracie Abram’s new album: The Secret of Us.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Xero for making this episode possible. If you want to free up your time to focus on the things you love, head to Xero today.

item.title: Oh, James Corden: Part three
item.description:
Hello, friends!
It’s the third and final part of our series on James Corden. A man who we’ve mentioned on our Thursday episodes so very many times, yet have never quite known how to place. So, how did his reputation become so… muddled? And is the criticism fair?
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and Chloe Wilson, and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Fly Me To The Moon for making this episode possible. Fly Me To The Moon hits cinemas on July 11, so don’t miss it! Watch the trailer here.

item.title: Escaping the “big ex”
item.description:
Helloooo, friends!
On today’s show: Matty Healy’s engaged and it’s all very much Brat inception, Joe Alwyn finally speaks on The Breakup while Miley touches on The Family Estrangement, Kate Middleton makes her soft return to public life and Cody Simpson misses out on the Olympics but so did we all. There is a loooot to cover today.

item.title: Oh, James Corden: Part two
item.description:
Hey hey!
Welcome to episode two of our James Corden series. A man who we’ve mentioned on our Thursday episodes so very many times, yet have never quite known how to place. So, how did his reputation become so… muddled? And is the criticism fair?
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and Chloe Wilson, and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.

item.title: TikTok’s most talked-about husband
item.description:
Hiiii hi hi!
On today’s show: it’s Charli XCX’s moment – and newsflash for the basic girlies: it’s been her moment for a while now. J Lo and Ben Affleck are selling their $91 million home, Sabrina Carpenter casts her boyfriend as her leading man, Lady Gaga clears up that she isn’t pregnant – she’s just down bad crying at the gym, and we play Slow News Week!
This week, Zara recommended Leo Woodall and Nicholas Galitzine's Actors on Actors interview and the TV show Alice and Jack on Binge. Mich recommended How to Rob a Bank on Netflix and this week’s episode of Style-ish called ‘How DISSH went from Pac Fair to the world’.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Elite Eleven for making this episode possible. Download the Elite Eleven app today from the App Store or Google Play to search, browse, add to your wishlist, and check it all out with just a few taps. Remember to use the code ‘SHAMELESS10’ for 10% off!
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: “One more time!” - Boyboss
item.description:
Hello, everyone!
On today’s show: Baz Luhrmann’s streetside interview went gloriously wayward. Jennifer Lopez cancels her summer tour, are Natalie Portman and Paul Mescal dating? Angelina and Brad’s daughter, Shiloh, wants to drop “Pitt” from her surname. Taylor Momsen gets bitten by a bat, and Rupey Murdoch seals the deal with his fifth bride.
This week, Zara recommended reading Piglet by Lottie Hazell. Mich recommended Britney Griner on the podcast, Celebrity Memoir Book Club.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Cashrewards for making this episode possible. Download the Cashrewards app today and use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout to get your $20 bonus.

item.title: Daytime TV that raised us: Dr. Phil
item.description:
Oh hey!
It’s the final episode of our ‘ Daytime TV that raised us’ series, and today, we’re deep-diving Dr. Phil. A man so recognisable we can say his name and you’ll probably hear his voice, his trademark straight-talking advice. He was total ratings gold. He was also, perhaps unsurprisingly, an incredibly complicated character.
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and Chloe Wilson, and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. Hit up their online store or swing by Chemist Warehouse to stock up and keep your skin glowing all winter long.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: The 9-5 is officially in
item.description:
Hiyaaaa!
On today’s show: quite a bit, actually! Molly-Mae Hague’s Ryanair flight has people rather grumpy. Plus, the New York Times has set out to determine just how Taylor Swift measures up to the greatest music icons in history, Billie Eilish calls three-hour concerts “psychotic”, Bad Bunny and Kendall Jenner are back… on? Glenn Powell is leaving Hollywood. And then! There’s more! Zara’s got a ‘My Two Cents’ on working influencers and we play ‘Are You Smarter Than a Clickbait Headline?’.
This week, Zara recommended New Girl and this interview with Anne Twist on Spinning Plates. Mich recommended Severance on Apple TV (specifically episode nine!!!), and also Kate Hudson on Call Her Daddy.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee and Ruby Hall.
Big thanks to Pureology for making this episode possible. You can find it online at Adore Beauty, or in your local Pureology salon.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Daytime TV that raised us: Judge Judy
item.description:
Oh hi, everyone!
She’s the straight-talking judge who was beamed into living rooms every weekday for years. If you’re a 90s kid, Judge Judy was a TV staple. So, what went into creating it? And who is its central star, Judith Scheindlin?
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and Chloe Wilson, and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Elite Eleven and their new Fall/Winter Aura Collection. Use the code ‘SHAMELESS10’ at checkout to receive 10% off your next purchase.

item.title: Well baby you can lose it overnight
item.description:
G’day, everyone!
On today’s show: the Bennifer divorce rumours and what we make of them. Sophie Turner talks to VOGUE about the fallout of her split from Joe Jonas, the ‘It Ends With Us’ trailer is here and it looks… surprisingly good, CCTV footage of Diddy assaulting Cassie is leaked to the media, Harry Styles is probably single again, and Jeremy Clarkson is the hottest man in the UK! Apparently!
This week, Mich recommended Billie Eilish’s latest album, ‘HIT ME HARD AND SOFT’. Zara recommended the podcast AdMission, as well as Bridgerton S3, P1 on Netflix.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Dan’s Daily for making this episode possible. If you’re over 18, head to dansdaily.com.au now to discover the inside word on drinks. And as always, remember to drink responsibly.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Daytime TV that raised us: Jerry Springer
item.description:
Hello, everyone!
Welcome to the first episode of our Scandal series, ‘Daytime TV that raised us’. First up: Jerry Springer. It was one of the trashiest television shows we watched growing up. And the man behind it? Well, he was rather complex. So, what went into creating it?
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and Chloe Wilson, and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. You can easily shop them online or at your nearest Chemist Warehouse store to stock up and keep your skin glowing all winter long.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: She’s wearing a cape
item.description:
Helloooo!
On today’s show: Hailey Bieber is pregnant! And her announcement with Justin Bieber was pretty delightful. What can the TV show of the year - Baby Reindeer - teach us about storytelling and fact vs fiction? Paris Hilton and Nicole Richie are a duo again, what the hell happened on the set of the new Mad Max movie – and what are we to make of Anya Taylor Joy’s quotes? Plus! Meet Clickbait of the Week, a new segment we’re trying on.
As we mentioned at the very top of this episode, if you are looking for ways to donate, head here for the link to CharityWatch - an independent charity watchdog - with options that you can consider.
This week, Zara recommended ‘The Complicated Sisterhood of Jackie Kennedy and Lee Radziwill’ in Vanity Fair. Mich recommended ‘Can I Just Quit Therapy?’ by Melissa Dahl in The Cut.
To read ‘Mad Max: Fury Road: The Oral History of a Modern Action Classic’ in The New York Times, head here.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Australian Red Cross Lifeblood for making this episode possible. All you have to do is search ‘give blood’ and sign up to book a donation with Lifeblood today.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Harry and Meghan: Part three
item.description: Hiiii, friends! Welcome to the third and final part of our series on Harry and Meghan. As far as scandals go, there aren’t many bigger than Harry and Meghan’s dramatic estrangement from the British royal family. So, how did we get here? And who was really at fault for one of the great family fracturings of our time? This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and Chloe Wilson, and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Bridgerton S3, P1 for making this episode possible. This season will be released in two parts, the first part on 16 May, and the second part on 13 June. Only on Netflix! Grab all the Bridgerton fans in your life and mark your calendars. Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated. Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Who's the Big Me?
item.description:
Hello hello!
On today’s show: the Met Gala guest list turned out to be… kind of second-rate, actually? Plus, a comprehensive explainer on what the hell went down between Drake and Kendrick Lamar this week, the influencers are truly influencing when it comes to baby names, two Home and Away stars have taken their on-screen romance off-screen too, Tom Brady’s been roasted and Madonna’s been swamped by… 1.6 million people.
This week, Mich recommended watching Colin from Accounts on Binge. Zara recommended reading Prima Facie by Suzie Miller.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to SIX the Musical for making this episode possible. Save the date for August 2nd, because there’s an exclusive Shameless event happening - ‘A Night with Shameless at SIX’ - and you’re invited. Tickets are live now! Head here to grab some for you and your friends.
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Zara on falling in love with reading
item.description:
Omg hi! Happy Saturday! You might be wondering what this is doing in your podcast feed on the weekend. Well, we've been running quite the beautiful series over on The Shameless Book Club, and this week, the final installment went live. It's called The Tastemakers - interview episodes helmed by our friend Gemma Dimond with local curators of all things, lifestyle, fashion and culture. This particular episode is with a familiar face and voice, one Zara McDonald. Big thanks to Baileys for making this episode possible. If you are over 18 and looking for a treat, head online or instore to your liquor retailer and shop Baileys. To explore a selection of delicious Baileys recipes, head here. (Remember to Drink Responsibly.) This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. In your ears today were host Gemma Dimond (@gemdimond) and guest Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald). Join us in the all the book chat over on our Insta @theshamelessbookclub, our TikTok @theshamelessbookclub, or in The Shameless Book Club Facebook group. Enjoy the content we create? The best way to support us is to click that ‘follow’ button in your favourite podcast app and leave a five star review. Orrr you can go old school and tell a friend to listen! The Shameless Book Club has a room on Apple Books! Check it out here. If you want to make Zara’s favourite Baileys Iced Latte with Biscuit Spread, follow along below!
Add 1 tsp of biscuit spread and a double shot of espresso to a glass.
In a separate glass, add ice and milk of your choice, and 50ml Baileys.
Combine the espresso and biscuit spread together.
Top it off with a little (or a lot) of whipped cream, and sprinkle with biscuit crumbs.
#Drinkresponsibly

Top it off with a little (or a lot) of whipped cream, and sprinkle with biscuit crumbs.
#Drinkresponsibly
item.content:encoded:
Omg hi! Happy Saturday!

You might be wondering what this is doing in your podcast feed on the weekend. Well, we've been running quite the beautiful series over on The Shameless Book Club, and this week, the final installment went live. It's called The Tastemakers - interview episodes helmed by our friend Gemma Dimond with local curators of all things, lifestyle, fashion and culture. This particular episode is with a familiar face and voice, one Zara McDonald.

Big thanks to Baileys for making this episode possible. If you are over 18 and looking for a treat, head online or instore to your liquor retailer and shop Baileys. To explore a selection of delicious Baileys recipes, head here. (Remember to Drink Responsibly.)

This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. 

In your ears today were host Gemma Dimond (@gemdimond) and guest Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald).

Join us in the all the book chat over on our Insta @theshamelessbookclub, our TikTok @theshamelessbookclub, or in The Shameless Book Club Facebook group.

Enjoy the content we create? The best way to support us is to click that ‘follow’ button in your favourite podcast app and leave a five star review. Orrr you can go old school and tell a friend to listen!

The Shameless Book Club has a room on Apple Books! Check it out here. 

If you want to make Zara’s favourite Baileys Iced Latte with Biscuit Spread, follow along below!

  1. Add 1 tsp of biscuit spread and a double shot of espresso to a glass.
  2. In a separate glass, add ice and milk of your choice, and 50ml Baileys.
  3. Combine the espresso and biscuit spread together.
  4. Top it off with a little (or a lot) of whipped cream, and sprinkle with biscuit crumbs.
  5. #Drinkresponsibly

item.title: eeoMeE To millenniAls
item.description:
Helloooo!!
On today’s show: Taylor Swift’s eleventh album, The Tortured Poets Department, is here and boy is it divisive. Hugh Grant has settled his case against The Sun newspaper, Sydney Sweeney responds to those quotes about being ‘not pretty or talented’, is Mark Zuckerberg… hot now? Victoria Beckham’s celebrating her 50th while her husband David is suing his old buddy, Mark Wahlberg. Oh, and then it’s Slow News Week!
This week, Zara recommended ‘3 vintage celebrity interviews I love’ in Books and Bits. Mich recommended watching The Idea of You on Prime Video and Baby Reindeer on Netflix.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Betty’s Burgers for making this episode possible. Head to one of their restaurants or order on the Betty’s App on Thursday 2nd of May to enjoy 2-for-1 burgers with your bestie. Remember, it's only available on 2nd of May!
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast
Thanks for listening! We’re huge fans of you.

item.title: Clara Bow, the original 'It Girl': Part two
item.description:

item.title: Is this Joe? Uh no
item.description:
Hello hello!
On today’s show: Coachella is back, and the predictions of a flop ended up being… dead wrong. Caitlin Jenner says “good riddance” to OJ Simpson, Channing Tatum and Jenna Dewan’s divorce is stillllllll going, Zendaya is courting Oscars buzz, an Aussie is on track to have the most liked TikTok of all time, aaaaand we have a… lukewarm… update to the silly fake news stories thing we told you about last week.
This week, Mich recommended seeing Groundhog Day The Musical and listening to JoJo Siwa's interview on Call Her Daddy. Zara recommended watching After on Netflix.
Big thanks to KX Pilates for making this episode possible. Start your next fitness chapter and purchase the introductory offer via the KX app or head to their website at kxpilates.com.
This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.

item.title: Baroness Fiona Shackleton of Belgravia
item.description: Helloooo, friends! On today’s show: the curious timing of Isla Fisher and Sacha Baron Cohen’s divorce, JoJo Siwa’s rebrand has made everyone mad, Billie Eilish wants you to be her close friend, Andrew Garfield has a hot normie girlfriend, the YouTuber who announced her baby’s arrival on the same day the media learned she’d filed for divorce, and there’s a chance the bizarre news stories you’ve read in the last month are the work of a comedian taking the piss. This week, Zara recommended Scoop on Netflix. Mich recommended an article in The New Yorker called ‘A Woman In Earnest’ written by Tina Brown. This episode was made possible by Dan’s Daily. item.title: Vanessa, Zac and High School Musical mania: Part two
item.description:
Well hello!
To nineties babies, there are few celebrity couples more iconic than Vanessa Hudgens and Zac Efron. To us, they were Troy and Gabriella: total teen dreams. Only, their lives as young celebrities showed how ruthless the tabloid media could be.
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Ruby Hall.
Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible.
