item.title: Herb wars
item.description: Hiiii! On today’s show: Kate Middleton shared her cancer diagnosis, and what is there to learn from all of this? Plus, Euphoria season three might… actually not happen, why the documentary ‘Quiet on Set’ is all over your social media feeds, Rebel Wilson’s memoir is about to be out in the world and all eyes are on Chapter 23 (and Sacha Baron Cohen), and Gwyneth Paltrow has announced a war on dill. This week, Zara recommended the 'Who Trolled Amber' podcast. Mich recommended American Nightmare on Netflix, and Anne Hathaway's Vanity Fair profile. This episode was made possible by the legends at Betty's Burgers. Experience their new limited edition Crispy Chicken Panko Yuzu burger this Easter. item.title: Winona and the CCTV footage
item.description:
Hiiii guys!
Winona Ryder was one of the biggest celebrities in the world - an Academy Award-winning actress who’d risen to the very top of her industry. CCTV footage of her shoplifting from a major department store would send everything crashing down.
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Warner Brothers for making this episode possible. Challengers is the sexy drama that everyone’s talking about and it’s definitely not one you’d want to miss.. It’s about passion, friendship and what happens when your past comes back to challenge you. Challengers is in cinemas from April 18, tickets are available from Tuesday the 26th!
Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.
Want more? We've got more...

Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

Plus, Meghan Markle’s curious timing for her new business launch, Olivia Munn reveals her cancer diagnosis, J Lo’s got a bit of a career headache on her hands, and Kylie Jenner is… getting into the alcohol game? item.title: Halle Berry's hit and run (and the rest of it)
item.description:
Hello, friends!
Halle Berry had ascended to the top of the Hollywood tree. She was on stage at the Oscars, gold trophy in hand, accepting the award for Best Actress. Just 10 days later, her marriage would crumble in front of the world.
This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee.
Big thanks to Pureology for making this episode possible. If you want hydrated, healthy hair, this is a PSA for you! To try Pureology’s Hydrate collection, you can shop it online via Adore Beauty, or in your local Pureology salon.

item.title: Grab your tin foil hats!
item.description: Oh hey, honeys! On today’s show: well well well, if we weren’t Kate Middleton conspiracy theorists last week, we just might be after the developments over the weekend. Also! Our main takeaways from the Oscars, Ariana Grande’s new album sparks speculation that she was cheated on, Natalie Portman has quietly divorced Benjamin Millipied, and cue the wedding bells because Rupert Murdoch is ready to start the second half of his life! Again! This week, Annabelle recommended going to see the musical Wicked and listening to Celine Song and Sofia Coppola on The A24 Podcast. Mich recommended Ira von Fürstenberg’s obituary in The New York Times. Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. Shop CeraVe’s entire Blemish Control range online or in-store now at Chemist Warehouse, Priceline, Terry White, and Adore Beauty. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. item.content:encoded:
Oh hey, honeys!

On today’s show: well well well, if we weren’t Kate Middleton conspiracy theorists last week, we just might be after the developments over the weekend. Also! Our main takeaways from the Oscars, Ariana Grande’s new album sparks speculation that she was cheated on, Natalie Portman has quietly divorced Benjamin Millipied, and cue the wedding bells because Rupert Murdoch is ready to start the second half of his life! Again!

This week, Annabelle recommended going to see the musical Wicked and listening to Celine Song and Sofia Coppola on The A24 Podcast. Mich recommended Ira von Fürstenberg’s obituary in The New York Times.

Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. Shop CeraVe’s entire Blemish Control range online or in-store now at Chemist Warehouse, Priceline, Terry White, and Adore Beauty.

This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee.

Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated.

item.title: Elvis and Priscilla: Part three
item.description: Hi, friends! Welcome to the third and final part of our series on Elvis and Priscilla. You might have seen the movies, because the relationship between Elvis and Priscilla is one of the most fascinating celebrity stories of all time. But the films only tell so much. And the nitty gritty details? Well, they’re just next level. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Uniqlo for making this episode possible. Head in-store or online at uniqlo.com.au to shop Uniqlo’s knitwear collection. Want to support our show? item.title: A busty crustacean
item.description: Hello hello! On today’s show: SO MUCH STUFF. Including the rumours that Miley Cyrus’s mum married her little sister’s ex-boyfriend, why are there thoughts and prayers for Hailey and Justin Bieber?, What the hell is going on with the British royal family? Spice Girl Geri Halliwell’s marriage is in the tabloids for uncomfy reasons, the Guardian’s blistering piece about guru to the stars, Jay Shetty, AND Glasgow’s Willy Wonka Experience has social media in a stranglehold. To read ‘Uncovering the higher truth of Jay Shetty’, head here. This week, Zara recommended Anyone But You. Mich recommended this MECCA MAX lipstick in the shade ‘Mean Girl’. Big thanks to Dan’s Daily for making this episode possible. Head to dansdaily.com.au now to discover the inside word on drinks. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! item.title: Different strokes, different folks
item.description: G’day, everybody! On today’s show: why is traditional homemaking and womanhood a la Nara Smith so popular on TikTok? Olivia Rodrigo launches her Guts World tour, television personality Wendy Williams has been put in the spotlight of a highly controversial four-part documentary series, Zendaya wants to talk about Tom Holland, Aussie Margaret Zhang has been moved on from the top gig at VOGUE China, and did Taylor Swift’s dad punch a pap? Then! It’s Zara’s turn to play slow news week. This week, Zara recommended Acquired’s podcast episode on Hermès. Mich recommended Ambika Mod on Radio 1’s Screen Time. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Mejuri for making this episode possible. The GANNI x Mejuri limited edition collection is available for purchase in North America and Australia now! Head online and get shopping. Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Mich on career, books and trends
item.description: It’s us! Dropping in your podcast feeds on a Saturday! Why? Well, on Thursday we launched a very exciting podcast series over on The Shameless Book Club: it’s called The Tastemakers, and it’s something we’re so excited for you guys to listen to. On The Tastemakers, friend of Shameless Media Gemma Dimond sits down with some of the biggest names in Australia’s fashion, food and media scenes to hear all about how they indulge: how they dress, eat, live and… read. We’ve already dropped episode one with a very familiar face in The Shameless Book Club podcast feed, but we thought, why not give you a little taste, too? So! Here’s episode one of The Tastemakers with Gemma Dimond and Michelle Andrews… Big thanks to Baileys Irish Cream Liqueur for making this episode possible. If you are over 18 and looking for a treat, head online or instore to your liquor retailer and shop Baileys. To explore a selection of delicious Baileys recipes, head here. (Remember to Drink Responsibly.) This episode was audio produced by Chelsea Srinivasan. In your ears today were host Gemma Dimond (@gemdimond) and guest Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1). Join us in the all the book chat over on our Insta, @theshamelessbookclub, and our TikTok, @theshamelessbookclub. Or, if you’re after some variety, here’s a link to record a voice message via our website, too. If you want to make Mich’s favourite drink - Baileys on Ice - grab a short glass, add a few ice cubes and 50ml of Baileys Irish Cream. Enjoy!

item.title: Not our strongest finish, sorry
item.description: Hello hello! On today’s show: it was the week that millions of people around the world fell in love with TikTokker @reesateesa, and for very good reason. Plus! Tom Sandoval’s New York Times profile is… a complete disaster, Dakota Johnson’s new movie has officially reached “so bad it’s good” status, while J Lo’s new film is, well, something we need to unpack together. And! Apparently, Khloe Kardashian has been spending her days Facetuning her cat and we have reason to believe Harry and Meghan’s wedding was… a bit smelly. This week, Zara recommended reading ‘100 Small Acts of Love’ from The New York Times. Mich recommended Crime Scene on This American Life, as well as The Weekly Fifty. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Betty’s Burgers for making this episode possible. Grab your bestie and head to Betty’s Burgers on Thursday, the 29th of February to celebrate the extra day of Summer this year with free extras. Head to their socials to stay updated! Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! Old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated. Want more? We've got more... We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Old ginger bollocks
item.description: G’day, everyone! On today’s show: Allllll things Super Bowl, from the two moments that gave us the ick, to Usher’s halftime show, and the Ben Affleck ad that won us over. Then! Edward Enninful went bang with his final cover of British Vogue, Beyonce’s big announcement, Kim Kardashian’s new boyfriend, and a new development in one of the weirdest stories we covered last year. To watch that Dunkin’ Donuts ad we mentioned in today’s episode, head here. This week, Zara recommended listening to Ben Winston on Awards Chatter, as well as One Day on Netflix. Mich recommended watching Nemesis on ABC. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Dan’s Daily for making this episode possible. Head online to Dan’s Daily today to up your cocktail game, expand your wine knowledge, or discover what’s trending in the world of drinks. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: The Taylor Swift series: Parts 1-3
item.description: Omg it’s us! In your podcast feeds! On a Saturday! Why? Well! You might remember that, at the beginning of 2022, we did a three-part Scandal series exploring how Taylor Swift rose, fell, then rose again. Those three episodes are Shameless Media’s most downloaded episodes of all time. As you’re already very much aware: a LOT has happened in the Taylor Swift omniverse since we released that three-part series. So much that it… completely justifies… a couple more episodes. So! To celebrate Taylor coming to Australia for the Eras Tour this week, we’re taking our most-popular series ever two steps further: to kick everything off we’ve repackaged our three existing episodes into one bumper podcast for you. Have a trip down memory lane with us here, then enjoy Part Four on Monday and Part Five the week after. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Want to support our show? Clicking ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify is the best way to do that, and we're super grateful to anyone who leaves a five-star review while they're at it. Also! An old-fashioned 'Tell a Friend In Real Life' is equally appreciated. Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Totes $120! Mugs $125!
item.description: Hey, fam! On today’s show: Taylor Swift announced her brand new album at the Grammy’s and where does the woman get the time? And then, obviously, we need to talk about expensive mugs and overpriced totes. Plus, Nick Lachey brings back music Mondays (much to my delight!) and Michael Buble is a silly, goofy, very high man. This week, Mich recommended ‘10 things I wish I’d known before deciding not to have kids at 45’ by Farrah Storr. Zara recommended Drunk Elephant’s Tiffany Masterson on How I Built This. Big thanks to Betty’s Burgers for making this episode possible. Their Date Night Sorted Special is such a great offer - especially with Valentine’s Day coming up - and is available all of February exclusively in the Betty’s Burgers App, available to enjoy in restaurant or to takeaway. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee, Michelle Andrews and Zara McDonald. Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Who is Kylie Jenner? Part three
item.description: Happy Monday, fam! Welcome to the third and final part of our series on Kylie Jenner - one of the most famous people in the world. item.description: Hey, friends! On today’s show: untangling what in the world is going on between Nicki Minaj and Megan Thee Stallion is a task, but we’re here to do it. Plus, Sofia Richie Grainge is pregnant, Travis Kelce is in the Super Bowl and all anyone wants to know is if Taylor Swift can get there, and then, our first Slow News Week of 2024. item.title: Cosmic, divine and totally cursed
item.description: Hello hello! On today’s show: Jacob Elordi is IT right now. And those rampant rumours that he’s fresh out of a breakup? Yeah, they were… completely wrong. Kim Kardashian’s office tour was completely unhinged, aaaaand How I Met Your Mother’s Josh Radnor got married and you could say it couldn’t have gone worse. AND THEN. Mich comes to the table with a ‘My Two Cents’: a viral article with the headline “You don’t need to document everything” is doing the rounds this week, and she has thoughts. This week, Mich recommended World of Secrets: The Disciples from the BBC. Zara recommended Greta Gerwig on Desert Island Discs and Cheeky Run Club. Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. Shop CeraVe’s entire range now at Chemist Warehouse nationwide. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Subscribe to our newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff, right here. We'd love your feedback! We wanna know a little bit more about how you engage with us so we can keep creating the content you crave. We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Buckle up, it’s a big one
item.description: We’re baaaaack! On today’s show: everything that happened over the summer break! From Ariana Grande telling us it’s not our business whose dick she rides, to host Jo Koy bombing at the Golden Globes, the Selena Gomez/Taylor Swift gossip session that was watched by the world, the viral trend that suggested Paul Mescal… runs away from his one-night stands, a brand new relationship between star of the moment, Barry Keoghan, and Sabrina Carpenter, convicted killer Gypsy Rose Blanchard becomes social media’s hottest new influencer, and an explainer on the Real Housewives finale that everyone’s been talking about. This week Zara recommended All That’s Left Unsaid by Tracey Lien, ‘How to Discover Your Own Taste’ on the Ezra Klein Show, and Past Lives. Mich recommended The Villa by Rachel Hawkins, Boy Swallows Universe on Netflix, and Emerald Fennell’s interview on Vanity Fair’s podcast, Little Gold Men. Subscribe to our newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff, right here. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Dan’s Daily for making this episode possible. Whether you want to up your cocktail game, expand your wine knowledge, or discover what’s trending in the world of drinks, dansdaily.com.au is the place to go. Want more? We've got more... Subscribe to the Shameless newsletter, Smart Dumb Stuff: http://eepurl.com/iH2sV-/ Aaaand everything else your heart could ever desire is here: https://linktr.ee/shamelesspodcast Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Olivia and Josh and Sabrina
item.description: Hellooo, everybody! It was the teenage love triangle that had the world in a stranglehold – with one song, Olivia Rodrigo had become an international superstar. As she shot for the stars, though, two people were left standing in the dust. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to the Australian Open for making this episode possible. Head to Ticketmaster now to buy your tickets to the Australian Open. Want to support our show? item.title: Breaking the Spice Girls: Part three
item.description: Helloooo! Welcome to the third and final part of our very special Spice Girls series. They’re the biggest girl group in history: five women who changed the face of pop music through the magic of girl power. But the ride to the top was far from smooth. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Betty’s Burgers and their Bestie Beach Resort for making this episode possible. Grab your Bestie and head to Betty’s, you just might win the ultimate summer holiday, in Noosa, the home of Betty’s Burgers. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘subscribe’ on Apple (bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too) or ‘follow’ on Spotify. Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. Subscribe to the weekly ‘ASK SHAMELESS’ newsletter: http://eepurl.com/gFbYLT Join our book club: https://www.instagram.com/theshamelessbookclub/ Check out our website: https://shamelessmediaco.com/ Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: The 2023 SEOYAs
item.description: Welcome to the 2023 Shameless End of Year Awards!!!! As you guys know, the SEOYAs acknowledge the celebrity and pop culture stories that shaped the year. We’ve had a brains trust of 1000 Shameless listeners vote on who they think should win each category. It’s a special episode and a special setup, because this is actually our first-ever full video episode. As we teased last week, we’re in a different studio today – we’re also drinking some cocktails, thanks to our mates at Dan Murphy’s – and we’d love for you to watch along. item.title: The real affair story behind Love Actually
item.description: Hello, everyone! We all know the story of Emma Thompson’s character in Love Actually being cheated on. But do you know the real-life affair story that led to the collapse of her first marriage? This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. Let your skin take centre stage and find your skin type and CeraVe skincare routine on the CeraVe website. item.title: Justin Deruuuloooo
item.description: G’day, friends! On today’s show: Taylor Swift is named TIME’s Person of the Year and takes a shot at Kim Kardashian in the process. There’s a royal photoshop fail in Will and Kate’s family Christmas card, Selena Gomez is in a relationship and letting loose in the comments section, Molly-Mae Hague says she’s “going through it”, and Hugh Grant is kinda grumpy but needs money, okay? This week, Zara recommended watching the Actors on Actors interviews with Variety. They’re all amazing! Mich recommended ‘Revealed: Ben Roberts Smith - Truth on Trial’ on Stan, and ‘How French Is Timothée Chalamet’ in the New York Times. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Meshki for making this episode possible. Don’t forget that you can enjoy 15% off using the code ‘SHAMELESS15’. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Lena Dunham’s mea culpas: Part two
item.description: Hey, everybody! Welcome to the second and final part of our series on Lena Dunham. She has a brilliant mind and a knack for pissing people off. Lena is behind some of our generation’s most celebrated work, but also cringeworthy blunders. How the hell did she get so famous? And what do we make of her now? This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Elite Eleven for making this episode possible. If you want to refresh your wardrobe for summer head to eliteelevensporting.com or download the Elite Eleven app and use the code ‘SHAMELESS10’ for 10 percent off. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Want to support our show? item.title: … Fleabag?
item.description: Why hello, everyone! On today’s show: remember the ‘wedding of the century’ that we spoke about last week? Yeah, well… it turns out the groom could be looking at decades behind bars. Plus! Publicist Tree Paine has taken a big old whack at professional celebrity gossiper DeuxMoi, Billie Eilish has called out Variety for ‘outing her’, and friend of the show Dave Galafassi is BACK!!! Then we’re doing a slow news week! This week, Zara recommended reading ‘How millennials learned to dread motherhood’ in Vox. Mich recommended reading a piece in the ABC called ‘Agatha Christie was the most famous detective novelist in the world. Then she found herself at the centre of a mystery’. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Dan’s Daily for making this episode possible. Head to dansdaily.com.au now to uncover the next big thing in drinks today. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. item.title: Versailles, aquarium, potato potahto!
item.description: Hellooooo, everybody! On today’s show: videos of Tommy Fury partying it up with Chris Brown in Dubai are making us feel… a lot of things. The wedding of the century is here and the TikToks are something else, the main takeaways from Kylie Jenner’s interview with Jennifer Lawrence, Diddy has been accused of sexual assault by two more women, and the British podcast that unwittingly cancelled the impending wedding of a major influencer. This week, Zara recommended reading ‘Happily Ever Divorced’ in The Cut. Mich recommended listening to the audiobook version of Green Dot by Madeleine Gray. Big thanks to MECCA for making this episode possible. Head in-store or online at MECCA.COM now to shop for the most wanted gifts wrapped with love. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. On today’s show: videos of Tommy Fury partying it up with Chris Brown in Dubai are making us feel… a lot of things. The wedding of the century is here and the TikToks are something else, the main takeaways from Kylie Jenner’s interview with Jennifer Lawrence, Diddy has been accused of sexual assault by two more women, and the British podcast that unwittingly cancelled the impending wedding of a major influencer.

item.title: Happy Madison
item.description: G’day, everyone! On today’s show: From the curious marketing campaign behind Anyone But You and The Curse, Suki Waterhouse announced she’s pregnant mid-performance, rapper Cassie accuses Diddy of sexual assault and abuse, reviews of The Crown season six are in and they are… emphatically negative, Travis Kelce has been profiled by the Wall Street Journal, and Kanye West’s Australian wife Bianca Censori might now be his ex. This week, Zara recommended this piece in the New York Times about the recent shut down of the site, Jezebel. Mich recommended the Robbie Williams documentary on Netflix. item.title: Take’n or leavin
item.description: Hello hello! On today’s show: What’s going on with the reports suggesting Prince Frederick has cheated on Australia’s Princess Mary? Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are giving us big romcom energy and we can’t get enough, there’s widespread mourning for Harry Styles’s hair, Mean Girls 2.0 is just around the corner, and Kim Kardashian’s hairdresser files for divorce - literal days after his televised wedding was watched by millions. This week, Zara recommended watching Starstruck on Binge and listening to ‘What Adidas Knew About Kanye’ from The Daily. Mich recommended watching Take Care of Maya on Netflix. The 2023 Shameless Holiday Gift Guide is now live! Head here to check it out. Big thanks to Dan’s Daily for making this episode possible. Head to dansdaily.com.au now to uncover the next big thing in drinks today. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Want to support our show? item.title: The Call Her Daddy breakup: Part two
item.description: Helloooo! Welcome to the second and final part of our Call Her Daddy series. They were two of the biggest names in podcasting. Together, Sofia Franklyn and Alex Cooper built a brand known around the world. But as fame, money, and attention came their way, the friendship that started it all completely crumbled. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Mejuri for making this episode possible. Head to pop up now until the 11th of December to shop your holiday gifts in real life, or to the Mejuri website. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? item.title: Craving a pure, raw electric guitar
item.description: Hello, everyone! On today’s show: 1989 Taylor’s Version is here, but a Harry Styles cameo is not. The world mourns the death of FRIENDS star, Matthew Perry, there are whispers in DeuxMoi that another celebrity divorce is brewing, Kylie Jenner has launched Khy and it’s, well, kind of genius. And then: how the hell did Martin Scorcese become TikTok’s new… it boy? This week, Zara recommended Green Dot by Madeline Gray. Mich recommended listening to Britney’s memoir on audiobook, as well as watching Last Stop Larrimah on Netflix. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Roadshow and their new release ‘The Hunger Games - The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes’ for making this episode possible. ‘The Hunger Games - The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes’ is in cinemas from November 16th, so head to cinemas and experience it on the big screen. item.title: The PFPE
item.description: Hellooooo, everyone! On today’s show: Britney Spears’s memoir is finally out in the world, so what are the key takeaways from one of the most anticipated books of the last year? Plus, Sophia Bush has reportedly moved on with a former soccer star and, well, where do we start with the drama around that story? Then, Rebecca Loos isn’t happy with David Beckham’s documentary and Meryl Streep’s marriage also falls victim to 2023. This week, Mich recommended the docu-series ‘Coleen Rooney: The Real Wagatha Story’ on Disney Plus. Zara recommended reading Demon Copperhead, and also… ham! This Gordon Ramsay recipe is Zara’s go-to. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Pureology for making this episode possible. If you want to try Pureology’s Strength Cure collection, you can shop it online via Adore Beauty, or in your local Pureology salon. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! item.title: The many iterations of Ariana Grande: Part three
item.description: Hello, everybody! Welcome to the third and final part of our series on Ariana Grande. She was the superstar who navigated a terrorist attack and the death of a former partner within 18 months. Ariana Grande had dealt with unimaginable heartbreak. By 2018, she was a bit of a phoenix, rising from the ashes. Only, the story was far from over. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Mejuri for making this episode possible. Head to the pop-up from now until the 15th of November or to the Mejuri website now to purchase your next piece of jewellery. item.title: Hidden nuances, subtle beauties, etc!
item.description: G’day, friends! On today’s show: Well, we simply must talk about Will and Jada and the news that... actually… they’ve not been together since 2016. Plus, the questions we have after Kendall Jenner took a sizeable paycheck from Mark Zuckerberg, why on earth have Sophie Turner and Priyanka Chopra Jonas unfollowed each other, and then, Julia Fox’s very candid memoir. Oh, and you bet we’re bringing back by popular demand SLOW NEWS WEEK, which is a win for podcast segment inventors everywhere. This week, Mich recommended our book club pick for this month, None of This is True by Lisa Jewell, as well as the podcast Big Small Talk. Zara recommended ‘My Delirious Trip to the Heart of Swiftiedom’ from The New York Times Magazine. As you’ll have heard, our new book, 4am, is out in the world this week! You can grab yourself a copy on Booktopia, Amazon, or purchase the audiobook via Audible. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to CeraVe’s Blemish Control range for making this episode possible. You can shop CeraVe’s entire Blemish Control range now at Chemist Warehouse nationwide. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. item.title: The best advice we’ve ever received
item.description: Well well well, what do we have here? This is a very special bonus episode to celebrate the fact that our new book, 4am, is out in the world today. Since 2021, tens of thousands of readers have devoured ASK SHAMELESS’s weekly columns on dating, friendship and self-development, written by Mich and Zara, along with our incredible roster of guest columnists. The book doesn’t just look beautiful, it also features ten brand new columns from Mich and Zara, and is available to read in hardback and audio book. See the links below for where you can shop it! Booktopia: https://www.booktopia.com.au/4am-zara-mcdonald/book/9781761341892.html Amazon: https://www.amazon.com.au/4am-Answers-conundrums-Advice-Shameless/dp/1761341898 Audible: https://www.audible.com.au/pd/4am-Audiobook/B0CD861577 If you enjoyed this episode, you’ll love ShameMore. When you sign up to our subscription offering, you get early access to every episode of Shameless, plus exclusive content each month. Subscribe below! ShameMore on Apple Podcasts: https://podcasts.apple.com/au/podcast/shameless/id1352875216?i=1000630892890 ShameMore on Spotify: https://spotify.link/KQIQQ7vmXDb Thanks so much for your support, we think you’re the best!

item.title: The many iterations of Ariana Grande: Part two
item.description: Hey, everyone! Welcome to part two of our series on Ariana Grande. A gig on Broadway, a Nickelodeon show, and a voice so powerful it was considered once in a generation: Ariana Grande was on the path to superstardom. But 2017 would show the singer just how awful - how heartbreaking - fame can be. For the link to BBC’s tribute to the Manchester attack victims, head here. To donate to Winston’s Wish, head here. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Hayu for making this episode possible. item.title: A wee mea culpa
item.description: Hello, everyone! On today’s show: the Beckham documentary has been released and we have oh so many thoughts, it appears that Gigi Hadid and Bradley Cooper are Hollywood’s newest couple, Emma Chamberlain is single, all of social media is theorising that Andy Cohen and John Mayer are more than friends, Olivia Wilde’s Instagram activity is under the microscope, and then finally: why did TikTok’s It Girl Matilda Djerf deactivate her account this week? Ahead of the referendum this weekend, Zara recommended watching Briggs’s video ‘Far Enough - Vote Yes’. She also recommended ‘Sold Out? Gab Waller Can Help’ in Vanity Fair. Mich recommended Quarterback on Netflix. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Dan’s Daily for making this episode possible. item.title: David and Victoria Beckham: A special from the archives
item.description: SURPRISE! We’re so excited to be bringing you this special, jam-packed episode from the archives. As you've probably noticed, the Beckham documentary has just dropped on Netflix and is going absolutely wild right now. We binged it, and at the end of the docu-series thought: you know what? We did our own three-part series on David and Victoria Beckham's marriage years ago. It's one of our favorite scandal series of all time and has a lot of information about the celebrity side of David and Victoria Beckham that might not have been covered in the documentary series. We have lots of new listeners who may have missed this series back in the day, so to those listeners: this is our David and Victoria Beckham scandal series from a couple of years back. We’ve packed three episodes into one and we hope you enjoy it! This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘subscribe’ on Apple (bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too) or ‘follow’ on Spotify. item.title: Girl summer? Willy nilly winter!
item.description: Hiya, friends! On today’s show: *that* Kim and Kourtney Kardashian phone call and what we make of the speculation that Travis Barker is actually at the heart of it all. Olivia Wilde and Jason Sudeikis quietly bury the hatchet, an episode of Dax Shepard’s podcast attracted some ugly headlines, we need to talk about the rise of the “girl’s girl”, and then, Zara’s got a brand new segment!!! This week, Mich recommended ‘Who Killed Jill Dando?’ on Netflix. Zara recommended this interview with Rhodri Giggs. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to MECCA and the Beauty Loop membership program for making this episode possible. item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Grace Beverley
item.description: Hello, pals! Today we are joined by Youtuber turned entrepreneur Grace Beverley. For the unacquainted, Grace is a force to be reckoned with. Grace blew up when she was studying at Oxford and decided to document her life with vlogs on YouTube. From there, she channeled her incredibly engaged audience into not one, but two, business ventures: a sustainable activewear brand called TALA and a fitness company called Shreddy. In this chat, Grace talks about finding insane levels of success at such a young age, the blessing and curse that comes with social media fame, and shares something she’s actually never talked about before: her ADHD diagnosis. This episode was audio produced by Michelle Andrews and Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Webjet for making this episode possible. If you are looking to book your next holiday, head online to Webjet. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. item.title: The college admissions scandal: Part two
item.description: Hi, everybody! Welcome to the second and final part of our series on the college admissions scandal. Olivia Jade was the ultimate aspirational Gen Z-er: the daughter of an actress and multi-millionaire entrepreneur – and an influencer with millions of followers to her name – she… kind of had it all. That is, until the US Department of Justice came knocking. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Elite Eleven for making this episode possible. If you want to refresh your wardrobe for Spring head to Elite Eleven and use the code ‘SHAMELESS10’ for 10% online or in-store. item.title: Every 1.6... days?
item.description: Hello hello! On today’s show: Sophie Turner sues Joe Jonas and shows him what magnificent PR looks like, Taylor Swift wants you to know who Travis Kelce is, Emma Roberts has been accused of transphobia by a former costar, and we absolutely need to talk about the Netflix romcom that we watched and absolutely adored this week. Zara recommended Imogen Heap’s newsletter article, ‘A Day With Taylor’, and ‘Say It To My Face’ from This American Life. Mich recommended Pandora Sykes’s interview with her friend, ghostwriter Katherine Ormerod. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Frankie4 for making this episode possible. Head online and use the code ‘SHAMELESS20’ for 20% off sitewide from now until the 31st of October. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. Click here to subscribe to ShameMore: http://apple.co/shamelesspod Subscribe to the weekly ‘ASK SHAMELESS’ newsletter: http://eepurl.com/gFbYLT Join our book club: https://www.instagram.com/theshamelessbookclub/ Check out our website: https://shamelessmediaco.com/ Write to the Shameless Mailbag: Email hello@shamelessmediaco.com Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Taylor Swift and Karlie Kloss: a Sentimental Garbage crossover
item.description: Hiya, friends! Today, Mich and Caroline (and producer Annabelle!) turn their attention to something you’ve all been *demanding* from us: a deep dive into Taylor Swift and Karlie Kloss, and what the hell happened to their friendship. You guys know that commentary around Taylor and Karlie has run rampant for years, so while we won’t get too deeply in the weeds of every single internet hole, consider this episode a wide-ranging pop culture exploration… what is the commentary about Taylor and Karlie? What are the three main theories, and why can’t people stop talking about them? And what does their friendship maybe say… about… us? Head here to check out Caroline’s Australia tour dates, and here to pick up a copy of her latest book, ‘The Rachel Incident’. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee and Chelsea Srinivasan. Big thanks to Elite Eleven for making this episode possible. If you want to elevate your activewear head to eliteelevensporting.com or download the Elite Eleven app and shop today. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. item.title: The college admissions scandal: Part one
item.description: Hello hello! Olivia Jade was the ultimate aspirational Gen Z-er: the daughter of an actress and multi-millionaire entrepreneur – and an influencer with millions of followers to her name – she… kind of had it all. That is, until the US Department of Justice came knocking. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Disney+ and the all-new season of The Kardashians for making this episode possible. There will be 10 episodes this season, dropping weekly, so head to Disney+ from the 28th of September to keep up with all the gossip and drama. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘subscribe’ on Apple (bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too) or ‘follow’ on Spotify. Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Tinkerbell’s dad
item.description: G’day, mates! On today’s show: Hugh Jackman and Deborra-Lee Furness’s marriage is over and the world (well, mostly our mothers) is mourning, Russell Brand says the mainstream media is out to get him after he is accused of multiple sexual assaults, and who and what is a Tube Girl? Plus, no - Paul Mescal is not Daisy Edgar Jones’s new boyfriend, Drew Barrymore faces backlash for returning to work and are the men OK? Why do they think about The Roman Empire so much? This week, Zara recommended ‘The Pandemic Skip’ by Katy Schneider in The Cut. Mich recommended ‘The Ozempic Era of Weight Loss’ on The Daily. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Dan Murphy’s Decoded Wine Awards 2023 for making this episode possible. If you want to try one of the award-winning wines, head in-store or online to Dan Murphy’s and shop. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Dolly Alderton
item.description: Why hello, everyone! Today, we are joined by one of the UK’s most prominent authors, Dolly Alderton. Some of you might be thinking, but wait! You guys have already interviewed Dolly! And you’d be right. Back in 2020, in the depths of lockdown, we spoke to Dolly over Zoom about her life and career. But, given how much we adore her, and given how she was so highly requested by you guys, we thought: why not make her the first person to ever return to Shameless In Conversation? But this is an In Conversation episode with a twist: Of course, Mich asked Dolly about what life has been like in the three years since we last spoke, but given she’s the ultimate Agony Aunt (or sister), we also wanted to pick her brain on your big life dilemmas. We did a callout and asked you what you needed Dolly’s advice on, so today, we opened the Shameless Mailbag and put Dolly’s marvelous mind to work. To pre-order Dolly’s new book, Good Material, head here. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Webjet for making this episode possible. Head online to Webjet to book your next getaway. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. Click here to subscribe to ShameMore: http://apple.co/shamelesspod Subscribe to the weekly ‘ASK SHAMELESS’ newsletter: http://eepurl.com/gFbYLT Join our book club: https://www.instagram.com/theshamelessbookclub/ Check out our website: https://shamelessmediaco.com/ Write to the Shameless Mailbag: Email hello@shamelessmediaco.com Thanks for listening! item.title: The drama of Dance Moms: Part two
item.description: Helloooo, friends! Welcome to the second and final part of our series on the drama of Dance Moms. It was the reality TV show that captured the world’s attention: a group of very young girls, their overbearing mothers, and a dance coach so intense, some called her methods abusive. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. You can shop CeraVe’s entire Blemish Control range now at Chemist Warehouse nationwide. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Want to support our show? item.title: Ashton, Mila, and their “role model” Danny
item.description: Hello hello! On today’s show: we have quite a few updates about the Sophie Turner and Joe Jonas divorce. Jimmy Fallon is the latest talk show host to be outed as a terrible boss, the video going viral after the VMAS, and finally: we do a massive deep dive on everything there is to know about Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis asking a judge for leniency after their friend was found guilty of raping two women. This week, Zara recommended The End Credits by Patty Lin. Mich recommended Olivia Rodrigo’s sophomore album, Guts. To read Eric Levitz’s piece in the Intelligencer that we mentioned in today’s episode, head here. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to MECCA for making this episode possible. Head online to MECCA.COM to explore MECCA’s range of fragrances or book a fragrance consultation to find your new favourite scent today. On today’s show: we have quite a few updates about the Sophie Turner and Joe Jonas divorce. item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Steven Bartlett
item.description: Hello! Welcome to the first episode of our very special In Conversation series. Today on the show, we are joined by one of the most recognisable business and media personalities in Britain, Steven Bartlett. In 2014, he co-founded a social media marketing agency called Social Chain, which cemented the then-22-year-old as one of the leaders in the social media marketing world. Three years later, he created his podcast, The Diary of a CEO, which is one of the biggest podcasts in the UK right now. Two years ago, he was announced as the youngest-ever investor of BBC’s Dragon’s Den. All were achieved by the age of 31. In this chat, Steven talks about everything: from being expelled from school and dropping out of uni, his relationship with religion, the reason he never thought he’d end up in such a healthy romantic relationship, what it’s like coming into money, and why he never sets an alarm. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Elite Eleven for making this episode possible. If you want to shop the range head to eliteelevensporting.com or download the Elite Eleven app today. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. item.title: The drama of Dance Moms: Part one
item.description: Heeeyyy, everyone! It was the reality TV show that captured the world’s attention: a group of very young girls, their overbearing mothers, and a dance coach so intense, some called her methods abusive. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to 20th Century Studios ‘A Haunting in Venice’ for making this episode possible. A Haunting in Venice is out on September the 14th so grab your mates and head to the cinemas. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Want to support our show? item.title: It’s celebrity divorce-ageddon
item.description: Hiya, pals! On today’s show: what the hell happened in Joe Jonas and Sophie Turner’s marriage? We unpack the latest celebrity divorce announcement of 2023. Then! Olivia Rodrigo anxiously answers whether her new single is a jab at Taylor Swift, Kylie Jenner and Timothee Chalamet make their public debut as a couple, and we absolutely need to discuss how Justin Bieber’s sartorial choices became the fixation of TikTok this week. This week, Mich recommended Good Material by Dolly Alderton. Annabelle recommended Troye Sivan on Dua Lipa: At Your Service. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee and Michelle Andrews. Big thanks to Dan Murphy’s Decoded Wine Awards 2023 for making this episode possible. If you are interested in trying one of the award-winning wines, head to Dan Murphy’s in-store and online. item.title: The Tiger Woods affairs: Part two
item.description: Hey, everyone! Welcome to the second and final part of our series on Tiger Woods. Tiger Woods was changing the world of sport and earning $80 million a year when the National Enquirer followed him into a car park with mistress Mindy Lawton. He managed to kill that story. But soon, his luck would completely run out. This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Big thanks to Betty’s Burgers for making this episode possible. If you are in the mood for a burger, head to a Betty’s Burgers restaurant today. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘subscribe’ on Apple (bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too) or ‘follow’ on Spotify. item.title: Not the reverse Steven Bradbury
item.description: G’day, everybody! On today’s show: We’ve officially entered the era of the rebrand - from strawberry girl aesthetic to tomato girl fall, so what the hell is going on? It’s official: We single-handedly manifested a Stormzy and Maya Jama reunion, an update on what the hell is up with Scooter Braun, unpacking the viral controversy around *that* Che Diaz profile, and Pete Davidson is single again. This week, Zara had two recommendations: this episode on Oprah from Acquired and The Intern on Netflix. Mich recommended the Skims Fits Everybody Bralette. Big thanks to Swisse for making this episode possible. Check out the Swisse Sleep Range by heading online or to your local retailer. Always read the label and follow the directions for use. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee, Michelle Andrews and Zara McDonald. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! item.title: Scootin' away from Scooter
item.description: Hello hello! On today’s show: three of Scooter Braun’s biggest stars have all reportedly left him within the space of a week, so what the hell is going on? Plus, everything we know about Britney Spears and Sam Asghari’s ugly divorce, Jack Antonoff had a star-studded wedding to Margaret Qualley, people are very, very irritated by Disney’s live-action remake of Snow White and are taking its young star to task, and - finally! - what the hell happened between podcaster Bobbi Althoff and Drake? This week, Mich recommended the Depp v. Heard documentary series on Netflix. Zara recommended the 'Person of the Week' podcast episode with Jack Antonoff. Big thanks to Double for making this episode possible. They have been generous enough to give you guys 15% off your order with the code ‘SHAMELESS’ - head to double.online/shameless to shop. Plus, if you shop through the weekend you can enjoy a total discount of up to 30% off with Double's Afterpay Day Sale, available until the 27th of August. item.title: Gwyneth, Goop, and everything else: Part three
item.description: Happy Monday, everyone! Welcome to the third and final part of our series on Gwyneth Paltrow. By 2008, Gwyneth Paltrow had conquered Hollywood. Her next frontier - her wellness company, goop - would prove more controversial, and indeed successful, than everything before it combined. Big thanks to 20th Century Studios and ‘A Haunting in Venice’ for making this episode possible. To celebrate the release of the film we will be asking our community to share their very own whodunit stories for their chance to win tickets to a private screening here in Melbourne on the 14th of September. Keep your eyes peeled on our socials for a fun game called “Shamelessly Haunted.” This episode was researched by Eilish Gilligan and audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Want to support our show? item.title: Sublime!
item.description: G’day, everyone! On today’s show: Karlie Kloss made a curious appearance in the nosebleeds section of the Eras Tour, adding another chapter to the world’s most cryptic celebrity feud. The team that works at an American magazine has had a headline nightmare, it seems all of TikTok is mourning the death of Anna Paul’s relationship, Aussie label Zimmermann sells for a billion dollars and what the hell do we make of Lil Tay’s supposed “Instagram hacking” scandal? This week, Zara recommended The Sex Lives of College Girls on Binge. Mich recommended The Matildas docuseries on Disney+. And don’t forget to check out our latest Stranger Than Fiction episode, ‘The author who faked her own death’, over on our The Shameless Book Club feed. Big thanks to Mejuri for making this episode possible. Head to the Mejuri website now to purchase your next piece of jewellery. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee, Michelle Andrews and Zara McDonald. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! item.title: Gwyneth, Goop, and everything else: Part two
item.description: Happy Monday, everyone! By her mid-twenties, Gwyneth Paltrow had leveraged her star-studded upbringing into a glittering career; she was winning Oscars, dating world-famous men, and captivating the tabloid media. And, she was about to meet someone who’d change her life: Coldplay’s Chris Martin. Big thanks to KX Pilates for making this episode possible. You can try KX Pilates today for just $12 a class with their intro offer: that’s 5 classes for $60. Visit kxpilates.com or download the KX Pilates App today. item.title: The curse continues
item.description: Hellooo, everyone! On today’s show: Lizzo, Lizzo, Lizzo. The Grammy-award-winning pop star has been accused of some rather dodgy behaviour in a lawsuit from three of her former employees. Then! How did Sophia Bush go from gushing about her husband in June, to filing for divorce in August? Bella Hadid addresses the rumours she’s been in rehab, Natalie Portman is probably single again, and the arts and craft section of TikTok is at war and Mich cannot look away. This week, Zara recommended this piece about gatekeeping in The Cut, and the new Thank God You’re Here. Mich recommended Chrissy and John’s house tour with Architectural Digest, as well as the latest season of The Real Housewives of New York City. For that link to Marty Singer’s profile in Vanity Fair, head here. Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. You can shop the range at Chemist Warehouse, Priceline, Terry White or Adore Beauty, nationwide. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. item.title: Ummm, where do we begin?
item.description: Oh, you bet we’re back. On today’s show: Well, just about everything. While we were gone two celebrity couples filed for divorce and another broke off their engagement, Jonah Hill’s ex-girlfriend leaked his texts and accused him of being a narcissist, childhood best friends Kylie Jenner and Jordyn Woods repaired their four-year rift, Twitter became ‘X’ and gained a new competitor ‘Threads’, Doja Cat offended half a million people, and TikTok’s IT Girl got sprung kissing a teenager. YEP. This week, Zara recommended Homegoing, Between You and Me and Love Marriage. Mich recommended The Guest, The Soulmate and that you see Barbie, of course. Big thanks to the Swisse Sleep Range for making this episode possible. Go the Swisse to sleep! Swap the scrolling for sleeping and while you're at it check out the Swisse Sleep Range. Find out more here. This episode was audio produced by Michelle Andrews, Zara McDonald and Sohani Goonetillake. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! item.content:encoded:
Oh, you bet we’re back. 

On today’s show: Well, just about everything. While we were gone two celebrity couples filed for divorce and another broke off their engagement, Jonah Hill’s ex-girlfriend leaked his texts and accused him of being a narcissist, childhood best friends Kylie Jenner and Jordyn Woods repaired their four-year rift, Twitter became ‘X’ and gained a new competitor ‘Threads’, Doja Cat offended half a million people, and TikTok’s IT Girl got sprung kissing a teenager. YEP.

This week, Zara recommended Homegoing, Between You and Me and Love Marriage. Mich recommended The Guest, The Soulmate and that you see Barbie, of course. 

Big thanks to the Swisse Sleep Range for making this episode possible. Go the Swisse to sleep! Swap the scrolling for sleeping and while you're at it check out the Swisse Sleep Range. Find out more here. 

This episode was audio produced by Michelle Andrews, Zara McDonald and Sohani Goonetillake.

Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) 

Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else.

Click here to subscribe to ShameMore: http://apple.co/shamelesspod

Subscribe to the weekly ‘ASK SHAMELESS’ newsletter: http://eepurl.com/gFbYLT 

Join our book club: https://www.instagram.com/theshamelessbookclub/ 

Check out our website: https://shamelessmediaco.com/

Write to the Shameless Mailbag: Email hello@shamelessmediaco.com

Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Ashton and Demi: Part three

For a time, the tabloids could not stop talking about Demi Moore and Ashton Kutcher’s 15-year age gap. Eventually, though, they were distracted by something much juicier: Ashton’s alleged infidelity. It was the man Demi married next - a boyish, rambunctious prankster named Ashton Kutcher - that would have the whole world talking. Big thanks to Pureology’s Color Fanatic Multi-Tasking Leave-In Spray for making this episode possible. item.title: Chad and Sophia's five-month marriage
item.description: Happy Monday, friends! They were the young and beautiful actors that ruled the mid-noughties on One Tree Hill. But the calamitous end to Sophia Bush and Chad Michael Murray’s marriage would have people asking questions for years to come. For that link to the Mark Schwahn piece in Variety that we mentioned at the top of this episode, head here. Big thanks to Hayu and the brand new season of Below Deck Down Under for making this episode possible. item.title: Everybody has a Taylor ticket story
item.description: Hello hello! On today’s show: The Barbie marketing campaign is well and truly amping up and it’s all we can talk about in the Shameless Media office, why is Blake Lively facing backlash over the release of her new Betty Booze cocktails, what’s going on with all these rumours Kyle Richards and her marriage and then, we unpack the most perfectly timed mailbag: is it OK to not want to sell Taylor Swift tickets to someone you don’t deem a big enough fan? This week, Annabelle recommended watching Swarm on Amazon Prime. Zara recommended listening to the Jonas Brothers on Armchair Expert. Big thanks to Roadshow and the newly released comedy Joyride for making this episode possible. If Joyride has piqued your interest, grab some popcorn and head to your local cinema now. This episode was audio produced by Annabelle Lee. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. item.title: The fight for Sofia Vergara’s embryos: Part two
item.description: G’day, mates! Welcome to the second and final part of our series on Sofia Vergara. Her breakup at the age of 41 went far beyond what we’ve seen for almost any celebrity. You see, Sofia’s ex wanted to have her children, and as the ensuing years would prove, he’d stop at nothing to do it. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Big thanks to Elite Eleven for making this episode possible. Elite Eleven is giving 2 lucky winners $50,000 cash, that’s a total of $100,000! All you need to do is spend $50 in-store, online, or in the app to enter and you’ll be in the running to win. Jump online or head in-store and shop. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘subscribe’ on Apple (bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too) or ‘follow’ on Spotify. item.title: A sushi scandal
item.description:
Update: In an earlier version of this episode, Mich accidentally said “Olivia” instead of Sophia Culpo. That error has been amended.
Hello, legends! On today’s show: Is Jennifer Lawrence’s new movie as problematic as some people are saying it is? Molly-Mae steps down from a role that many found controversial to begin with, how the Glastonbury crowd had Lewis Capaldi’s back and Alix Earle’s soft-launching her new boyfriend has kicked off quite the TikTok controversy. This week, Mich recommended Amelia Dimoldenberg on Louis Theroux’s podcast. Zara recommended ‘Why Sarah Jessica Parker Keeps Playing Carrie Bradshaw’ by Rachel Syme in the New Yorker. Big thanks to MECCA Beauty Loop for making this episode possible. Level 3 and 4 members, head to your nearest MECCA and pick up your Bonus from now until July 12. If you can’t make it to a store in time, you can also get it online with any order over $25! And if you’re not in the Beauty Loop yet, you can sign up right here. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. Molly-Mae steps down from a role that many found controversial to begin with, how the Glastonbury crowd had Lewis Capaldi’s back and Alix Earle’s soft-launching her new boyfriend has kicked off quite the TikTok controversy. This week, Mich recommended Amelia Dimoldenberg on Louis Theroux’s podcast. Zara recommended ‘Why Sarah Jessica Parker Keeps Playing Carrie Bradshaw’ by Rachel Syme in the New Yorker. Big thanks to MECCA Beauty Loop for making this episode possible. Level 3 and 4 members, head to your nearest MECCA and pick up your Bonus from now until July 12. item.title: BOOK CLUB: Really Good, Actually
item.description:
Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/6Na2UkzFL8yHDL3G5BFMVc?si=923b6e8b022442d7
Hello, book clubbers! This month, we read Monica Heisey’s debut novel: Really Good, Actually. The book is told through the eyes of Maggie - a 29-year-old whose marriage ended just 608 days after it started. Sure, she’s alone for the first time in her life, can’t afford her rent and her obscure PhD is going nowhere, but she’s reaaaally good. As Maggie throws herself headlong into the chaos of her first year of divorce, she finds herself questioning absolutely everything. Big thanks to Audible for making this episode possible. Download the Audible app to browse their audiobooks, podcasts, and Audible Originals when you download the Audible app and start listening today. Got some thoughts on our July pick, ‘Yellowface’ by R.F. Kuang? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta, @theshamelessbookclub. Or, if you’re after some variety, here’s a link to record a voice message via our website, too. You can browse the eBook and audiobook versions of past book club picks in our room on Apple Books! Have a look-see right here. (You might spot our little baby, The Space Between, in the mix there, too.) Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘subscribe’ on Apple (bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too) or ‘follow’ on Spotify. Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Grifters and daddies
item.description: Hey hey! On today’s show: Taylor Swift is coming to Australia, Kourtney Kardashian is pregnant and announced it in quite the creative way, and Harry and Meghan part ways with Spotify amid being called “grifters”. Plus, Kayla Itsines speaks of her split from her fiance and business partner Tobi Pearce, and then can we talk about Daddy’s Day? This week, Mich recommended watching Shiny Happy People on Amazon Prime. Zara recommended reading Yellowface by R.F. Kuang and trying Birch & Waite’s Parsley, Dill & Tarragon Seafood sauce. Big thanks to CeraVe for making this episode possible. You can pick up a bottle of the CeraVe Moisturising Lotion or a tub of their Moisturising Cream now at Chemist Warehouse, Priceline, Terry White, or Adore Beauty, nationwide. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) item.title: The YouTuber series: Logan and Jake Paul (Part two)
item.description: Hello hello! Two brothers, tens of millions of followers, and too many “diss track videos” to count. Logan and Jake Paul were controversial for sure. But by the end of 2017? They’d encounter a scandal so serious, it’s a wonder their careers survived. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? item.title: Bang, bang, bang
item.description: Hellooo, everyone! On today’s show: Mich watched The Idol so you don’t have to, so what does she actually think? Plus, Leo and Gigi seem to be back on again but the press is getting a little confused by it all, Amy Schumer has an issue with all those celebrities on Ozempic, another bizarre celebrity couple enters the cosmos, and then, Jennifer Coolidge’s advice for life. Head here to purchase our charity merch! There aren’t many jumpers left so make sure you get in quick. This week, Mich recommended Love & Death on Binge. item.title: Money screams!
item.description: G’day, friends! On today’s show: rumours are swirling that Natalie Portman’s husband had an affair with a 25-year-old climate activist, it looks like Taylor Swift and Matty Healy might be over almost as soon as they began, there’s been a colossal power struggle over at VOGUE, and the long-running Sex and the City feud has taken a weird turn. This week, Zara recommended listening to Greta Gerwig on the podcast, Dua Lipa: At Your Service, as well as 'The New York Times Company’ from the podcast, Acquired. Mich recommended listening to the podcast, Mother’s Guilt. Big thanks to Elite Eleven for making this episode possible. Elite Eleven is giving away $50,000 (!!) to two people (!!!!). To be in the running, spend $50 in-store, online, or in the app between June 21st (so when the sale starts) to August 31st. During the sale period, our code ‘SHAMELESS10’ will be inactive but outside of those times, you are welcome to use it to get a cheeky 10 percent off. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. Click here to subscribe to ShameMore: http://apple.co/shamelesspod Subscribe to the weekly ‘ASK SHAMELESS’ newsletter: http://eepurl.com/gFbYLT Join our book club: https://www.instagram.com/theshamelessbookclub/ Check out our website: https://shamelessmediaco.com/ Write to the Shameless Mailbag: Email hello@shamelessmediaco.com Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

G’day, friends!

On today’s show: rumours are swirling that Natalie Portman’s husband had an affair with a 25-year-old climate activist, it looks like Taylor Swift and Matty Healy might be over almost as soon as they began, there’s been a colossal power struggle over at VOGUE, and the long-running Sex and the City feud has taken a weird turn.

This week, Zara recommended listening to Greta Gerwig on the podcast, Dua Lipa: At Your Service, as well as 'The New York Times Company’ from the podcast, Acquired. Mich recommended listening to the podcast, Mother’s Guilt.

Big thanks to Elite Eleven for making this episode possible. Elite Eleven is giving away $50,000 (!!) to two people (!!!!). To be in the running, spend $50 in-store, online, or in the app between June 21st (so when the sale starts) to August 31st. During the sale period, our code ‘SHAMELESS10’ will be inactive but outside of those times, you are welcome to use it to get a cheeky 10 percent off.

Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!)

item.title: The YouTuber series: Jaclyn Hill
item.description: Happy Monday, everyone! She was the queen of the beauty influencer community, with plenty of high-profile and lucrative collaborations to her name. But when Jaclyn Hill decided to launch her own makeup brand in 2019, things went just about as badly as possible. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Big thanks to Prime Video and their brand new series Deadloch for making this episode possible. If you’re keen to watch a show that’ll keep you on your toes, Deadloch is available to watch exclusively on Prime Video, and if you’re a new subscriber you can score a free 30-day trial. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘subscribe’ on Apple (bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too) or ‘follow’ on Spotify. Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. Subscribe to the weekly ‘ASK SHAMELESS’ newsletter: http://eepurl.com/gFbYLT Join our book club: https://www.instagram.com/theshamelessbookclub/ Check out our website: https://shamelessmediaco.com/ Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

item.title: Barbiemania level: 66%
item.description: Hello hello! On today’s show: We finally have answers as to what caused the huge rift between This Morning’s Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby. It’s almost time for Barbie Mania, Matty Healy has some… choice words… for anyone who was offended by those February podcast comments, and it’s that time of the year again: the top 100 Australian influencers have been named, and true to form, we have about 10,000 questions. This week, Mich recommended listening to Edward Enninful being interviewed on The Diary of a CEO. Zara recommended following the 7th Heaven TikToker you’ve probably seen on your feeds, Rob Anderson. Big thanks to Swinburne Online for making this episode possible. Visit swinburneonline.edu.au to see a range of online courses in Business, Psychology, Education and Law. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! On today’s show: We finally have answers as to what caused the huge rift between This Morning’s Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby. It’s almost time for Barbie Mania, Matty Healy has some… choice words… for anyone who was offended by those February podcast comments, and it’s that time of the year again: the top 100 Australian influencers have been named, and true to form, we have about 10,000 questions.

item.title: The emancipation of Drew Barrymore: Part two
item.description: Happy Monday, everyone! Welcome to the second and final part of our series on Drew Barrymore. Drew started drinking at eight, smoking at nine and was regularly doing cocaine by the time she was thirteen years old. How did this troubled but talented young actress turn her spiraling reputation into a $125 million legacy? Big thanks to the FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023 for making this episode possible. Show your support and purchase your tickets at www.fifa.com/tickets. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘subscribe’ on Apple (bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too) or ‘follow’ on Spotify. Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. item.title: BOOK CLUB: Pineapple Street
item.description:
Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CtZYT73nntQsevXK6HoIv?si=f3e51848ccdb49d7
G’day, book clubbers! This month, we read Jenny Jackson’s debut novel, Pineapple Street. Pineapple Street follows three women in an old money Brooklyn Heights family: one was born with money, one who married into it, and one who wants to give it all away. Over the course of the novel we learn about the intricacies of the Stockton family’s dynamic, how they each feel about their relationship with wealth, and whether or not you can ever really break out of a mold your parents created for you. Big thanks to Audible for making this episode possible. If you’re keen to check out audiobooks, podcasts and audible originals, download the Audible app and start listening today. Got some thoughts on our June pick, ‘Really Good, Actually’ by Monica Heisey? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta, @theshamelessbookclub. Or, if you’re after some variety, here’s a link to record a voice message via our website, too. You can browse the eBook and audiobook versions of past book club picks in our room on Apple Books! Have a look-see right here. (You might spot our little baby, The Space Between, in the mix there, too.) Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘subscribe’ on Apple (bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too) or ‘follow’ on Spotify. Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. Click here to subscribe to ShameMore: http://apple.co/shamelesspod Subscribe to the weekly ‘ASK SHAMELESS’ newsletter: http://eepurl.com/gFbYLT Join our book club: https://www.instagram.com/theshamelessbookclub/ Check out our website: https://shamelessmediaco.com/ Thanks for listening! We are very big fans of yours.

G’day, book clubbers!

This month, we read Jenny Jackson’s debut novel, Pineapple Street. Pineapple Street follows three women in an old money Brooklyn Heights family: one was born with money, one who married into it, and one who wants to give it all away. Over the course of the novel we learn about the intricacies of the Stockton family’s dynamic, how they each feel about their relationship with wealth, and whether or not you can ever really break out of a mold your parents created for you.

item.title: That's one cursed couch
item.description: Hey, legends! On today’s show: Two of the UK’s most high-profile television personalities have had such a falling out, one of them has been turfed off the job. Dua Lipa has a new boyfriend and her ex Anwar Hadid doesn’t seem at all happy about it, Taylor Swift says she’s ‘never been happier’, and why is the internet obsessed with a big blue couch? This week, Zara recommended this Nick Cannon profile in the LA Times and My Spectacular Betrayal in Modern Love. Mich recommended listening to Florence Pugh on Off Menu with Ed Gamble and James Acaster. Big thanks to The Clearing, streaming only on Disney Plus, for making this episode possible. Head to www.disneyplus.com to watch The Clearing, a Star Original series, now streaming on Disney Plus. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘follow’ on Apple and Spotify. (Bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too!) Still not enough? Well! Our hearts! See below for everything else. item.title: The emancipation of Drew Barrymore: Part one
item.description: Hello hello! Drew Barrymore, a professional actress from 11 months old, reached global movie stardom at seven as Gertie in E.T. But her troubled family history and absent parents would soon cast a dark shadow on her achievements. Got some thoughts on this scandal you wanna share? We’re allllll ears (also, eyes, heads, bodies, etc etc) - join in the convo over on our Insta @shamelesspodcast. Big thanks to Disney+ and the all-new season of The Kardashians for making this episode possible. Sink your teeth into season 3 of The Kardashians, streaming only on Disney+ from this Thursday the 25th of May. Want to support our show? We are sending air kisses, air tea, and air hugs (too far?) to anyone who clicks ‘subscribe’ on Apple (bonus hugs for anyone who leaves a five-star review, too) or ‘follow’ on Spotify.
