item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Yumiko Kadota
item.description:
Gooooood morning, wonderful listeners!
Today on the show, we bring you the brave Yumiko Kadota. Yumiko, as you’d read in her new memoir Emotional Female, has been an over-achiever her entire life, studying medicine at university and deciding to enter the perilous surgical stream when specialising as a doctor. Only, it was when Yumiko found herself trying to become a surgeon that she encountered the true, brutal nature of Australia’s hospital culture. Yumiko was subjected to such a ridiculous work schedule, colleagues who were unflinching in their coldness, and institutionalised sexism and racism that she was pushed to a mental breakdown in her late twenties, prompting her to take extended leave from her career and spend time as an inpatient in a psychiatric facility.
In this chat, we talk about the highs and the lows of being a female doctor in Australia, as well as what can be done to ensure the next generation of female surgeons aren’t pushed to a place they can’t come back from.
For more from Yumiko, follow her on Instagram at @mindbodymiko. And to grab a copy of her book, Emotional Female, head here.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Quay Australia. Head here to use the code ‘SHAMELESS20’ at checkout for 20% off.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessmediaco.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: Slip on your Satan sneakers!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Joel Creasey
item.description:
Hiya! Happy Monday!
Today on the show, we bring you the effervescent Joel Creasey. Joel is best known as one of the country’s leading stand-up comedians, having begun performing at the age of just 16. He’s performed everywhere from the Melbourne International Comedy Festival to the New York International Fringe Festival and the Edinburgh Fringe. But beyond comedy, Joel is also an author, an actor, and TV presenter who, after a stint on I’m A Celebrity Get Me Out of Here, became one of our most recognisable faces on television. But it was in 2020 when Joel got the call up to join Australia’s #1 drive program, replacing Marty Sheargold on Kate, Tim, and Marty.
For more from Joel, follow him on Instagram at @joelcreasey. If you enjoyed this episode, we recommend you listen to our interviews with fellow comedians Celia Pacquola or Matt Okine.
To grab tickets to Joel’s new show, Messy Bitch, head here.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Sweaty Betty. Check out their new high-waisted power leggings range right here, and don’t forget to use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for 20% off your entire order.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. item.title: BOOK CLUB: The Shadow Box
item.description:
Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/7DE63ZzOef240bv3X3sJjj?si=1e64f004df3e4948
Halloooooo, fellow book clubbers!
This month, we are looking at best-selling author Luanne Rice’s pacey thriller, The Shadow Box. This book jumps before and after the day artist Claire Chase was brutally attacked, to explain just what happened to her. Claire survives before going into hiding and has her suspicions on who her attacker likely was - her admired husband and state attorney, Griffin Chase, who is also running for governor. On the day of Claire’s attack, she was about to launch a shadow box at her art exhibition, inspired by an unforgivable act she was convinced her husband was responsible for years ago. On that same day, one of Claire’s neighbours was also killed. Throughout this novel, as both investigations unfold, we learn exactly how both incidents overlap, and the extent of Griffin Chase’s power over the circle that surrounds him.
Today on the show, Mich, Zara, and Annabelle ask allllll ze questions: Did Rice’s thriller keep us on our toes? What did we love about the book? And finally, were we satisfied with the ending?
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Bed Threads. Head here to check them out, and don’t forget to use the code ‘SHAMELESS10’ at checkout for 10% off your entire order.
If you’d like to share your thoughts on our April pick, It Ends With Us by Colleen Hoover, record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com). Or, if you’re after some variety, here’s a link to record a voice message via our website, too.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessmediaco.com.
Your hosts are Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: So, we'll never be billionaires?
item.description:
Hello, lovely people!
On today’s show: What does a billionaire like Kylie Jenner owe the people around her? Plus, Orlando Bloom is getting roasted online for his morning routine, Celeb Spell Check all but disappears from Instagram, the Hembrows are getting a reality show and then!!! Demi Lovato bares so much of her trauma - including what led to her 2018 overdose - for a new documentary.
This week, Zara recommended listening to the interview with Will McMahon on The Imperfects. Mich recommended this four-part deep dive on Jessica Simpson from the podcast, You’re Wrong About.

Hello, lovely people!
On today’s show: What does a billionaire like Kylie Jenner owe the people around her? Plus, Orlando Bloom is getting roasted online for his morning routine, Celeb Spell Check all but disappears from Instagram, the Hembrows are getting a reality show and then!!! Demi Lovato bares so much of her trauma - including what led to her 2018 overdose - for a new documentary.
This week, Zara recommended listening to the interview with Will McMahon on The Imperfects. Mich recommended this four-part deep dive on Jessica Simpson from the podcast, You’re Wrong About.
To read that piece on Australian defamation laws from The New York Times, head here.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Sweaty Betty. Check out their new high-waisted power leggings range right here, and don’t forget to use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for 20% off your order.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Chantelle Otten
item.description:
HELLOOO EVERYONE!
Today on the show, we bring you the serene Chantelle Otten. Chantelle is best known as one of the countries leading psycho-sexologists who works out of Melbourne with a team of more than 20. To put it simply, Chantelle is the authority on sex, not just for Australian women, but for Australians from all walks of life. She has built an incredibly successful career being one of the leading voices shattering taboos around sex: about what the average sex life should look like, about how common painful sex is, and about how sex can be pleasurable, no matter what body you live in.
In this chat, we covered everything: from why we are sold myths about sex from the moment we understand what it is, about how isolating sex can be if you feel like you’re doing it wrong, and why it’s important for her to be vocal about her own sex life with her Paralympian star boyfriend, Dylan Alcott.
For more from Chantelle, follow her on Instagram at @chantelle_otten_sexologist. If you enjoyed this chat, last year we sat down with Dylan Alcott and heard all about his life in professional sport - head here to listen.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, CeraVe. Check out their skincare right here.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: The influencer circle of life
item.description:
Oh haaaiiii! Happy Thursday!
On today’s show: Bec Judd’s op shop donation causes an influencer storm, J-Lo’s engagement is on, then off, then on again, and the slut-shaming of Melbourne socialite Mia Fevola. Finally - last but not least - a chat about the Grammys and what the performance line-up told us about the legacy of music’s bad boy, John Mayer.
This week, Zara got a Kindle and hates it! So, she recommended you give her tips on how to enjoy using hers! Mich recommended watching ‘Making Their Mark’ on Amazon Prime.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Maybelline New York. Head here to check out their new campaign, Let your eyes do the talking.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Priyanka Chopra Jonas
item.description:
GOOD MORNING LISTENER FRIENDS!!!!
Today on the show, we bring you the most famous person we’ve ever had the privilege of interviewing on this podcast, Priyanka Chopra Jonas. Priyanka has more than 60 million followers on Instagram, is one of the biggest Bollywood actors and producers of her generation, has managed to pull off a seamless transition into Hollywood, is married to a Jonas brother, and just published a New York Times best-selling memoir. As you can imagine, getting to where Priyanka is today took boundless grit and guts and determination, but what we wanted to hear most from Priyanka was about the facets of her life that the lights and cameras don’t catch; the Priyanka who loves and hurts and feels the exact same range of emotions you or I do.
In this chat, we speak about Priyanka’s rise to the very top, yes, but also the village of people who got her there. We talk about grieving her father, grappling with loneliness, wrangling with fame, and falling in love with her husband, Nick.
For more from Priyanka, follow her on Instagram at @priyankachopra.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Bed Threads. Head here to use the code ‘SHAMELESS10’ for 10% off your order, valid until 10th April 2021.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!

item.title: A *royally* bad IWD cover
item.description:
Good morning lovely people!
On today’s show: Stellar Magazine posted a bunch of topless men on their cover to celebrate IWD we have a few questions, Dolce and Gabbana sues Diet Prada for a stupid amount of money, the next Bachelor is announced as a past Bachelorette gets married, and then! OF COURSE, Meghan, Harry, Oprah, and that history-making interview.
This week, Zara recommended Honeybee and the Instagram account, MipsChips. Mich recommended reading Priyanka Chopra’s memoir, Unfinished.
Head here for that Diet Prada GoFundMe link we mentioned in today’s episode.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Pantene and their Rainbow Ribbon of Strength Campaign. Get your very own Rainbow Ribbon of Strength by DMing @PanteneANZ on Instagram.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Grace Tame
item.description:
Good morning wonderful Shameless community.
Today on the show, we bring you the absolute force that is Grace Tame. When Grace was just 15 years old, she was repeatedly groomed and raped by a 58-year-old maths teacher who taught at her Tasmanian high school. While - after serving his jail sentence - her perpetrator was allowed to speak about his crimes with the media, Grace legally wasn’t: she was prevented by law from sharing her story with the world. So, she decided to do something about it. Together with journalist and activist Nina Funnell, they created the #LetHerSpeak Campaign, which sought to overturn gag laws in Tasmania, the Northern Territory, and, more recently, Victoria. Grace’s voice has been so powerful and so necessary in the space of law reform, that in January, she was named our 2021 Australian of the Year.
A content warning before you listen to today’s chat - in this episode we discuss issues regarding grooming, child sexual abuse, eating disorders, self-harm and suicide, and may be triggering for some listeners.
For more from Grace, follow her on Instagram @tamepunk.
We urge you to check out the work of Bravehearts, a child safety foundation dedicated to preventing child sexual assault and exploitation in Australia. Support them in any way you can via their website, bravehearts.org.au.
If you’d like to seek support or advice, Braveheart’s support line is 1800 272 831.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

We urge you to check out the work of Bravehearts, a child safety foundation dedicated to preventing child sexual assault and exploitation in Australia. Support them in any way you can via their website, bravehearts.org.au.


If you’d like to seek support or advice, Braveheart’s support line is 1800 272 831.


If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!


To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.


This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: Even celebs have shitty boyfriends
item.description:
Hellooooo! Happy Thursday!!!!
On today’s show: Taylor Swift blasts Netflix to her 88 million followers, Hilaria and Alec Baldwin’s big baby mystery, the Married at First Sight “hotness ranking” challenge that made the reality show’s “experts” look more like evil masterminds, and life through the eyes of Billie Eilish - how the teen star’s rise to the top has been very different to those who have gone before her.
This week, Zara recommended HBO’s documentary miniseries, Allen v. Farrow. If you’re on the hunt for THE BEST JEANS EVER, Mich recommended these beauties from Zara (the store... not... the person).
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Pepsi Max and their Pepsi Max Taste Challenge. Tag @pepsimaxaus on Instagram with the hashtag #allittakesisasip to take part in the challenge.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Celeste Barber
item.description:
Happy Mondaaaaay everybody!
Today on the show, we bring you the remarkable Celeste Barber. We have no doubt you know precisely who Celeste is - she does have 10 million followers across Instagram and Facebook - but we’ll introduce her to you anyway. Celeste began her career as an actress, but over the last six years, has channeled her talent for making people think and laugh into a movement she calls ‘Challenge Accepted’. The premise is simple and brilliant; via her Instagram page, Celeste parodies the content Instagram has become synonymous for - exceedingly thin, obscenely famous women posing in unrealistic and sometimes downright bizarre ways. Celeste’s comedy has made her a local and international sensation: she’s graced the likes of In Style Magazine, penned a best-selling memoir, is the new face of MCoBeauty, and is practically taking over the world, one post at a time.
In this chat, we wanted to hear about Celeste’s life before fame, the awkward stages of pursuing a career in the public eye, her relationship with rejection and failure, and what it’s like to build a business off the back of being yourself.
For more from Celeste, follow her on Instagram at @celestebarber and check out her podcast, Celeste and Her Best. If you enjoyed this episode, we recommend you listen to our chat with fellow comedian Celia Pacquola.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Apple’s new original film, Billie Eilish: The World’s a Little Blurry, now streaming exclusively on Apple TV+ (terms apply). Head here to subscribe.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: Just Like You
item.description:
Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/7aYSmwZekgTofjWGy1LGX3?si=7c50e5683df149c5
G’day book club friends!!!
This month, we read best-selling author Nick Hornby’s eighth novel, Just Like You. The book follows two protagonists, 22-year-old Joseph and 42-year-old Lucy, who fall in love despite coming from two different worlds. Joseph is a young Black DJ trying to find his place in the world, while Lucy is a white English teacher and mum of two, who has recently separated from her addict ex-husband. This isn’t just the story of a juicy love affair though: after all, the book is set in 2016 and Brexit is the backdrop of their union, meaning conversations about politics and race relations are littered throughout.
Today on the show, Mich, Zara, and Annabelle talk about it all: Did Nick Hornby pull off his eighth book? Can a white man write about the experience of a Black man? And, were we pulled towards the romance of Lucy and Joseph?
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Penguin Books Australia and Emotional Female by Yumiko Kadota. Head here to pick up a copy.
If you’d like to share your thoughts on our March pick, ‘The Shadow Box’ by Luanne Rice, record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com). Or, if you’re after some variety, here’s a link to record a voice message via our website, too.
Grab yourself a copy of ‘The Shadow Box’ and join our convo next month! We’d love to have you! Head here to purchase it.
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
Shameless Podcast is run by three women in their twenties, and thrives on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: The golden boy loses his shine
item.description:
Heeeeey mates!
On today’s show: Kimye have finally filed their divorce papers and the betting markets have gone wild on who Kim is going to date next. Plus, why Emma Watson may have just retired from acting, Gwyneth Paltrow thinks she was the first person to wear a mask, and then, the fall of NRL great Sam Burgess and what it says about our obsession with sporting stars.
This week, Zara recommended The Split on Stan. Mich recommended reading this Frank Ocean profile from The New York Times.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Maybelline New York and their Fit Me foundation. Check it out right here.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Bridget Malcolm
item.description:
Helloooooo pals!
Today on the show, we bring you the brilliant Bridget Malcolm. Bridget is a classically-trained musician, best known as an international model who walked for Victoria’s Secret in their 2015 and 2016 fashion shows, as well as walking for brands like Ralph Lauren and Stella McCartney. But Bridget’s story in the fashion industry isn’t just one of glitzy catwalks and endless travel. Instead, Bridget spent much of her early and prominent years modelling battling a relentless eating disorder which, for two years, saw her live off little more than protein shakes and steamed vegetables.
In this chat, we talk about all of it: her lowest moments, her love of music, her complicated relationship with alcohol, her relatively recent diagnosis of Pre Menstrual Dysphoric Disorder, and how she feels about the modelling industry after everything she’s been through.
If this chat raises issues for you, support is available on The Butterfly Foundation's National Support Line, 1800 33 4673.
For more from Bridget, follow her on Instagram @bridgetmalcolm and subscribe to her new podcast, Model Mentality on Spotify here.
If you enjoyed this episode, we recommend you listen to our chat with model and entrepreneur Steph Claire Smith, which you can find here.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Maybelline New York and their Instant Age Rewind Concealer. Head here to check it out.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. item.title: Prying paps and tricky tabloids
item.description:
Happy Thursday legends!!!
On today’s show: Scott Disick is dating… yep, another teenager. Then, Justin Timberlake’s apology, an Aussie magazine’s huge Meghan and Harry blunder, and finally, a big bumper discussion about the Bondi paparazzi: How Aussie tabloids and their seedy photographers are slowly - and insidiously - influencing the way you think about women in the public eye.
This week, Mich recommended checking out your nearest plant delivery service, and Zara recommended watching the movie Holding The Man, which you can find on Netflix or Stan.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Modibodi. Use the code ‘SHAMELESS15’ FOR 15% off right here.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Martha Kalifatidis
item.description:
Happy Monday folks!
Today on the show, we bring you the vibrant Martha Kalifatidis. You’re likely familiar with the makeup artist and reality star after she appeared in one of the country’s most-watched seasons of Married at First Sight. Yes, she may well be known for a certain **wine throwing** incident, but she also left the show with a huge and fiercely loyal group of fans who fell in love with how confident, unapologetic, and yes - if we may use a buzzword to round this list out - authentic she really is. Oh, and they fell in love with her love story too, after Martha and her Married at First Sight husband Michael defied the reality TV odds, still together more than two years after the show aired.
In this chat, we talked about why she decided to go on the show, the dark days she spent in bed when trolling got too much and how Michael changed her life completely.
For more from Martha, follow her on Instagram @marthaa__k.
If you enjoyed this episode, we recommend you also listen to our chats with Love Island’s Tayla Damir and The Bachelor’s Abbie Chatfield.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, CeraVe. Head here to check out their incredible skincare.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!

item.title: Archiving > deleting
item.description:
HELLO, LOVELY LISTENERS!
On today’s show: Australia has its own local and modern-day gossip girl - Celeb Spellcheck - so what happens when influencers are determined to track her down and expose her identity? Plus, Kim Kardashian West thinks her seven-year-old daughter North is Picasso, why the Golden Globes are more irrelevant than ever, and then, why Janet Jackson was trending on Monday, some 17 years after the term ‘nipplegate’ entered the zeitgeist.
This week, Mich recommended the new documentary, Framing Britney Spears, and Zara recommended watching The Undoing.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Maybelline New York and their Fit Me foundation. Head here to check it out.
For that ABC piece on the Golden Globes and I May Destroy You, head here.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Yassmin Abdel-Magied
item.description:
HEY FRIENDS!
Today on the show, we bring you the whip-smart Yassmin Abdel-Magied. Yassmin is a media personality and a writer, yes, but she’s also a woman who worked for years as a successful engineer and social justice advocate who, at just 16, started the youth charity Youth Without Borders. In 2010 she was named Young Queenslander of the year, and in 2015, she was named Queensland Australian of the Year. Her 2014 TED Talk has been watched by more than 3 million people worldwide, she’s written a memoir, and now she’s turning her hand to YA fiction, releasing You Must Be Layla in 2019, and her newest book, Listen, Layla, which was released this week.
In this chat, we talk about everything: from being a teenage overachiever, to the precipice of burnout, to what it feels like to grieve her younger self.
For more from Yassmin, follow her on Instagram @yassmin_a and grab a copy of her latest novel, Listen, Layla.
If you enjoyed this episode, we recommend you also listen to our chat with fellow writer Jamila Rizvi. You can find that one right here.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Quay. Head here to check out their awesome sunnies.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!

item.description:

On today’s show: Jennifer Coolidge is suddenly absolutely everywhere, a lil' collection of stories from the week that prove some male celebs are truly the worst, Adele’s divorce settlement has a sneaky catch, and then! The question from a Rolling Stone profile that had Dua Lipa stewing for days.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Bonny Rebecca
item.description:
HIYA FRIENDS!
Today on the show, we bring you the ever-so-sweet Bonny Rebecca. For the unacquainted, Bonny Rebecca is a content creator and influencer with one hell of a story to tell. In 2018, at the height of the plant-based Instagram movement, Bonny - someone who had built a life and a career based on the lifestyle - decided to tell the world that she was leaving veganism for good. Cue: total internet outrage. Outrage so bad that Bonny found her name and face in massive publications like VICE.
In this chat, we asked Bonny: What’s it like to find yourself in the eye of a social media storm? Is that corner of the internet really a bit like a cult? And how do you find yourself again when everything you once defined yourself as comes crashing down?
For more from Bonny, follow her on Instagram @bonnyrebecca.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Sweaty Betty. Don’t forget to use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for 20% off.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. item.content:encoded:
HIYA FRIENDS!


Today on the show, we bring you the ever-so-sweet Bonny Rebecca. For the unacquainted, Bonny Rebecca is a content creator and influencer with one hell of a story to tell. In 2018, at the height of the plant-based Instagram movement, Bonny - someone who had built a life and a career based on the lifestyle - decided to tell the world that she was leaving veganism for good. Cue: total internet outrage. Outrage so bad that Bonny found her name and face in massive publications like VICE.


In this chat, we asked Bonny: What’s it like to find yourself in the eye of a social media storm? Is that corner of the internet really a bit like a cult? And how do you find yourself again when everything you once defined yourself as comes crashing down?


For more from Bonny, follow her on Instagram @bonnyrebecca.


Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Sweaty Betty. Don’t forget to use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for 20% off.


If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!


To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.


We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. item.title: BOOK CLUB: Daisy Jones & The Six
item.description:
Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/1P6d02a7tL2b9rZsYNO7aw?si=0670cc460f2546cf
Happy Saturday book club pals!
This month, we tore through Daisy Jones & The Six - the sixth novel from bestselling author Taylor Jenkins Reid that looks at the whirlwind rise of a fictional, iconic 1970s rock group and their beautiful lead singer, revealing the mystery behind their infamous breakup.
Today on the show, Mich, Zara, and Annabelle talk about the love-hate relationship between Daisy and Billy, the book's interview format, and what the story said about love, monogamy, drugs, loneliness, and fame.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Penguin Books Australia and The Chase by Candice Fox. Head here to pick up a copy.
If you’d like to share your thoughts on our February pick, ‘Just Like You’ by Nick Hornby, record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com). Or, if you’re after some variety, here’s a link to record a voice message via our website, too.
Grab yourself a copy of ‘Just Like You’ and join our convo next month! We’d love to have you! Head here to purchase it.
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
Shameless Podcast is run by three women in their twenties, and thrives on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: Wanting your cake and eating it too
item.description:
HELLO! HAPPY THURSDAY!
On today’s show: An Aussie fashion designer’s Instagram posts about Invasion Day leave everyone confused, raising questions about performative activism online. Plus! Ben Affleck and Ana De Armas’s bizarre breakup, the latest on Harry Styles’s relationship with Olivia Wilde, and finally, a deep dive on the worldwide sensation that is Jojo Siwa, who came out as a member of the LGBTIQ+ community this week.
This week, Mich recommended the You’re Wrong About podcast episode, ‘The Obesity Epidemic’. Zara recommended the Tiger Woods documentary, Tiger.
To read that Buzzfeed article on Armie Hammer by Anne Helen Peterson, head here.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Pepsi Max. If you want to take part in the Pepsi Max Taste Challenge, make sure you tag @pepsimaxaus on Instagram with the hashtag #allittakesisasip.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in our Thursday pop culture analysis, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Style by Deni
item.description:
A very happy Monday to you, wonderful friends!
Today on the show, we bring you the electric Deni Todorovic. You may well know Deni by their moniker, Style by Deni - a nod to their successful career as a fashion editor at Cosmopolitan Magazine and now GT magazine, and work as a celebrity stylist.
In this chat, we go everywhere: from the moment as a kid they knew they were different, to working in the magazine industry as it was slowly dying, to coming to grips with their own gender identity.
For more from Deni, follow them on Instagram @stylebydeni.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Somersby Mango & Lime. Head here to find out more.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. item.title: Drivers licenses and 'the Baldwinitos'
item.description:
HELLO! MAN OH MAN ARE WE HAPPY TO BE BACK!
And HELLOOOO to Thursday, you fresh, sexy day! So glad we could make it! What a delight! What a time! What a year!
On today’s show: A big ‘ol recap of the stories that dominated this summer and boy do we have a show for you. From Hilaria Baldwin’s Spanish controversy, to Armie Hammer’s deer heart ways, and Olivia Rodrigo’s viral chart-topping song - we’re covering every story we missed over the break.
This week, Mich had a few watch recs! The Queen’s Gambit on Netflix, Bump on Stan, and of course, Bridgerton on Netflix. Zara recommended you read Rodham by Curtis Sittenfeld, The Vanishing Half by Brit Bennett, and Pachinko by Min Jin Lee.
To read that Hilaria Baldwin interview in The New York Times, head here.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Sweaty Betty. For 20% off their Power Leggings and all other items, use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout here.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Tayla Damir
item.description:
We're baaaaaack and BOY is this a goodie to officially kick off 2021!
Today on the show, we bring you the delightful Tayla Damir. You may know Tayla from her time on Love Island season one where she fell in love, won the reality show, and promptly found out her boyfriend - the one she won beside - actually had a girlfriend on the outside the entire time. Now, with an Instagram following of more than half a million people, Tayla Damir has proven to be so much more than her Island experience and the drama that ensued in the weeks after.
In this chat, we talk about the sugary stuff like, how does one even find themselves applying for the show? And how did she find out Grant Crapp actually had a girlfriend sitting at home? But also, we go deeper into Tayla’s struggles with her mental health and why her first business venture is something so close to her heart.
For more from Tayla, follow her on Instagram @tayla.damir. If you enjoyed this episode, may we also recommend you listen to our In Conversation chats with Bella Varelis and Brooke Blurton.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Sweaty Betty. For 20% off their Power Leggings and all other items, use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout here.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Alyce Tran
item.description:
Hiya friends!
Today on the show, we bring you the powerhouse that is Alyce Tran. For the unacquainted, Alyce is an entrepreneur to be reckoned with. She is the brains behind The Daily Edited, an accessories label that makes personalised, monogrammed clutches, phone cases, and luggage - the must-have pieces of the moment.
In this chat, we talk about the glamour of running your own empire, but also the grit and the ugly parts, too. Particularly, when it comes to the delicate tightrope act of juggling a burgeoning career and a social life.
For more from Alyce, follow her on Instagram @alyce_tran. If you enjoyed this episode, may we also recommend you listen to our In Conversation chats with Effie Kats and Zoe Foster Blake.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Priceline Pharmacy. Visit Priceline Pharmacy to check out their game-changing initiative, Scripts Now.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Allira Potter
item.description:
Hellooooo friends!
Today on the show, we bring you the glorious Allira Potter. Allira has curated an incredible career by being herself and embracing what the universe throws at her. Despite having numerous hurdles in her path since her mother’s death when she was a teenager, Allira has flourished and thrived. Allira is a body positive warrior who helps her audience practice self-love every single day.
In this chat, we talk with Allira about processing grief after her mother’s passing, how spirituality completely changed her perspective, and finding new love.
For more from Allira, follow her on Instagram @allirapotter. If you enjoyed this episode, may we also recommend you listen to our In Conversation chats with Rae Johnston and Jules Von Hep.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Hayu. Head here or download the app to start your free trial.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Samantha Wills
item.description:
Goooood morning, everyone! HAPPY LAST DAY OF 2020!
Today on the show, we bring you the formidable Samantha Wills. You likely know Samantha’s name from her eponymous jewelry line, Samantha Wills. Back in 2004, Sam decided to invest her last $500 to showcase her jewelry - jewelry she was then selling at the Bondi markets at Australian Fashion Week. People fell in love, and very soon, she was overwhelmed with orders. Three years in though - despite boasting a successful and very popular business - Sam found herself $70,000 in debt. So, how did she turn it all around? And why did she decide to close, rather than sell, a 10 million dollar business?
In this chat, we go everywhere, from burnout to chronic illness to broken relationships to business.
For more from Samantha, follow her on Instagram @samanthawills. If you enjoyed this episode, may we also recommend you listen to our In Conversation chats with Kylie Brown and Michelle Battersby.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Bioré. Check out their new Brightening Collection here.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in a Monday episode, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: Transcendent Kingdom
item.description:
Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/0D39Y5QgX53l9PngQlT7AS?si=239a0943f6854fef
OHHH, it's the last book club for 2020, friends!
This month, we read Transcendent Kingdom by Yaa Gyasi - a novel that centres around Gifty, a neuroscientist at Stanford who studies addiction and depression neural circuits through experimenting with mice. This, we come to learn, is no coincidence. Transcendent Kingdom deals with grief, mental illness, and religion, and also takes us back through Gifty’s life: From her brother’s opioid addiction to a disappearing father to being sent to Ghana to live with her Aunt while her mother battles depression at home.
Transcendent Kingdom was a NYT bestseller and is Yaa Jessie’s second published work. Mich sat down for an interview with Yaa about her novel, which we will play in the second half of this episode.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Penguin Books Australia and The Push by Audrey Audrain. Head here to buy a copy.
If you’d like to share your thoughts on our January pick, ‘Daisy Jones and The Six’ by Taylor Jenkins Reid, record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com). Or, if you’re after some variety ,here’s a link to record a voice message via our website, too.
Grab yourself a copy of ‘Daisy Jones and The Six’ and join our convo next month! We’d love to have you! Head here to purchase it.
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
Shameless Podcast is run by three women in their twenties, and thrives on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: You guys!
item.description:
MERRY CHRISTMAS EVE, FAVOURITE PEOPLE!
Today, we bring you a very special episode with you guys, the Shameless community! We think there’s no better time to reminisce on the year that was, all while hearing your thoughts on everything from your favourite pop culture stories of 2020, to which Shameless interviews have stayed with you the most, and what lessons you’ll be taking into 2021.
We will be back with normal programming on January 18! In the meantime though, keep an eye out for our summer series of In Conversation episodes that we will be dropping every Thursday. A huge thank you to all of you for your ongoing support throughout 2020. It has been a bloody weird year and we are so lucky to have been able to do it all by all of your sides.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Marc Jacobs’ new fragrance, Perfect. To check it out, head to Myer or David Jones.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless and to find the full chats you heard in today’s episode, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in a Monday episode, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: Off with your head, 2020
item.description:
HELLOOOO AND MERRY CHRISTMAS TO ALL!
On today’s show: Exactly what’s gone down between The Slumflower and Florence Given, Cody Simpson randomly pops up in Australian Olympic trials, a definitive ranking of all of the best and worst Christmas songs of all time, and a wrap on the year that was. What has 2020 taught us about ourselves and the world?
This week, Zara recommended Zoe Foster Blake’s dinner playlist on Spotify and Mich recommended watching Geordie Shore (lol).
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Pantene and their Intense Rescue Shots. Check them out here or at all major retailers.
As you would’ve heard at the end of today’s show, our very last In Conversation episode for 2020 will be with all you lovely people. Call our Shameless Hotline and tell us what you’ve learned about this year! It can be about social media, your favourite story or Shameless segment of the year - absolutely anything.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in a Monday episode, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!

item.content:encoded:
HELLOOOO AND MERRY CHRISTMAS TO ALL!


On today’s show: Exactly what’s gone down between The Slumflower and Florence Given, Cody Simpson randomly pops up in Australian Olympic trials, a definitive ranking of all of the best and worst Christmas songs of all time, and a wrap on the year that was. What has 2020 taught us about ourselves and the world?


This week, Zara recommended Zoe Foster Blake’s dinner playlist on Spotify and Mich recommended watching Geordie Shore (lol).


Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Pantene and their Intense Rescue Shots. Check them out here or at all major retailers.


As you would’ve heard at the end of today’s show, our very last In Conversation episode for 2020 will be with all you lovely people. Call our Shameless Hotline and tell us what you’ve learned about this year! It can be about social media, your favourite story or Shameless segment of the year - absolutely anything.


If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Nazeem Hussain
item.description:
Happy Thursday friends!
Today on the show, we bring you the hilarious Nazeem Hussain. Nazeem is a comedian, actor and TV personality who has performed stand-up at comedy festivals all around the world. Nazeem created and starred in the SBS show ‘Legally Brown’, the sketch comedy series ‘Orange Is The New Brown’ on Channel 7, and has his very own, critically-acclaimed Netflix Special called ‘Nazeem Hussain: Public Frenemy’.
In this chat, we spoke with Nazeem about the close bond he has with his younger sister, his experience forming an unlikely friendship on ‘I’m a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here’, and the joys of fatherhood.
For more from Nazeem, follow him on Instagram @nazeemhussain. If you enjoyed this episode, may we also recommend you listen to our In Conversation chats with fellow comedians, Celia Pacquola and Matt Okine.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, JBL. Check out JBL’s True Wireless range here, and use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for 25% off!
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. item.title: Two words: coconut oil
item.description:
Happy Monday wonderful people!
On today’s show: The influencer s*x tape that’s made us see coconut oil in an entirely new light. Plus, Johnny Depp’s celeb-laden love life is outed as part of his court case against Amber Heard, Taylor Swift outdoes herself by releasing her second album in 2020, and - last but not least- the Red Table Talk that sparked a huge discussion about star power and privilege.
This week, Zara recommended the episode of The Cut, ‘Would You Move Back Home? Could You?’. Mich recommended the gorgeous art and v handy pre-framed section from Society6.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Marc Jacobs’ new fragrance, Perfect. To check it out, head to Myer or David Jones.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Kylie Brown
item.description:
Hey, legends!
Today on the show, we bring you the formidable Kylie Brown. Kylie is in the public eye, partly, because her husband Jonathan Brown is a well-known former AFL star and radio personality. But it’s what Kylie has managed to do with her profile and platform that has blown us away. After struggling with chronic endometriosis for two decades, and undergoing no less than nine surgeries - including a hysterectomy at 34 - to manage her condition, Kylie opened an Instagram account to track her journey and spread awareness about endo.
In this chat, we talk about Kylie’s battle with her body so far, and why she decided to run a marathon when the odds were well and truly stacked against her.
For more from Kylie, follow her on Instagram at @endo.runner. If you enjoyed this episode, we recommend you check out our chat with fellow endo warrior Bridget Hustwaite.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Vodka Soda & and their new Pink Gin Soda &. For their ‘special pack’ deal, check out the link in their instagram bio @ginsodaand or find their products in-store.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in a Monday episode, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: Where art thou manly men?
item.description:

On today’s show: What your Spotify Wrapped says about you, plus, Juno star Elliot Page announces he is transgender, Rhianna has a very famous new bf, and why conservatives lost their flippin’ minds over Harry Styles wearing a dress in Vogue.
This week, Mich recommended The Story of Diana on Netflix, and Zara recommended reading Cazzie David’s piece, ‘Ex Dysmorphia’, in Air Mail.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Rupi Kaur
item.description:
Happy Thursday everyone!
Today on the show, we bring you the inimitable Rupi Kaur. Rupi is the writer and poet of three best-selling books: Milk and Honey, The Sun and her Flowers, and Home Body, which have sold a cumulative 8 million copies worldwide and been translated into 42 languages. In 2017, Kaur was named in BBC’s 100 Women list, and in 2019, The New Republic named her the writer of the decade.
For more from Rupi, follow her on Instagram at @rupikaur_. And buy her fantastic book, Home Body, right here.
If you enjoyed this episode, we recommend you check out our backlog of chats with so many other people we admire.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Clinique and their new custom-blend clearing hydrator, Clinique iD for Imperfections. Use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for 15% off any order and head here for the T&Cs!
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. item.title: Diana's millennial makeover
item.description:

This week, Zara recommended listening to the You’re Wrong About podcast. Michelle recommended keeping an eye out for our Shameless 12 Days of Giveaways, dropping into your Instagram feeds TOMORROW! YAY FOR CHRISTMAS!

On today’s show: Do not call Justin Bieber a pop star, the bizarre backlash to Meghan Markle’s New York Times essay, and then, has Zac Efron put an end to his ‘hot normie’ relationship? Finally, we talk all about the millennial makeover of Princess Diana.
This week, Zara recommended listening to the You’re Wrong About podcast. Michelle recommended keeping an eye out for our Shameless 12 Days of Giveaways, dropping into your Instagram feeds TOMORROW! YAY FOR CHRISTMAS!
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Kin Fertility. Use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for $10 off your video consultation.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in a Monday episode, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: BOOK CLUB: Ghosts
item.description:
Link to this episode in the new The Shameless Book Club feed: https://open.spotify.com/episode/5PwGumOnjhUbz2vNtWkQdS?si=90750de4c18e40ec
A very happy Saturday to you, book club friends!!!
This month, we’re delving into bestselling author Dolly Alderton’s fiction debut: the warm, funny, tender novel, Ghosts. Ghosts tells the story of food writer Nina Dean who enters her thirties with a successful career under her belt and strong friendships around her. And then, well... then she meets Max - a tall, clever, evasive man who told her on their first date that he will marry her. She loves him, he loves her. For five months, they’re entwined in each other’s lives and then he just… disappears. Ghosts tells the story of how friendship changes over the decades and how terminal illness in a family can sometimes splinter the relationships of those who are hurting. Just over a month after release, Ghosts is already a Sunday Times bestselling novel.
Today on the show, Mich, Zara, and Annabelle discuss the hype around this book, the magnificent character that is Lola, and the plot lines that didn’t quite land (we’re looking at you, Angelo).
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Penguin Books Australia and The Last Migration by Charlotte McConaghy. Head here to pick up a copy.
If you’d like to share your thoughts on our December pick, ‘Transcendent Kingdom’ by Yaa Gyasi, record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com). Or, if you’re after some variety,here’s a link to record a voice message via our website, too.
Grab yourself a copy of ‘Transcendent Kingdom’ and join our convo next month! We’d love to have you! Head here to purchase it.
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com.
Shameless Podcast is run by three women in their twenties, and thrives on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: The Inspired Unemployed
item.description:
HIYA FRIENDS!
Today, we bring you the men behind The Inspired Unemployed, Matt Ford and Jack Steele. Matt and Jack have gone from relative obscurity to being an internationally-recognised duo in only the last year or so. They have accumulated 600,000 followers on TikTok and nearly 800,000 on Instagram, and have also fronted campaigns for Fendi, The Iconic, and Louis Vuitton.
In this chat, we talk about the transition from working on suburban job sites as tradies to starring on the cover of GQ, as well as how they keep having fun when their side hustle has now become their full-time job.
For more from The Inspired Unemployed, follow them on Instagram @theinspiredunemployed.
If you enjoyed this episode, we recommend checking out our chats with Hamish Blake and Andy Lee.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, The Oodie. Use the code ‘SHAMELESS30’ at checkout for $30 off your Oodie.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
To catch up on everything Shameless, head to our website www.shamelessthepodcast.com
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in a Monday episode, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: Catch ya never, Pete
item.description:
HEY FRIENDS!
On today’s show: Nigella Lawson’s buttered toast technique becomes a very British scandal. Plus, Angie Kent rightly disparages cover story clickbait, and then, is this the end of Pete Evans as we know him?

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Florence Given
item.description:
Happy Thursday everybody!!!
Today, we bring you the enigmatic Florence Given. For the unacquainted, Florence is nothing short of a force to be reckoned with. The 21-year-old feminist illustrator, writer, and activist released her debut book, Women Don’t Owe You Pretty, in June this year, and has gone on to become a number one Sunday Times bestseller. Florence now has a social media following of more than half a million people, and has single-handedly carved out one of the most engaged spaces for the queer community online.
In this chat, we go from Florence’s turbulent high school experience, to what she would change about social media if she was given a chance.
For more from Florence, follow her on Instagram @florencegiven, and grab a copy of her incredible book, Women Don’t Owe You Pretty, right here.
If you enjoyed this episode, we recommend checking out our chats with Clementine Ford and Jameela Jamil.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, TBH Skincare. Use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for 15% off anything on their website.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
But wait! There’s more! Our back catalogue of In Conversation interviews. Follow Shameless on Instagram. Join our book club Facebook Group. Subscribe to the weekly Shameless recommendations newsletter. Grab a copy of our first book, The Space Between.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in a Monday episode, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: The fall of a 'hypepriest'
item.description:
Hiya friends!
On today’s show: The most brutal riches to rags story that we’ve read in a very long time. Plus, the future of shoppable shows like Euphoria, an internal crisis on why we give so many effs about the love lives of teenage Tik Tokkers, and the Hillsong "hypepriest" who ruined his career with an extra-marital affair.
This week, Zara recommended The Rise Of The Murdoch Dynasty on ABC iView. Off the back of last week’s Christmas movie chat, Mich recommended the show A Moody Christmas.
Here’s the GQ profile on Carl Lentz that Zara mentioned in this episode.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Maybelline New York. Head here to find their Fit Me Foundation range.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
Is this your first time listening? Want to check out our Christmas gift guide? You'll find lots of cool things over on our website, shamelessthepodcast.com
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in a Monday episode, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Nakkiah Lui
item.description:
Why hello there!
Today, we bring you the very warm Nakkiah Lui. Nakkiah is a Gamilaroi and Torres Strait Islander woman who writes for both the theatre and television. Nakkiah has co-written and starred in the ABC’s Black Comedy, created and starred in Kiki and Kitty for the ABC, co-hosted the Buzzfeed podcast series Pretty for an Aboriginal, and in 2019, released her debut novel, Black Is The New White. This year, Nakkiah also released her Audible Original Podcast alongside Miranda Tapsell, Debutant: Race, Resistance and Girl Power.
In this chat, we touched on everything: From growing up around community to how she found herself studying a law degree, and the impact her grandma Joan had on her life and career.
For more from Nakkiah, follow her on Instagram @nakkiah. And we highly recommend you check out her and Miranda’s Audible Original Podcast, Debutant: Race, Resistance and Girl Power.
If you liked this episode, we recommend checking out our chats with STEM journalist Rae Johnston and best-selling author Dolly Alderton.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Maybelline New York. Head here to find their Fit Me Foundation range.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
But wait! There’s more! Our back catalogue of In Conversation interviews. Follow Shameless on Instagram. Join our book club Facebook Group. Subscribe to the weekly Shameless recommendations newsletter. Grab a copy of our first book, The Space Between.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. If you’d like to weigh in on an episode - whether it be a segment in a Monday episode, an In Conversation guest, or this month’s book club pick, we’d love for you to call our Shameless Hotline. You miiiiight just be featured on an episode.
Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: Three days. THREE. DAYS.
item.description:
HELLO LISTENER FRIENDS!
On today’s show: The explosive Bachelorette finale that took us by surprise after quite a lacklustre season. Plus, the baby rumours that Hailey Bieber is having none of, and then, how one of Netflix’s most-streamed films in 2020 also happens to be one of the worst Christmas movies we’ve ever seen.
This week, Mich and Zara recommended some top-quality/kinda niche Christmas movies you should spend your time watching instead of Holidate - While You Were Sleeping and Home Alone Four.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Denada Sugar Free Ice Cream. Head here to find your nearest stockist.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Sophie Delezio
item.description:
Hiiiii lovely people!
Today, we bring you the remarkable Sophie Delezio. If Sophie’s name sounds familiar, you were probably first introduced to her story more than 16 years ago, when a car crashed into Sophie’s daycare centre and trapped Sophie underneath. In that incident, she suffered burns to more than 85% of her body, lost both of her feet, a number of fingers, and an ear. A few years later, Sophie’s life was threatened again by a serious car accident, where, after being thrown from her wheelchair, she obtained an acquired brain injury. In the face of so much adversity, Sophie Delezio is a sunshine-y force to be reckoned with. Now, on the cusp of her twenties, Sophie is a fighter who didn’t just survive, but thrived despite everything that life threw at her.
In this chat we will retrace the two events that shaped Sophie into the incredible person she is today, and how her parents’ and brother’s love nurtured her in even the darkest of moments.
For more from Sophie, follow her on Instagram @soph.delezio. If you liked this episode, we recommend checking out our chat with skydiving accident survivor Em Carey, which you can find here.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Lo Bros Kombucha. Keep an eye out on our Instagram page for your chance to win enough Lo Bros Cola Kombucha to last you an entire summer.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
But wait! There’s more! Our back catalogue of In Conversation interviews. Follow Shameless on Instagram. Join our book club Facebook Group. Subscribe to the weekly Shameless recommendations newsletter. Grab a copy of our first book, The Space Between.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. item.title: The great birthday party divide
item.description:
Hey there!
On today’s show: Is James Corden the next to fall down to cancel culture? Plus, the celebrity baby boom, David Beckham’s massive Netflix’s deal, and the Kardashian birthday story that split Shameless listeners right down the middle. Is it a bit gross to celebrate your 40th birthday on a private island and post about it on social media, all in the midst of a pandemic? Or, should we just accept that rich people are going to live their very best lives, no matter what the rest of us are doing?
This week, Mich recommended Reputation Rehab on ABC iView. For our fellow Melbournians, Zara recommended listening out for the boisterous noises of lively pubs, restaurants, and busy roads. We’ve missed you, sounds!
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Maybelline New York. Check out their Fit Me Foundation right here.
If this is your first time checking us out (hey, you), we are an independent media company that is dedicated to telling young women’s stories. The best way to support Shameless is to click ‘Subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘Follow’ on your Spotify app, and to tell your mates about us. We will reward such good behaviour with a puppy! Not everything in this paragraph is true!
But wait! There’s more! Follow Shameless on Instagram. Join our book club Facebook Group. Subscribe to the weekly Shameless recommendations newsletter. Order our book about life in your twenties, The Space Between.
We cherish your feedback on the show, and would bloody love to hear your wonderful voices. Thanks so much for lending us your ears for this episode! Have a great day! Stay hydrated!
