item.title: Anti-vaxxers and 'asking questions'
item.description:
Hey there, fabulous folks!
On today’s show: The anti-vaxxer movement's annoying PR glow-up. Plus, the ‘Call Her Daddy’ furore goes global. And then, how Emily Oberg killed her own brand, Sporty & Rich, in a matter of days.
If you’d like to take action about what’s going on in the world right now, you can donate to the same charities Shameless Media has supported over the weekend: the Minnesota Freedom Fund and the North Australian Aboriginal Justice Agency.
Mich recommended one of our favourite episodes of In Isolation with Melissa Leong, and Zara recommended another nibble, Kellogg’s Crispix Cereal (certainly not sponsored, because Mich is... not a fan).
The readings on cultural appropriation from our Facebook threads are below. We implore you to give them all a read, as well as continue to do your own research.
‘7 Reasons Why White People Should Not Wear Black Hairstyles’ by Maisha Z. Johnson.
Deaths Inside: Indigenous Australian Deaths in Custody by The Guardian.
This Twitter thread by @GOLDENFILTER.
Such A Fun Age by Kiley Reid.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Nutty Bruce. Keep an eye out on our Instagram page to win two months worth of bloody delicious snacks for you and a friend.
Want to be featured on the pod? Record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com) It can be about anything pod related! Or unrelated! We just wanna chat, pretty please. OK, we're done being clingy. Love you.
Head here to pre-order our proudest project to date! Our beautiful baby! Our book, The Space Between.
Craving more? You’re only human. Here are all the links your heart desires! Our Insta profile. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter.
Shameless Podcast is run by three women in their twenties, and thrives on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Melissa Leong
item.description:
HELLO! It goes without saying we’re super excited to share today’s episode with you!
Today on the show, we bring you the glorious Melissa Leong. Melissa is a freelance food and travel writer, cookbook editor, radio broadcaster, and TV presenter. She’s been an esteemed food critic for publications like Time Out Sydney, and previously hosted SBS’s television series A Chef’s Line. She’s now working alongside Andy Allen and Jock Zonfrillo as a judge on Masterchef Australia, and has been requested as a guest on our show so many times we've honestly lost count.
In this chat, Melissa tells us exactly how she found out Masterchef Australia wanted her as a judge on the show, as well as her past experiences grappling with shame and culture.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Beefeater Gin. Don’t forget to use the code ‘SHAMELESS20’ here for that generous discount!
If you’d like to see more from Melissa, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow her on Instagram at @fooderati.
As for us? Here are all the links your heart desires... Our Insta profile. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!
Shameless Podcast is run by three women and is charged by the support of our incredible listeners - AKA you! So, if you'd like to support the show, hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts and leave a five-star review if you think we’ve earned it. You can also click 'follow' on Spotify. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: Welcome to Media-geddon
item.description:
Hellloooooo and good morning, fellow pop culture junkies!
On today’s show: The Anna Wintour tell-all causing a ruckus in the fashion industry. Plus, how a pandemic has put Only Fans in the spotlight. And then, can a decimated media industry be saved?
But BEFORE WE GET ONTO ALL THE LINKS, LET’S GIVE YOU THE ONE THAT REALLY COUNTS! We will be announcing the details of our upcoming book in a very special newsletter drop tomorrow at 8AM. So, if you’d like to be the very first to know exactly what we’ve been working on for the last year (and pre-order) make sure to subscribe right here: https://bit.ly/3cYtOaJ
This week, Zara recommended an episode of the WTF with Marc Maron Podcast called Remembering Lynn Shelton. She also recommended listening to the interview with Daisy Edgar Jones on How To Fail with Elizabeth Day.
Mich recommended reading The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo by Taylor Jenkins Reid, as well as The Alice Network by Kate Quinn. She also recommended you listen to the She’s On The Money episode, COVID-19: What NOT to do with your money during a crisis.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Square. Head here to set up your account.
Want to be featured on the pod? Record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com) It can be about anything pod related! Or unrelated! We just wanna chat, pretty please. OK, we're done being clingy. Love you.
Craving more? You’re only human. Here are all the links your heart desires! Our Insta profile. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter.
Shameless Podcast is run by three women in their twenties, and thrives on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Matt Okine
item.description:
Happppppy Thursday! Feelin’ like a mood boost? This episode will do the trick.
Today on the show, we bring you the warm and witty Matt Okine. Matt is a stand-up comedian, author, actor, and podcast host. You’ll likely be familiar with Matt’s work as the co-host of Triple J’s breakfast show from 2014 to 2016 alongside Alex Dyson, who he’s gone on to host a new podcast ‘All Day Breakfast’ with. Matt also starred in The Other Guy on Stan, a show he also wrote.
In this chat, Matt touches on the impact of losing his mother at the age of 12, as well as exactly how he stumbled into stand up comedy after finishing acting school.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Nutty Bruce. Check out their products here.
If you’d like to see more from Matt, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow him on Instagram at @mattokine.
You can find Matt’s podcast, All Day Breakfast with Alex Dyson, here, and his book, Being Black ‘n Chicken & Chips, here.
As for us? Here are all the links your heart desires... Our Insta profile. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!
Shameless Podcast is an independent vehicle, run by three women, that's charged by the support of our incredible listeners - AKA you! So, if you'd like to support the show, hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts and leave a five-star review if you think we’ve earned it. You can also click 'follow' on Spotify. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1).

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Turia Pitt
item.description:
G’day! It’s Thursday! Hooray!
Today on the show, we bring you the remarkable Turia Pitt. Turia is an author, mining engineer, athlete, and motivational speaker. In 2011, she was caught in a grassfire while running an ultramarathon, suffering severe burns to 65 per cent of her body as a result. In the almost decade since, Turia is now one of Australia’s most inspiring voices.
In this chat, we ask Turia exactly how she responds to her inner critic, as well as whether there’s pressure that comes with being such a leading voice on resilience at a time like this.
Thank you so much to Andalou Naturals. Their products are currently 40 per cent off (!!!) at Chemist Warehouse’s online store. Click here to shop.
If you’d like to see more from Turia, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow her on Instagram at @turiapitt. You can also find her School of Champions course here.
If you’re after that In Conversation episode with Jess Quinn we mentioned at the end of today’s episode, click here.
As for us? Here are all the links your heart desires... Our Insta profile. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!

item.itunes:summary:
G’day! It’s Thursday! Hooray!
Today on the show, we bring you the remarkable Turia Pitt. Turia is an author, mining engineer, athlete, and motivational speaker. In 2011, she was caught in a grassfire while running an ultramarathon, suffering severe burns to 65 per cent of her body as a result. In the almost decade since, Turia is now one of Australia’s most inspiring voices.
In this chat, we ask Turia exactly how she responds to her inner critic, as well as whether there’s pressure that comes with being such a leading voice on resilience at a time like this.
Thank you so much to Andalou Naturals. Their products are currently 40 per cent off (!!!) at Chemist Warehouse’s online store. Click here to shop.
If you’d like to see more from Turia, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow her on Instagram at @turiapitt. You can also find her School of Champions course here.
If you’re after that In Conversation episode with Jess Quinn we mentioned at the end of today’s episode, click here.
As for us? Here are all the links your heart desires... Our Insta profile. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!
Shameless Podcast is an independent vehicle, run by three women, that's charged by the support of our incredible listeners - AKA you! So, if you'd like to support the show, hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts and leave a five-star review if you think we’ve earned it. You can also click 'follow' on Spotify. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: What's in a name?
item.description:
Hey hey! It’s Mondaaaayyy!
On today’s show: We try to decode Elon Musk and Grimes’ baby name. Plus, is publicly calling out trolls online off limits when they’re under the age of 18? And finally, we finish with a conversation about the current state of foodie culture.
This week, Zara recommended watching Normal People on Stan and eating Barbeque Shapes. (Not spon, just important.) Mich then recommended you get a Koala mattress. (Again, not spon, but equally as important.)
The GoFundMe for Ahmaud Arbery’s family is here.
Record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com) It can be about anything pod related! Or unrelated! We just wanna chat, pretty please. OK, we're done being clingy. Love you.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Andalou Naturals. Head here to check out their brightening range.
To drool at/cook/admire Jess Nguyen’s totally yum recipes mentioned at the end of the episode, head to her Instagram page here.
Craving more? You’re only human. Here are all the links your heart desires! Our Insta profile. Our Facebook Group. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!
Shameless Podcast is run by three women in their twenties, and thrives on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Celia Pacquola
item.description:
Happy In Isolation Thursday, self-isolated pals!
Today on the show, we bring you the very warm, very witty Celia Pacquola. When Celia isn't winning Dancing with the Stars Australia, she’s busy being one of Australia’s best comedians, writers and actors. Celia - along with Luke McGregor - is the brains behind the award-winning comedy series, Rosehaven, on the ABC, and has also appeared in Utopia, The Beautiful Lie, and Have You Been Paying Attention.
In our interview with Celia, we chat about it all: From how she got into comedy in the first place, to what it’s like navigating mental health in a pandemic when her mind is constantly idle. We felt instantly calmer after this chat with Celia, and we hope her charm lifts your day as much as it did ours.
Thank you so much to BROSA furniture for making this episode of Shameless possible. Find their stuff here, and don’t forget to use the code ‘SHAMELESS20’ at checkout for 20% off your order.
If you’d like to see more from Celia, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow her on Instagram at @celia_pacquola.
And check out Celia’s new comedy special, All Talk, on Amazon Prime here.
For those In Conversation interviews we mentioned at the end of today’s episode, here ya go: Click here for Clementine Ford and here Tanya Hennessy.
As for us? Here are all the links your heart desires... Our Insta profile. Our Facebook Group. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!
Shameless Media is run by three women and is charged by the support of our incredible listeners - AKA you! So, if you'd like to support the show, hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts and leave a five-star review if you think we’ve earned it. You can also click 'follow' on Spotify. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: The uncomfortable reality of internalised misogyny
item.description:
Well whaddya know! It’s Monday morning again!
On today’s show: Meghan and Harry are releasing a book, but do the headlines tell the real story? Plus, a deep dive on Jameela Jamil’s Instagram experiment says about internalised misogyny.
This week, Mich recommended you listen to the podcast, The Briefing, and Zara recommended the Stan series, The Loudest Voice.
Record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com) It can be about anything pod related! Or unrelated! We just wanna chat, pretty please. OK, we're done being clingy. Love you.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, ANZ. Find out more about their 50-30-20 budget here.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Sammy Robinson
item.description:
Good morning, you wonderful humans!
Today on the show, we bring you the lovely Sammy Robinson. Sammy has grown a vast social media following after starting on YouTube only four years ago, uploading beauty tutorials from the comfort of her bedroom. Now, she works with fashion and beauty brands globally, and is about to launch her very own clothing label, One Mile.
In our chat with Sammy, we touch on everything: From what it’s like launching One Mile when the world is in such chaos, to whether she thinks COVID-19 will change influencer culture forever after things start to shift back to normal.
Thank you so much to The Body Shop and Plan International Australia’s Youth Activist Series for making this episode of Shameless possible. Check it out here.
If you’d like to see more from Sammy, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow her on Instagram at @sammmyrobinson. And please do check out One Mile on Instagram too, at @onemile.thelabel!
As for us? Here are all the links your heart desires... Our Insta profile. Our Facebook Group. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!
Shameless Podcast is an independent vehicle, run by three women, that's charged by the support of our incredible listeners - AKA you! So, if you'd like to support the show, hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts and leave a five-star review if you think we’ve earned it. You can also click 'follow' on Spotify. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: God bless female Agents of Chaos
item.description:
Yoohoo! It’s us! We’ve missed you!
On today’s show: Our very random and almost inexplicable obsession with tonal loungewear. Plus, why in the world does Dr Phil still have a platform but no practicing certificate. And finally, a deepdive on the Netflix show Too Hot to Handle and female agents of chaos (a term coined by by VICE’s Lauren O’Neill and Emma Garland that we LOVE).
This week, Zara recommended you listen to Daniel Radcliffe’s podcast episode on Desert Island Discs here. Mich did a whoopsies and forgot to recommend something this week, but all is forgiven considering her phenomenal work on our open letter to Margot Robbie. Check it out here.
Record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com) It can be about anything pod related! Or unrelated! We just wanna chat, pretty please. OK, we're done being clingy. Love you.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, The Oodie. Head here to get $30 off your order by using the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout. And the generosity continues! The Oodie is also running a giveaway on our Instagram page so keep an eye out for it over there to enter.
Craving more? You’re only human. Here are all the links your heart desires! Our Insta profile. Our Facebook Group. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Osher Günsberg
item.description:
Hello helloooooo!
Today on the show, we bring you someone who likely needs no introduction at all: Osher Günsberg. You probably fell in love with Osher when he was the host of Australian Idol all the way back in 2003. Since then, he’s gone on to become one of the country’s most successful television personalities as the host of The Bachelor, The Bachelorette and The Masked Singer.
In our interview with Osher, we cover everything: From what it’s like filming in The Bachelor mansion, to his passion for spreading mental health and climate change awareness.
Thank you so much to The Body Shop and Plan International Australia’s Youth Activist Series for making this episode of Shameless possible. Check it out here.
If you’d like to see more from Osher, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow him on Instagram at @osher_gunsberg.
To grab a copy of Osher’s book, Back, After the Break, head here. And to get his wonderful podcast, Better Than Yesterday, in your ears, click here.
At the end of today’s episode, we mentioned a couple others we think you might enjoy! Click here for Georgia Love and here for Rosie Waterland.

Hello helloooooo!
Today on the show, we bring you someone who likely needs no introduction at all: Osher Günsberg. You probably fell in love with Osher when he was the host of Australian Idol all the way back in 2003. Since then, he’s gone on to become one of the country’s most successful television personalities as the host of The Bachelor, The Bachelorette and The Masked Singer.
In our interview with Osher, we cover everything: From what it’s like filming in The Bachelor mansion, to his passion for spreading mental health and climate change awareness.
Thank you so much to The Body Shop and Plan International Australia’s Youth Activist Series for making this episode of Shameless possible. Check it out here.
If you’d like to see more from Osher, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow him on Instagram at @osher_gunsberg.

item.title: The Great Avocado Debate
item.description:
Hellloooooo Monday! Or is it Tuesday? Friday?
On today’s show: How Masterchef reclaimed the Australian reality television throne after years of slumping ratings. Then, Reese Witherspoon’s Instagram marketing debacle, and finally, the very odd trend of sharing your #pandemicdreams online.
This week, Mich recommended you bless your eyeballs with Unorthodox on Netflix. (Yeah yeah, Zara suggested you do the same last week, but just watch it, kay?). Zara recommended you listen to this episode of The Daily about the allegations levelled at Joe Biden, and this interview with Alain De Botton on How To Fail With Elizabeth Day.
Record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com) It can be about anything pod related! Or unrelated! We just wanna chat, pretty please. OK, we're done being clingy. Love you.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: The Resilience Project’s Hugh van Cuylenburg
item.description:
Good morning! Or arvo! Or night! We’re rambling!
Today on the show, we bring you the uplifting Hugh van Cuylenburg. For those unaware, Hugh is the school teacher turned mental health pioneer behind The Resilience Project - an organisation that works with schools, sports clubs, and businesses to provide evidence-based, positive mental health strategies to build resilience and happiness.
In our interview with Hugh, we talk about it all: From the pivotal trip to Northern India that changed his life, to the impact his sister’s battle with Anorexia Nervosa had on his perspective.
Just a quick note: this episode covers issues around disordered eating and might be triggering for some listeners.
Thank you so much to James Cosmetics for making this episode of Shameless possible. Head here to grab yourself or a pal somethin’ nice, and make sure you use the code ‘SHAMELESS25’ at checkout for 25% absolutely anything (!!!) on the site.
If you’d like to see more from Hugh, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow him on Instagram at @theresilienceproject.
Check out Hugh’s podcast, The Imperfects, which he hosts alongside Ryan Shelton by clicking here. Hugh has also written a book! Find out about it here. And to get your mitts on the wellbeing journal Hugh mentioned at the end of this episode, head here.
As for us? Here are all the links your heart desires! Our Insta profile. Our Facebook Group. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you'd like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts or 'follow' on Spotify, and leave a review if you're feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: A love letter to Florence Pugh
item.description:

On today’s show: Are we finally seeing the death of influencer unboxings? Plus, the sharp rise of Florence Pugh and her epic handling of online trolling, and then, how conspiracy theories are given room to thrive in a period of time like this one.
This week, Mich recommended you watch Lion on Netflix, and Zara recommended another Netflix goodie, Unorthodox.
Record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com) It can be about anything pod related! Or unrelated! We just wanna chat, pretty please. OK, we're done being clingy. Love you.

item.title: IN ISOLATION: Brooke Boney
item.description:
Today’s the day! The day we introduce you to our very first, very special In Isolation episode.
On the show this week, we bring you the delightful Brooke Boney. Brooke is a Gamilaroi woman who grew up in Muswellbrook, NSW, and is currently an entertainment reporter on The Today Show. You’ll likely be familiar with her work before that too, as a journalist on NITV, the ABC, and Triple J.
In our interview with Brooke, we cover everything: From what she thought her year was going to look like to how she’s coping in these strange times. As well as that, Brooke also touches on how she really hopes - when the curtain lifts from all the chaos - that she’ll care a little less about what people think of her.
Thank you so much to ANZ for making this episode of Shameless possible. Head to their website here to find out more.
If you’d like to see more from Brooke, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow her on Instagram at @boneybrooke.
As for us? Here are all the links your heart desires! Our Insta profile. Our Facebook Group. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you'd like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts or 'follow' on Spotify, and leave a review if you're feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: Celebrity culture is crumbling
item.description:
A big, caps-locked HELLLLOOOO to you, Shameless besties!
On today’s show: Mason Disick is the Instagram and Tik Tok deviant we didn't know we needed right now. Plus, why Tiger King will perhaps be the most meme-able moment of 2020, and finally, the New York Times article that convinced us that celebrity culture may be crumbling right before us.
This week, Mich recommended you all download Tik Tok and do this TV character personality test (Link pls Mich xxx). Zara recommended reading this article in The Guardian by Elliott Dallen and getting anything by or with Seth Godin in your ears.
Record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com) It can be about anything remaining positive right now! Or your thoughts on the latest pod! We just wanna chat, pretty please. OK, we're done being clingy. Love you.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, The Oodie. Head here to grab yourself one, and use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ for $30 off your order.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Lana Wilkinson
item.description:
OH HAI!
Today on the show, we bring you the absolute dynamo that is Lana Wilkinson. Lana is a celebrity stylist who has dressed the likes of Megan Gale, Rebecca Judd, Ruby Rose, and Zoe Foster Blake as well as a designer, having launched her own self-titled shoe brand in 2019.
Given the state of the world, we were feeling a little deflated when we walked into this interview with Lana two weeks ago, but our moods were immediately lifted by Lana’s kindness and light, as well as her insights into pursuing your career and making your big dreams a reality.
Thank you so much to Bangn Body for making this episode of Shameless possible. Check out their products here and don’t forget to use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for 10% off your order.
If you’d like to see more from Lana, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow her on Instagram at @lanawilkinson.

item.title: We want to lie down
item.description:
Hello hello, lovely people!
On today’s show: How the satirical news website Betoota Advocate somehow, oh so cleverly, Trojan-horsed us all. Plus, a discussion on the reignited Kimye/Taylor Swift feud, and finally, why the concept of self-optimising in this time of self isolation is kinda annoying.
This week, Mich recommended the Netflix show Tiger King and Zara recommended the app HouseParty.
Looking for that collection of hilarious conference call stories on Jules Von Hep’s Instagram? Read it right here. And that Taylor Swift article by Joel Golby in The Guardian? You can find it here.
Record a voice message and send it to hotline@shamelessmediaco.com (that's *CO*.com) It can be about anything pod related! Or unrelated! We just wanna chat, pretty please. OK, we’re done being clingy. Love you.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Fantastic Furniture. Head here to check out their aptly named, very, very fantastic furniture.
Craving more? You’re only human. Here are all the links your heart desires! Our Insta profile. Our Facebook Group. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Dylan Alcott
item.description:
Hiiiiii listener friends!
You asked, we listened. Today, we bring you the man you’ve all been wanting on the show for quite some time: the utterly impressive Dylan Alcott. Dylan is a professional athlete, media personality, motivational speaker, bestselling author, and disability advocate. (And us? We’re completely out of breath just typing that.)
In this episode, we talk about the childhood moment that shaped Dylan’s approach to life, his career jump from pro basketball to tennis, and the love story with his partner Chantelle.
Thank you so much to Keep It Cleaner making this episode of Shameless possible. Sign up to Keep It Cleaner here. And make sure you’re following them on Instagram at @keepitcleaner to join their FREE live workout this Friday the 27th of March, 7AM.
If you’d like to hear more from Dylan, which you no doubt 1000% do, check out his podcast, ListenABLE, here, and make sure you hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts and ‘follow’ on Spotify. You can also catch Dylan on Instagram @dylanalcott.
As for us? Here are all the links your heart desires! Our Insta profile. Our Facebook Group. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you'd like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts or 'follow' on Spotify, and leave a review if you're feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1).

item.title: Calabasas Lobster
item.description:
The greatest of mornings to you all, Shameless family!
On today’s show: We hear from a few of your lovely voices via our brand new Shameless hotline. Then, we talk about the Hayley Williams profile that made us think a little deeper about female anger and how to harness it. Finally, a conversation on the lipstick effect and self care in an era of economic downturn.
Zara recommended two episodes of the podcast This American Life: The Show of Delights episode and their Birds & Bees episode. She also recommended linen clothing from Kehoe because YES TO LINEN CLOTHING. Mich recommended you watch 9 Life Lessons from Tim Minchin on Youtube. Also! Lou Lou Lips, if you’re looking for some local, top quality lippies.
Give us a buzz on 0482 472 301 and talk to us! About anything pod related! Or unrelated! We just wanna chat, pretty please. OK, we’re done being clingy. Love you.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Tribe Skincare. Head here to shop their products and to use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for 10% off storewide.
As for us? Here are all the links your heart desires! Our Insta profile. Our Facebook Group. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Brooke Jowett
item.description:
OH HELLO! Happy In Conversation day, listener friend!
Today on the show, we’re joined by the sunny Brooke Jowett. If you’re a fan of Survivor Australia, you’ll no doubt be familiar with Brooke, who has now appeared on two separate seasons of the show (the first, which aired in 2016, and the one on your television screens right now!).
In this episode, we talk about how Brooke made a name for herself as a fierce competitor on the show so many of us adore, as well as how she feels about dominating headlines lately. Sure, Brooke’s the woman who was blindsided by the country’s next big Bachelor star. But she’s also the woman who’s shown Australia what she’s made of - twice - without a phone, or a wardrobe, or any of the creature comforts that keep you and I sane day-to-day.
Thank you so much to Bioré for making this episode of Shameless possible. Check out Bioré’s pore strips here.
To listen to the other In Convo eps we mentioned at the end of this episode, follow ze links: click here for Abbie Chatfield and here for Tully Smyth.
If you’d like to hear more from Brooke, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow her on Instagram @brookejowett.
As for us? Here are all the links your heart desires! Our Insta profile. Our Facebook Group. Our book-club. And our weekly newsletter!
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you'd like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts or 'follow' on Spotify, and leave a review if you're feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1).

item.title: A little dose of joy
item.description:
Oh hi there, glorious listener pals!
Today on the show: A discussion on how we seek out joy during a time of overwhelmingly rampant news coverage. Where are the slithers of light amongst the dark? Where is the line between being educated about world events and being utterly overwhelmed? Then, we jump right to the biggest pop culture news story of the week - the Woody Allen memoir that was pulled just before its release to the public.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Modi Bodi. You can check out their stuff by clicking here. But wait! There’s more! Use the code ‘SHAMELESS15’ at checkout for 15% off your order, if you like discounts, of course.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jules Von Hep
item.description:
Happy Thursday to all our fine-footed friends in the world!
Today on the show we are joined by Jules Von Hep, who we also like to refer to as a human ray of sunshine. Jules is a celebrity tanning expert, the founder of tanning juggernaut Isle of Paradise, co-host of the Jules and Sarah podcast and champion of body confidence.
We first met Jules last year when we hosted MECCALAND and were immediately drawn to him: he is one of the kindest, warmest, most exuberant humans we have ever had the pleasure of meeting through this job. Yes, Jules is a tanning expert - and has tanned some of the most famous women in the world - but goodness, he is also so much more than that. Jules is a warrior for body confidence, infusing much of his ethos about loving and embracing our bodies on his Instagram feed and in his brand.
A quick plot twist before we jump into this chat - Zara wasn’t actually there. She fell ill on the morning we were due to record with Jules and, because he lives in London, it was impossible to re-schedule. So, while she had huge amounts of FOMO listening to this one back, she loved SO much getting the pleasure of enjoying this one as a listener. Mich and Jules cover everything from his battle with an eating disorder as a young man, to tanning celebrities like Kendall Jenner to the birth of his mammoth, internationally stocked beauty brand, Isle of Paradise.
For more from Jules, you can find him @julesvonhep and @theisleofparadise. As always, we are @shamelesspodcast.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor DiDi. Simply use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ to receive $20 worth of vouchers, redeemable in all Australian cities where DiDi is operating.
Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories.

item.title: Do you have 'interxiety'?
item.description:
It’s Monday! AND a public holiday! AAAAND episode drop day! Hooray!
On today’s show: Toilet paper. Yes, you know exactly what we’re talking about. The great Australian toilet paper shortage of 2020 that’s left us completely perplexed. Plus, we look into The Bachelor Australia’s false start with their announcement of Locky Gilbert as next season’s star. And finally, how ‘interxiety’ - a term we most definitely made up - has kept us up this week.
This week, Mich recommended the newest book by Marian Keyes, Grown Ups. Find it here. Zara recommended Elizabeth Kate Russell’s book, My Dark Vanessa, which you can find here.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, ANZ. To download their app we spoke about in today’s episode, head here.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here for recommendations, columns and snazzy discount codes.
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Neroli Meadows
item.description:
Yoohoo! It’s us again, rudely interrupting your Thursday morning! (And we aren’t even sorry about it.)
Today on the show, we’re joined by the delightfully vibrant Neroli Meadows: one of the country’s leading sports commentators and television presenters.
In this episode, we dive into it all: From Neroli’s close relationship with her siblings to the highlights of working her way up in a male dominated industry. We also touch on what grappling with losing a job is like when it's so tied to your personal and public identity, as well as how Neroli has dealt with re-shaping her career after rejection.
Thank you so much to Denada Sugar Free Ice Cream for making this episode of Shameless possible. Purchase Denada’s goodies here.
Neroli is just about to release her very own independent podcast, Ordineroli Speaking. Be sure to keep an eye out for its release in the weeks to come, and click here to follow the podcast on Instagram.
To check out those other In Conversation interviews we mentioned at the end of this episode, follow ze links: click here to listen to Jo Weston, and here for Brandon Jack.
If you’d like to hear more from Neroli, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow her on Instagram @nezm. As for us? We're @shamelesspodcast.
Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories.
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here.
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you'd like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts or 'follow' on Spotify, and leave a review if you're feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
This episode was produced by Annabelle Lee for Shameless Media.

item.title: A royal case of Insta fraud
item.description:
HAPPY MONDAY! And the happiest hello to you, Shameless fam!
On today’s show: The very curious, very convincing theory that Will and Kate (yes, the royal ones) have bought Instagram followers. Plus, a discussion on Harvey Weinstein’s conviction and the aftermath of it all. Finally, we talk about a woman’s nightmarish revelation that her ex-boyfriend of seven years is now dating… Lady Gaga.
This week, Mich recommended the podcast Dying For Sex. Find it here. Zara recommended the documentary The Australian Dream, which you can watch here.
Thank you so much to today’s sponsor, Francesca. To check out their charity Endometriosis Awareness Bracelet and their other timeless pieces, head here. Oh oh oh! You can also get 15% off storewide, you lucky things you! All you gotta do is use the code ‘SHAMELESSFRANC’ at checkout, excluding charity items.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Courtney Act
item.description:
Hiya friends! Strap yourselves in, ‘cause this one’s a goodie. (Are we allowed to say that about our own podcast episode? Screw it. IT’S AMAZING.)
Today we’re joined by the ridiculously entertaining Courtney Act: a drag queen, entertainer and singer who has graced television screens across not just in Australia, but around the world.
In this episode, we talk about it all: from Courtney’s schooling experience in Brisbane as Shane Jenek, to how Courtney Act came to life. We also cover why drag is such an important part of her identity, as well as her time on Australian Idol, Big Brother UK and Ru Paul’s Drag Race.
Thank you so much to ShopBack for making this episode of Shameless possible. Check out ShopBack here.
Courtney is currently touring her new live show FLUID in Sydney and Darwin. Click here for more details and to buy tickets.
To check out those other In Conversation interviews we mentioned at the end of this episode, follow ze links: click here to listen to Georgie Stone, and here for Em Rusciano.
If you’d like to hear more from Courtney, which you no doubt 1000% do, follow her on Instagram @courtneyact. As for us? We're @shamelesspodcast.
Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories.
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here.
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you'd like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts or 'follow' on Spotify, and leave a review if you're feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1).

item.title: The one where 'Mercury retrograde' breaks us
item.description:
HAPPY MONDAY TEAM!
On today’s show: Why the heck does everyone keep talking about Mercury being in retrograde? Plus, what the death of Caroline Flack says about internet culture and then, how Ben Affleck is pulling out all the stops to win back the affection of the public.
This week, Mich recommended going to a discount Adidas store lol which definitely isn’t a proper recommendation but we are rolling with it anyway. Zara recommended an episode of Australian True Crime called Defending the Indefensible.

On today’s show: Why the heck does everyone keep talking about Mercury being in retrograde? Plus, what the death of Caroline Flack says about internet culture and then, how Ben Affleck is pulling out all the stops to win back the affection of the public.
This week, Mich recommended going to a discount Adidas store lol which definitely isn’t a proper recommendation but we are rolling with it anyway. Zara recommended an episode of Australian True Crime called Defending the Indefensible.
A big thank you to today’s sponsor, Shopback. Remember, it’s free to sign up and comes with a $10 welcome bonus for you! You can sign up right here.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here for recommendations, columns and snazzy discount codes.
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald).

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Zoë Foster Blake
item.description:
YES! Today is the day. And from this point on, the 20th of February 2020 will be forever known as Shameless Christmas. Also, the day with the best numerology in the history of the universe (20/02/2020 - what a date, what a time).
But enough about number orgasms! This is about Zoë, AKA former beauty journalist, the author of ten books and the founder of Go-To (and Bro-To... and Gro-To) Skin Care. Also, the curator of Very Good Instagram Accounts and purveyor of Extremely Good Advice.
In this episode, we cover a lot; from the early days of Zoë's career to building a huge beauty brand, the self-doubt that can rear its head, motherhood, and what it’s like to be one half of the country’s golden couple.
You're almost definitely following Zoë on Instagram anyway, but just in case, she's @zotheysay. We're @shamelesspodcast.
Thanks so much to Brown Brothers' Moscato One for making this episode of Shameless possible. Check out Moscato One here.
Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories.
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here.
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: Say hello to ‘medfluencers’
item.description:
WAHOOOOO IT’S MONDAY! Thanks so much for giving us your ears for this hour of power.
On today’s show: WHO WON DOGGO OF SHAMELESS? Plus! The divorce announcement that we care about deeply and the rise of medfluencers - doctors, dieticians and nurses who are making money on Instagram. And - finally - the opinion piece on the Karen meme that was so contentious, it was the top trending topic on Twitter in Australia over the weekend.
Mich forgot to recommend anything because she was too busy talking about the new baby burrito. Can she recommend you become an aunty? Because she wants to recommend that. Zara recommended 7am’s episode, Profiting from Auschwitz. She recommends Michelle shut the eff up about babies. Some links from today’s episode:
Read Eve Simmons’s piece on medfluencers.
Read Julia Baird’s story on the Karen meme.
A big thank you to today’s sponsor, Maybelline. Check out their new Falsies Lash Lift Mascara here.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing.)
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald).

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Nawal Sari
item.description:
GOOD MORNING! GOOD THURSDAY! GOOD LISTENER FRIENDS!
Today on the show, we have the glorious Nawal Sari. Nawal is an influencer committed to redefining modest fashion, and has turned her love of fashion into a burgeoning career. In this interview, we sit down to discuss Nawal’s decision to wear the hijab in high school, as well as what it’s like becoming a bit of an accidental big sister to a community of 120,000 young women.
Follow Nawal on Instagram @nawalsari. As for us? We're @shamelesspodcast.
If you enjoyed this episode, please do check out our interviews with beauty influencers Rowi Singh and Jade Tuncdurok in 2019. They are goodies, if we do say so ourselves.
A big thank you to today's sponsor, Maybelline New York and their new Falsies Lash Lift Mascara. Get your mitts on it in stores or online.
Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories.
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you'd like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit 'subscribe' on Apple Podcasts or 'follow' on Spotify, and leave a review if you're feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: Teen mags screwed us up
item.description:
A very happy Monday to you, lovely people! On today’s show: a look back at all the effed articles we consumed in teenage magazines. Plus, we watched Gwyneth Paltrow’s new Netflix special Goop Lab and have lots of thoughts and then, why people suddenly became prudish when Shakira and JLo took their clothes off at the Superbowl halftime show.
Mich recommended Chasing Cosby, and Zara recommended last week’s episode of Four Corners called Black Summer.
Some links from today’s episode:
Watch Rebel Wilson’s full BAFTAs speech here.
Read the Pedestrian article we spoke about in today’s episode, with extracts from old, effed magazine articles.
Read Jennifer Paola Varela Rodriguez's PopSugar story on JLo and Shakira's halftime performance.
A big thank you to today’s sponsor, Maybelline. Check out their new Falsies Lash Lift Mascara here.
Thanks so much to Bondi Boost for getting behind Doggo of Shameless and gifting the winner a $500 prize pack plus a year's supply of Pooch Wash!!!
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing.)
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald).

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Rosie Waterland
item.description:
HELLO GLORIOUS LISTENERS!
Today on the show we are joined by Rosie Waterland. Rosie is a writer and comedian who began her career writing recaps of The Bachelor for Mamamia. Since then, she's achieved so much we honestly feel a little dizzy, err, recapping it all.
Rosie has written two bestselling books - The Anti Cool Girl and Every Lie I’ve Ever Told - hosted an award-winning podcast, My Mum Says My Memoir is a Lie, toured Australia with two sold out one-woman shows (with a third coming!) and written for TV, too. Oh, and last year she signed a two-book deal with Harper Collins Australia, announcing her foray into fiction. NO BIG DEAL. EVERYTHING IS FINE.
Just a content note on this one: we do cover issues of suicide, addiction and details of childhood trauma in this episode and it may be triggering for some listeners.
Follow Rosie on Instagram: @rosiewaterland Listen to Rosie's podcast, Just The Gist here. Head along to one of her shows! Rosie is doing her Kid Chameleon show in Canberra on the 23rd of February and then heads to South Australia on the 25th. You can buy your tickets here.
A big thank you to today's sponsor ICC Women’s T20 World Cup. Be part of history and buy your tickets to the final here!
AND FIND YOUR TICKETS TO OUR JUSTCO CAREER Q+A RIGHT HERE (use our code ‘SHAMELESS’ for $20 off your ticket!): http://bit.ly/jcshamelessevent
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: From Kobe to Taylor
item.description:
OH FAM, IT’S A BIG ONE THIS WEEK. Happy Monday!
Today we go everywhere from the very random, very silly Instagram feud between influencer Mitchell Orval and food critic John Lethlean, the tragic death and complicated legacy of Kobe Bryant and then, the Taylor Swift documentary we’d been waiting weeks for.
Some links for you from today’s show:
Mich recommended this New York Times profile of Jessica Simpson and Zara recommended this episode of The Hollywood Reporter’s Awards Chatter podcast.
Extra reading: Kobe Bryant and Complicated Legacies by Jill Filipovic, Kobe Bryant’s Disturbing Rape Case: The DNA Evidence, the Accuser’s Story, and the Half-Confession by Marlow Stern, ‘Taylor Swift: Miss Americana’ Review: A Star, Scathingly Alone.
A big thank you to today’s sponsor, ANZ. Check out their financial wellbeing calculator here. Buy tickets to our Tea With Jam and Clare live show here.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Georgie Stone
item.description:
HAPPY THURSDAY LISTENER FRIENDS!
Coming up today: a very special episode with 2019’s youngest recipient of an Order of Australia Medal, Georgie Stone. For those unacquainted, Georgie is a Neighbours actress and trans rights activist. Oh, and did we mention she’s only 19?
If you’d like to follow Georgie on Instagram, please do so @georgiestone. As for us? We’re @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: So do we call them ‘Braniston’ or ‘Anipitt’?
item.description:
HAPPY MONDAY, WONDERFUL LISTENER FRIENDS!
Man oh man, do we have a lot to talk about. Firstly, let’s cover the Triple J Hottest 100, and what the results over the last three decades say about us. Then, every little thing about BRAD AND JEN (!!!!!!) and the Alec Baldwin interview that made our mouths hit the floor.
This week, Mich recommended Sex Education on Netflix. Zara recommended you go see Little Women at your local cinema and that you listen to The Daily’s episode on Meghan and Harry.
Read that wild Jen Aniston profile in Vanity Fair here. Aaaaand that infuriating Alec Baldwin interview is here.
A big thank you to today’s sponsor, Prene Bags. Use our code SHAMELESS for 10% off all full-priced products!
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing.)
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Michelle Wants Michael Buble’s Attention Andrews (@michelleandrews1) and Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald).
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.
*Note: this episode asserted that the Triple J Hottest 100 countdown began in 1975. It began in 1989.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Clementine Ford
item.description:
It’s our first In Conversation of 2020 and it’s a gooooood one. Today on the show we are joined by the formidable force that is Clementine Ford. Of course, you’re likely to know Clem for her writing on feminism and as the author of Fight Like a Girl and Boys will be Boys. But who is Clem Ford behind the writing and activism we know so well? We sat down with Clem in her Melbourne home to chat all about her work, yes, but what it was like growing up all over the Middle East and how motherhood changed everything.
Just setting the scene on this one before we jump in: we recorded this in Clem’s apartment with a train line nearby which may hear very occasionally through the chat, but we think you will love it all the same.
Here are some links to buy Clem’s books Fight Like a Girl and Boys will be Boys.
A big thank you to today’s sponsor Denada Sugar Free Ice Cream.
Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?

Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).

item.title: Beware the women!!!
item.description:
AAAAND WE ARE BACK!!! Happy happy happy 2020 Shameless fam - we couldn’t be more excited for our first episode of the year. So, what’s on the agenda? One of the biggest Youtube star’s comes out as transgender. Plus, what the actual eff happened to the royal family while we were away, and how do we feel about Megxit? Then, some thoughts on influencers, Instagram brands, and public shaming.
This week, Zara recommended you read Such a Fun Age by Kiley Reid. Mich recommended the film Marriage Story and the reality show The Circle, both on Netflix.
Also, to read a little more about the complexities of Celeste Barber’s fundraiser, you can here. That brilliant piece by Kathy McCabe for Rendezview is here.
A big thank you to today’s sponsor Moscato One by Brown Brothers.

item.title: In 2020 #IPledge
item.description:
Hey friends! Happy New Year! We hope you've enjoyed some much-deserved time out with your loved ones.
Today we are re-sharing one of our favourite episodes of 2019 - our In Conversation episode with Natalie Fornasier. We first came across Natalie and her story when she sat down with Byrdie.com.au in 2018 for a piece titled “I’m 24 and Living With Advanced Melanoma—This Is My Story”. Natalie’s words and insights in that interview were what informed our very last segment of Shameless in 2018, and what pushed us to change our own relationship with sun tanning forever. We had Nat as a guest at our Sydney live show in November, and are so lucky to now call her a friend.
Nat is now battling stage four melanoma after the cancer spread to her small intestine and bowel. Given today marks a new year and a new decade, we thought now is the time to help Nat champion her message again. So, Team Shameless has enlisted the help of some of Australia's most influential and recognisable women to make a pledge toward sun safety in 2020. You can watch our #IPledge video on our Instagram page @shamelesspodcast at midday today.
The Pledge:
Did you know melanoma is the third most common cancer in Australian women? It kills more young people in our country than any other form of cancer.
So in 2020, I pledge:
To wear sunscreen.
To get my tan from a can.
And to take notice of my skin - and do whatever I can to protect it.
I pledge to get my skin checked if I feel like something’s wrong, or if it’s been a while.
To never glamourise sun tanning to my followers.
And to educate myself and others about the risks.
In 2020, I’m going to be safe in the sun. And I encourage you to do the same.
To support Call Time On Melanoma, visit www.calltimeonmelanoma.com.au, or follow them on Instagram @calltimeonmelanoma. To follow Nat on Instagram, search @nataliefornasier.

Hey friends! Happy New Year! We hope you've enjoyed some much-deserved time out with your loved ones.


Today we are re-sharing one of our favourite episodes of 2019 - our In Conversation episode with Natalie Fornasier. We first came across Natalie and her story when she sat down with Byrdie.com.au in 2018 for a piece titled “I’m 24 and Living With Advanced Melanoma—This Is My Story”. Natalie’s words and insights in that interview were what informed our very last segment of Shameless in 2018, and what pushed us to change our own relationship with sun tanning forever. We had Nat as a guest at our Sydney live show in November, and are so lucky to now call her a friend.


Nat is now battling stage four melanoma after the cancer spread to her small intestine and bowel. Given today marks a new year and a new decade, we thought now is the time to help Nat champion her message again. So, Team Shameless has enlisted the help of some of Australia's most influential and recognisable women to make a pledge toward sun safety in 2020. You can watch our #IPledge video on our Instagram page @shamelesspodcast at midday today.


The Pledge:


Did you know melanoma is the third most common cancer in Australian women? It kills more young people in our country than any other form of cancer.


So in 2020, I pledge:


To wear sunscreen.


To get my tan from a can.


And to take notice of my skin - and do whatever I can to protect it.


I pledge to get my skin checked if I feel like something’s wrong, or if it’s been a while.


To never glamourise sun tanning to my followers.


And to educate myself and others about the risks.


In 2020, I’m going to be safe in the sun. And I encourage you to do the same.


To support Call Time On Melanoma, visit www.calltimeonmelanoma.com.au, or follow them on Instagram @calltimeonmelanoma. To follow Nat on Instagram, search @nataliefornasier.

item.title: The end of a decade
item.description:
IT’S THE FINAL EPISODE OF THE YEAR AND IT’S A CHRISTMAS SPECIAL! KINDA. Well, look, there will be presents and this Christmas jingle and we did probably consume a little too much champagne while recording it.
What are we TALKING about though?! Well, there’s the curious Christmas Instagram campaign that is unlike anything we’ve seen. Plus, the best pop culture moments of the last decade, and the Chrissy Teigen and John Legend argument that sings to our souls.
We’re taking a wee little break but don’t stress, we will be BACK in your ears on January 20!
A big thank you to today’s sponsor Skydive Australia. Remember! Use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout until the 29th of February next year for $40 off your booking.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Zara and Mich!
item.description:
WELL, WELL, WELL! It’s our last In Conversation episode of 2019 and today on the show you’re joined, actually… today you’re joined by us. Yes, we sat down with the effervescent Sarah Davidson at the Mercedes me store on Tuesday night for an In Conversation with the two of us.
A huge, huge thank you to Mercedes me for having us in their beautiful space - their Melbourne is one of 11 Mercedes me locations worldwide, sitting alongside other iconic cities including Munich, Hamburg, Hong Kong, Tokyo and Moscow.
Our wonderful MC Sarah Davidson, is of course, is the co-owner of Matcha Myklbar and Matcha Maiden and the host of the Seize the Yay podcast. Wanna find more from Sarah? 'Course you do. Right this way...

item.title: Generation 'Instagram Face'
item.description:
HAPPY SECOND MONDAY BEFORE CHRISTMAS SHAMELESS FAM AND YES WE WILL KEEP YELLING ABOUT THIS UNTIL AFTER CHRISTMAS. On the show today: Our obsession with finding words and colours to define the year that was. Plus, the age of Instagram Face and then, a look at Rihanna’s 2019: one that saw her the centre of the public consciousness, despite not releasing a second of music.
Zara recommended Morning Wars on Apple TV and Mich recommended Terrace House on Netflix.
Today's episode was made possible by our sponsor Moscato One by Brown Brothers: refreshingly-spritzed Moscato that contains exactly one standard drink.
Read Jia Tolentino's New Yorker piece on 'Instagram Face' here.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Bel Sloane
item.description:
Hello lovely listeners!
Today we have a powerful interview with Bel Sloane. In case you’re not familiar with her name, Bel is a television presenter for Channel 7. She’s also the wife of AFL star and captain of the Adelaide Crows, Rory Sloane. In 2018, Bel and Rory lost their first child Leo, who was born sleeping. In this interview, we talk about that grief, but also the love that Leo brought to both of their lives. We also talk about what it was like to fall pregnant again with their little boy, Sonny, and the mechanics of keeping that entire pregnancy secret from the outside world.
While we sat with Bel in her Adelaide home, there was a great, big Christmas tree right beside us. On the Christmas tree were a collection of baubles that read the names of their little family - Mum, Dad, Sonny and Leo - the little warrior who will never be forgotten, and whose passing ignited a legacy that will help Australian parents for years to come.
Thanks to our sponsor Hey Tiger for making this episode of Shameless episode possible. Use our code SHAMELESSHOLIDAY at checkout to receive a free full-size bar of chocolate, worth $15.
You can follow Bel on Instagram @bel_sloane. If you enjoyed this episode, we also recommend you listen to our chat with Leigh Campbell, which you can find here.
If you or a loved one is struggling with pregnancy loss, support is available at SANDS. You can call any time, day or night, on 1300 072 637.
Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing.)

Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Steph Claire Smith
item.description:
It’s little Friday and boy, are we happy about it! Today we’ve got a good one for you, because we are joined by the powerhouse that is Steph Claire Smith. Or, now, Miller. Steph entered the public consciousness as a model, and a wildly successful one at that, but since then has crafted a career that exists well beyond the modelling industry. Today, she is the co-founder of fitness app Keep it Cleaner, sunglass company Soda Shades and bikini brand Midnight. She’s the face of Bondi Sands, an ambassador for Adidas and the co-author of a book, too. And, yes, she’s still only 25.
We sat down with Steph to talk about business, yes, but also the scrutiny of being in the public eye, her very recent and high profile wedding and the kinds of criticisms that hurt the most.
Also a big thank you to today’s sponsor Kester Black. Remember, with the code SHAMELESS at checkout you can receive a FREE (!!) lipstick with any order. Visit www.kesterblack.com to check them out.

item.itunes:author: Shameless Media
item.itunes:summary:
It’s little Friday and boy, are we happy about it! Today we’ve got a good one for you, because we are joined by the powerhouse that is Steph Claire Smith. Or, now, Miller. Steph entered the public consciousness as a model, and a wildly successful one at that, but since then has crafted a career that exists well beyond the modelling industry. Today, she is the co-founder of fitness app Keep it Cleaner, sunglass company Soda Shades and bikini brand Midnight. She’s the face of Bondi Sands, an ambassador for Adidas and the co-author of a book, too. And, yes, she’s still only 25.
We sat down with Steph to talk about business, yes, but also the scrutiny of being in the public eye, her very recent and high profile wedding and the kinds of criticisms that hurt the most.
Also a big thank you to today’s sponsor Kester Black. Remember, with the code SHAMELESS at checkout you can receive a FREE (!!) lipstick with any order. Visit www.kesterblack.com to check them out.

item.title: Manufacturing a pop star
item.description:

On today’s show: what the rise of singer songwriter Tones and I says about the music industry in 2019, the photos of Justin Timberlake holding the hand of his co-star and then, the Selena Gomez AMAs performance that was… shaky, at best.
Zara recommended you *don’t* spend $20 watching Last Christmas. Mich wants you to read Pachinko! Read it!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Emma Carey
item.description:
Happy, happy, happy Thursday you wonderful people!
Em is known as the girl who fell from the sky: at just 20 years old, when skydiving in Switzerland, her parachute failed to open properly. She plummeted from the sky, landing on the ground completely paralysed from the waist down. She spent months in hospital re-learning how to move her body again. Today, Emma is a walking paraplegic. As she documented her recovery and her re-birth (as she now calls it) Emma built a hugely loyal following thanks to her sunny and warm and thoughtful posts. But often, behind the scenes, things were much harder than she presented them on Instagram. Last week, we sat down with her in Brisbane and asked her all about it.
Also a big thank you so much to today’s sponsor The Body Shop. Book your spot with Mrs Claus online now at thebodyshop.com.au.
Craving more? You're only human. item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Clare Bowditch
item.description:
Happy, happy, happy Thursday our favourite listeners!
Today on the show, we’re joined by Clare Bowditch, a musician and actress who has now released her memoir, Your Own Kind of Girl, a book that explores the stories we tell ourselves and what happens when we believe them. In this episode we talk about what it’s like to lose a sister, be sent to a diet doctor when you’re still in primary school, and accept yourself when the world tells you that you shouldn’t.
A bit of a trigger warning on this one, too: this episode discusses eating disorders in a manner that might be triggering for some listeners.
If you’d love to hear more from Clare, you can do two things: buy her book Your Own Kind of Girl, or follow her on Instagram @clarebowditch.
Also a big thank you so much to today’s sponsor Urban You. Don't forget to use our code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for $30 off your clean!

item.title: OK, Boomer
item.description:
HIYA and HAPPY MONDAY LOVELY PEOPLE!
Coming up on today’s show: it was a big night for reality TV finales on Thursday and the results sparked a rather furious divide between Australians: when it comes to daylight savings and the shows airing at different times in different states, whose responsibility is it to keep the result under wraps? Plus, a conversation about celebrity fundraisers in the wake of natural disasters and then, the OK Boomer meme that has infiltrated the internet.
This week, Zara recommends you read Catch and Kill by Ronan Farrow, while Mich recommends Three Women by Lisa Taddeo.
Today's episode was made possible by our sponsor The Body Shop, the original nature-inspired, cruelty free beauty brand fighting for a fairer and more beautiful world.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Erin Brockovich
item.description:
Helloooooo, favourite listener friends! Today on the show we have the enigmatic Erin Brockovich. In the year 2000, the award-winning film starring Julia Roberts told the true story of Erin’s involvement in a case against a Californian power company. Ever since, Erin has continued to work in the environmental sphere and has regularly visited Australia as the ambassador for Shine Lawyers.
In our chat with Erin, we asked her about her environmental activism, what it’s like coming into such a large sum of money so unexpectedly, and her relationship with the label “feminist icon”. And yes, we talk a bit about Julia Roberts too...
If you loved this chat with Erin, you can find more from her at @the_real_erin_brockovich on Instagram. After you follow Erin, may we recommend you also listen to our interview with the marvellous Em Rusciano too? You can feast your ears (eyes? who knows!) on that one right here.
Thank you to our sponsor Tribe Skincare for making today’s episode possible. Find out more about Tribe Skincare here and use our code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout for 10% off AND free express shipping.

item.itunes:author: Shameless Media
item.itunes:summary:
Helloooooo, favourite listener friends! Today on the show we have the enigmatic Erin Brockovich. In the year 2000, the award-winning film starring Julia Roberts told the true story of Erin’s involvement in a case against a Californian power company. Ever since, Erin has continued to work in the environmental sphere and has regularly visited Australia as the ambassador for Shine Lawyers.
In our chat with Erin, we asked her about her environmental activism, what it’s like coming into such a large sum of money so unexpectedly, and her relationship with the label “feminist icon”. And yes, we talk a bit about Julia Roberts too...
If you loved this chat with Erin, you can find more from her at @the_real_erin_brockovich on Instagram. After you follow Erin, may we recommend you also listen to our interview with the marvellous Em Rusciano too? You can feast your ears (eyes? who knows!) on that one right here.

item.title: Are you a troll?
item.description:
Helloooooo and HAPPY MONDAY WONDERFUL LISTENER PEOPLE!
Coming up on today’s show: the mummy blogger who outed herself as a troll. Plus, what do we make of American rapper T.I. admitting that he forces his 18-year-old daughter to undergo virginity tests? Then the debate on dresses with pockets that precisely none of you asked for!
This week, Zara recommends you... uhh... listen to Christmas music (???). Mich recommends you buy her el cheapo Michael Bublé perfume, By Invitation.
Today's episode was made possible by our sponsor Francesca Jewellery. Use our code SHAMELESS at checkout for 20% off your order.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Sophie Cachia
item.description:
Haaaaappy Thursday mates! Boy do we have a cracker of an episode in store.
Today we are joined by the force of nature that is Sophie Cachia - blogger, presenter and one of Australia’s most influential voices. Here, we talk about falling pregnant at the age of 22, finding your feet in a sea of commentary and feedback, and how to navigate a marriage breakdown when you’re still figuring out your sexuality.
For more from Sophie, follow her on Instagram @sophiecachia_.
Loved this? We think you’ll also enjoy our interview with Abbie Chatfield.
Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing. NOT A DAMN THING).
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
Thank you to our sponsor Brown Brothers for making today's episode possible. Find out more about Brown Brothers here and use our code 'SHAMELESS' at checkout for 20% off.
