item.title: Textbook faux-mance
item.description:
AS ALWAYS, HAPPY MONDAY LOVELY PEOPLE! On today’s show: Schapelle Corby re-releases her book, but where exactly is the money going? Plus, just a couple bandwagoners delving deep into Shawn Mendes and then the Chrissy Teigen and John Legend profile that piqued our interest.
And we are so excited to announce our live show partners for November in Sydney and Brisbane. Our shows will be presented by ANZ who are helping young Australians boost their financial wellbeing and The Body Shop, helping busy women relax and unwind since 1976.
This week, Mich recommends the playlist Bridget Hustwaite made for us called For Shameless xx on Spotify. We also suggest you check out the video of Jess Mauboy's prank on Will & Woody's radio show.
Today's episode was made possible by our sponsor Bon Maxie. Find out more about their handy organisation and storage solutions here. Oh, and don’t forget! Use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at checkout before the 28th of November 2019 for 15% off storewide.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?
Want to check out our shiny new podcast, Reality Check? Listen on Spotify here!
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing.)

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Marlee Silva
item.description:
Haaaaappy Thursday, wonderful humans!
Today on the show we have the ever impressive Marlee Silva. Marlee Silva is a Kamilaroi/Dunghutti woman and the founder of Tiddas 4 Tiddas, a movement that shines a light on the stories of Indigenous women across the country. Marlee is also a national youth advisor for the Red Cross and spends much of her time speaking across the country to change the conversation around the Indigenous experience. Here, we talk about everything from tokenism to channeling anger into activism and how Marlee struggles to balance a life outside of her work.
Follow Marlee on Instagram @marlee.silva.
Loved this? We think you'll also enjoy our chat with Flex Mami.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing. NOT A DAMN THING).
If you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
Thank you to our sponsor Pocket Prints for making today's episode possible. Find out more about Pocket Prints here.

item.title: Meet the new Jenna Dewan
item.description:
HAPPY HAPPY HAPPY Monday to our favourite Shameless people! On the agenda today: The Jenna Dewan and Channing Tatum divorce that was far grittier than their official statement ever let on. Plus, the landmark ruling that could shake up the reality TV industry and a meaty discussion on the merits and shortcomings of marriage.
This week, Zara recommends an old episode of Ladies We Need to Talk called Settling for Average, and Mich was SUPPOSED to recommend a banger playlist Triple J's Bridget Hustwaite made for us after our interview with her went live, but got so caught up in the "I'm not Joey" stuff she totally forgot. Sorry.
Today's episode was made possible by our sponsor Uber Stay by Le Tan. Find out more about their 10-day lasting tan here.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?
Want to check out our shiny new podcast, Reality Check? Listen on Spotify here!
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing.)
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

This week, Zara recommends an old episode of Ladies We Need to Talk called Settling for Average, and Mich was SUPPOSED to recommend a banger playlist Triple J's Bridget Hustwaite made for us after our interview with her went live, but got so caught up in the "I'm not Joey" stuff she totally forgot. Sorry.


Today's episode was made possible by our sponsor Uber Stay by Le Tan. Find out more about their 10-day lasting tan here.


Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Podcast Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram @shamelesspodcast instead?


Want to check out our shiny new podcast, Reality Check? Listen on Spotify here!


We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing.)


Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.


Your hosts are Zara Beach Hero McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).


Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Bridget Hustwaite
item.description:
Happy Thursday, wonderful people!
Today we're sitting down with Bridget Hustwaite, the host of Triple J's Good Nights, the founder of Endogram, and ambassador for Endometriosis Australia. We sat down with Bridget a little over a month ago in her Melbourne apartment to talk all things burnout, workism, music and endo and found her insights to be so illuminating.
Want more from Bridget? Of-bloody-course you do! Follow her on Instagram @bridgethustwaite or over at @endogram.
Loved this? We think you'll also enjoy our chat with Ash London.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram instead?

item.title: Kyle, Jackie O and PC pushback
item.description:
Happy new week, pals!
Coming up on today’s show: Kanye West would like his wife Kim Kardashian to stop being sexy, please and thank you. Then, how the country's most controversial radio personalities landed the biggest pay packets in Australian media history, and our thoughts on PR guru Roxy Jacenko’s Paddington Poo Jogger.
This week, Zara recommended Kate Leaver's story on marriage in Future Women. Mich recommended you go see HUSTLERS at the cinema!
Today's episode was made possible by our sponsor Thankyou. Be part of the movement to end global poverty by choosing Thankyou. Find out more here.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jan Fran
item.description:
HAPPY THURSDAY lovely people! Today on the show we are joined by the one and only Jan Fran. Of course, Jan Fran is an Australian journalist and presenter and presenter, best known for her work co-hosting SBS’ The Feed. Outside of that, though, Jan is also a bit of a podcast fiend, hosting The Few Who Do alongside Marc Fennell and having hosted Sexism and the City, too. Jan has shot and produced documentaries from all over the world, as well as occasionally appearing as a commentator on The Project Q&A, ABC Breakfast, Paul Murray Live, Studio 10, The Latest, The Today Show and The Drum.
In this chat, we go everywhere from how Jan got her big break in the media, to what a diverse media landscape looks to her, and why her dream gig would be at the forefront of a late-night female-driven comedy show.
Thank you to our sponsor Bekka May for making today's episode possible. Find out more about Bekka May here and use our code 'SHAMELESS' at checkout for 10% off the their range.
Want more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram here instead?

item.title: The best trash story of 2019
item.description:
IT'S A NEW WEEK! WEEEEEE! LET'S AVOID THE MISERY TOGETHER!
Coming up on today’s show: The Herald Sun story that made us tear our hair out. Plus! An explainer on the WAGatha Christie tweets you've definitely seen about Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy (AKA THE BEST TRASH STORY OF THE YEAR - NAY - THE MILLENNIUM), and a deep dive on Ellen DeGeneres's friendship with controversial former US President, George Bush.
This week, Zara recommended the book 'Whisper Network'. Mich recommended you listen to the latest Shameless Media podcast, Reality Check. (Not biased. Not biased at ALL.) Check it out on Spotify or Apple Podcasts!
Today's episode was made possible by our sponsor Trilogy Skincare. Get 15% off Trilogy by using the code SHAMELESS at checkout.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Abbie Chatfield
item.description:
Hellooooo! Happy Thursday, lovely Shameless listeners!
Today we’re sitting down with Abbie Chatfield - the 24-year-old runner up on this year’s season of The Bachelor. We wouldn’t hop on a plane to Brisbane for just any Bachelor contestant; but we did for Abbie because we think her time in the public eye has been fascinating. Abbie is considered one of the most controversial Bachelor contestants in history for one, curious reason: Abbie likes talking about sex.
In this chat, we talk a lot about shame: why and how the media deploys it against women and the unique power in rejecting it.
If you loved this interview, follow Abbie on Instagram @abbiechatfield.
Thank you to our sponsor Moscato One for making today's episode possible. Find out more about Moscato One here and use our code 'SHAMELESS' at checkout for 20% off the new range.
Want more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram here instead?

item.title: Erin Molan is not your punching bag
item.description:
Haaaaappy Monday, folks!
Coming up on today’s show: Kylie Jenner and Travis Scott split, and it’s a story not without a bunch of subplots. Plus, an explainer on the Erin Molan and Andrew Johns controversy (and how it exposes the NRL’s continued sexism problem) and the most ridiculous TV show on Australian television is The Masked Singer and we can’t stop talking about it.
This week, Zara recommended the book 'She Said'. Mich recommended Boy Swallows Universe because, yes, she is about 1000 years behind the curve.

item.content:encoded:
Haaaaappy Monday, folks!


Coming up on today’s show: Kylie Jenner and Travis Scott split, and it’s a story not without a bunch of subplots. Plus, an explainer on the Erin Molan and Andrew Johns controversy (and how it exposes the NRL’s continued sexism problem) and the most ridiculous TV show on Australian television is The Masked Singer and we can’t stop talking about it.


This week, Zara recommended the book 'She Said'. Mich recommended Boy Swallows Universe because, yes, she is about 1000 years behind the curve.


Want to win a Goodness Me Box subscription prize pack worth $1080? Enter here!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jo Weston
item.description:
Happy, happy, happy Thursday lovely people!
Today on the show we have the delightful Jo Weston. For those unaware, Jo is goal defence for the Australian Diamonds netball team, and has been a star of the Melbourne Vixens since she was basically a teenager.
Here, we talk to Jo all about what life is like as an athlete, how heartbreak and guilt overlap after a big loss and the work she thinks needs to be done in the space of women’s sport.
Jo is a total legend, and we think you will really love this chat.
Loved this? We think you'll also enjoy our chat with Brandon Jack, Edwina Bartholomew and Emma Hawkins.

item.title: Oh, sugar
item.description:
Haaaaaappy Monday, wonderful listeners!
Coming up on today's show: a little sugar hit from the Brownlow red carpet. Plus, why do so many men hate Greta Thunberg, and the Sarah Wilson ‘I Quit Sugar’ blaze that started in the Daily Mail and has sparked spot fires all over social media.
Zara recommended 'How to survive a Twitter storm' in The Guardian. Mich recommended checking out Gary Vee's podcast.
Read Eve Simmons' and The Daily Mail's piece on Sarah Wilson's I Quit Sugar movement here.
Today's episode is made possible by Business Chicks and their 9 To Thrive Summit. To buy your tickets, head to www.businesschicks.com and use the code ‘SHAMELESS’ at the checkout for $50 off your ticket. We hope to see all your lovely faces there!

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Brandon Jack
item.description:
Haaaaappy Thursday, friends!
Please welcome THE FIRST EVER MAN to Shameless In Conversations! How wild. What a niche. For those unfamiliar, Brandon Jack was born with sporting prowess in his blood; Brandon grew up with a father, Garry, who was a star player and coach in the rugby league. His brother Kieren was an AFL premiership player, and for a time was captain of the Sydney Swans. Brandon gave professional sport a crack himself - he played alongside Kieren at Sydney from 2013 to 2017 - before deciding his passion was writing. And feminist writing, at that.
Now, Brandon is a columnist for the Sydney Morning Herald, where he writes about locker-room culture, feminism, and violence against women, among other things like current affairs and sport. We hope you enjoy this chat as much as we loved having it.
Follow Brandon on Instagram @brandonjackk. Find some of his writing here.
Loved this? We think you'll also enjoy our chat with writers Jamila Rizvi and Carly Findlay.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing. NOT A DAMN THING).
If you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
Thank you to our sponsor Brown Brothers' Moscato One for making today's episode possible. Find out more about Brown Brothers' Moscato One here.
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: A Survivor GoFundMe
item.description:
HIYA! Happy Monday, lovely people.
Today's show is a biiiig one: How a Survivor contestant was the recipient of GoFundMe’s third biggest fundraiser ever, the Bachelor contestant with a suspiciously-timed weight-loss program and the influencer who sparked a racist furore this week.
Zara recommended following @thedailyaus on Instagram. Meanwhile, keep your eyes peeled on our socials for our charity merch! $10 from every tee will be going straight towards Sacred Heart Mission's Women's House.
Read 'Dear fellow white people: here's what to do when you're called racist' by Rebecca Hains.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram instead?

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Priya Serrao
item.description:
Hello! Happy Thursday!
Today we are joined by Miss Universe Australia, Priya Serrao, a woman who defies the mould of what constitutes a beauty queen. Priya is beautiful, yes, but it's her brain that we find most impressive: she has interned for the United Nations in developing countries, has a law degree under her belt, is a vocal force for greater diversity and representation in the media, and works toward enacting change via her day job in public policy.
If you enjoyed this chat as much as we did, follow Priya on Instagram @priyaserrao.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing. NOT A DAMN THING).
If you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
Thanks so much to Bed Threads for making today's episode possible! Use our code SHAMELESS at checkout for 10% off!

item.title: The bloodsport of hating Caroline Calloway
item.description:
It's a new week and we have a lot to talk about, pals!
Starting with Taylor Swift performing at the Melbourne Cup. Then, the Caroline Calloway saga that just won't die (with a lil recap for those of you who have no idea what any of that means), and the think piece about performative friendships that had us squealing in delight.
Zara recommended Will and Woody's video on depression for R U OK Day. Mich recommended you listen to Unravel: Snowball.
Read The Cut's personal essay on Caroline Calloway here, and Mic's piece on performative friendship here.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing. NOT A DAMN THING).
If you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jess Quinn
item.description:
Happy Thursday lovely Shameless fam! Today, we are joined by the remarkable Jess Quinn. When Jess was nine, her life was thrown into disarray by a cancer diagnosis. Within the year, she would lose all of her hair, and then, one of her legs. Now, Jess has turned her biggest hurdle into her biggest triumph - her career is built on the prosthetic limb she wears every day, helping her show her 180,000 Instagram followers that beauty comes in many different sizes and forms.
Here, we talk with the advocate and influencer about disability, resilience, diversity and inspiration. It’s a conversation that has stuck with us ever since we sat down in Jess’ Melbourne hotel room, and will continue to have an impact on us for a very long time.
If you loved Jess as much as we loved talking to her, you can catch her on Instagram here, and her petition is right here, ready to be signed!
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing. NOT A DAMN THING).
If you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Leigh Campbell
item.description:
Happy Thursday!
Today we are joined by the delightful Leigh Campbell. If we are talking expert voices in the beauty and lifestyle space, Leigh’s the ultimate go-to. You probably grew up reading her columns and insights in Cosmopolitan magazine, or, later on, in the Huffington Post Australia. Or, perhaps, you found Leigh not through her work as a journalist and editor, but as a blogger; last year, she penned the wildly popular series Treading Water about her experience with infertility and miscarriage.
Here, we chat with Leigh about work, guilt and grief, and what the last 12 months of her life have taught her about herself.
If you love Leigh as much as we do, follow her on Instagram @leighacampbell.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing. NOT A DAMN THING).
If you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
Thank you to our sponsor Liptember for making today's episode possible. Find out more about Liptember here.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Cyan Ta’eed
item.description:
Happy Thursday friends!
We’re joined today by serial entrepreneur Cyan Ta’eed, who has gone from working out of her parents’ basement in 2006 to building a tech empire in her online design and photography hub, Envato.
Over the last couple of years, Cyan has directed her energy and efforts into Hey Tiger, an ethical chocolate brand that functions as a social enterprise, where each bar sold helps community development projects for cocoa farming communities in West Africa.
Cyan is incredibly successful, yes, but she’s also kind, and oozes compassion with everything she does. Here, we discuss how she went from being in her mid-twenties with nothing to her name, to being in her late thirties with hundreds of employees, and everything in between.
Want more from Cyan? Follow her on Instagram @cyanctaeed.
Craving more? You’re only human. Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you chuck us a follow on Instagram instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing. NOT A DAMN THING).
Shameless Podcast is very much an independent vehicle that runs on the support of our incredible listeners - that's you! So, if you’d like to support the show, we would like that very much. Hit ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts or ‘follow’ on Spotify, and leave a review if you’re feeling especially generous. Then sit back and bask in our eternal, abundant love.
Your hosts are Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
Thank you to our sponsor Keep It Cleaner for making today's episode possible. Use our code SHAMELESS50 at checkout for 50% off your first month.
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Ash London
item.description:
Happy Thursday, lovely people!
Today, we’re sitting down with Ash London. If you’re unfamiliar with the name, Ash is a powerhouse in the radio industry, spearheading Ash London Live on the Hit Network. When she’s not behind a mic, she’s busy carving out quite the career across television too.
We sat down with Ash in our Sydney hotel room to chat about quitting your dream job, moving overseas in search for something more, and the beauty of serendipity.
Want to follow Ash? Of course you do! Find her @ash_london on Insta.
Oh, and us too? We're @shamelesspodcast.
Want to talk about today's episode? Jump into our Facebook group Shameless Podcast Community, where thousands of like-minded women discuss all things pop-culture, every day.
Thanks so much to our favourite ethical chocolate brand Hey Tiger for making today's episode possible. Use our code SHAMELESSDAD at checkout before the 8th of September to receive that extra chocolate bar. A treat for Dad and yourself!
Shameless Podcast is a production of Shameless Media.

Today, we’re sitting down with Ash London. If you’re unfamiliar with the name, Ash is a powerhouse in the radio industry, spearheading Ash London Live on the Hit Network. When she’s not behind a mic, she’s busy carving out quite the career across television too.


We sat down with Ash in our Sydney hotel room to chat about quitting your dream job, moving overseas in search for something more, and the beauty of serendipity.


Want to follow Ash? Of course you do! Find her @ash_london on Insta.


Oh, and us too? We're @shamelesspodcast.


Want to talk about today's episode? Jump into our Facebook group Shameless Podcast Community, where thousands of like-minded women discuss all things pop-culture, every day.


Thanks so much to our favourite ethical chocolate brand Hey Tiger for making today's episode possible. Use our code SHAMELESSDAD at checkout before the 8th of September to receive that extra chocolate bar. A treat for Dad and yourself!


Shameless Podcast is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: The unruly rebellion of Miley Cyrus
item.description:
Hi friends! Happy new week! What a time to be alive! We're almost at the end of winter, HOORAY!
Coming up on today's show: the sneaky new way to buy Instagram followers. Plus, how the royal family became embroiled in the Jeffrey Epstein saga, and why the media finds Miley Cyrus so goddamn difficult.
This week Mich recommended Sam Cavanagh's interview with the Daily Talk Show boys. Listen here.
We'd give you Zara's recommendation, but it's kinda... not a thing. It's not a thing whatsoever.
Craving more? We thought you might be! Join our glorious Shameless Facebook community here, where thousands of like-minded ladies keep each other up to date with the latest celebrity and pop culture stories. Or if Facebook isn't your thing why don't you follow us on Instagram here instead?
We know you didn't ask, but yes of course we have a weekly newsletter! So glad you asked. You can subscribe to it here for recommendations, columns and more super fun things (yes, we clickbaited you and we don't regret a thing. NOT A DAMN THING).
Your hosts are Zara McDonald (@zamcdonald) and Michelle Andrews (@michelleandrews1).
Thank you to our sponsor Thankyou for making today's episode possible. Find out more about the new Sage and Clare collaboration here.
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media. (Duh! It's in the name!)

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Tanya Hennessy
item.description:
Happy Thursday wonderful people!
Today we are joined by Tanya Hennessy, the woman who knows millennials inside out. If you haven't seen Tanya in your Facebook newsfeed with her witty videos, you've probably read her best-selling book 'Am I Doing This Right' or heard about her in-demand comedy tour, 'Low Expectations'. In this conversation, we cover everything from finding your career calling, to mental illness and trolling.
Want more from Tanya? OF COURSE YOU DO! Follow her on Insta @tanhennessy (Mich got this wrong in the ep, PLEASE FORGIVE HER!!!). You can also buy tickets to Tanya's critically-acclaimed show here: https://www.frontiercomedy.com/hullandhennessy
As for us? Zara is on Instagram @zamcdonald and Mich is @michelleandrews1. We'll be back in your ears on Monday!
Today's episode is made possible by RnB Fridays Live.
Shameless podcast is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: Shredding for the wedding
item.description:
Happy Monday wonderful people!
Coming up on today’s episode: the influencer who ended her career by uploading the wrong Youtube video. Plus, the New York Times wants you to get “strong” for your wedding day, but by “strong” we’re pretty sure they mean “skinny”. Also, what’s with all these television reboots?
Mich recommended this profile on Taylor Swift: https://www.vogue.com/article/taylor-swift-cover-september-2019
Zara recommended this episode of ABC's Conversations with Richard Fidler: https://www.abc.net.au/radio/programs/conversations/adele-ferguson-exposing-the-banks/11368384
This episode of Shameless was made possible by Libra's #bloodnormal campaign. Help break down the great period taboo by purchasing a Bloody Awesome t-shirt at bloodnormal.com.au.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Emma Isaacs
item.description:
HAPPY THURSDAY! Today on the show we have the inimitable Emma Issacs.
Emma is a serial entrepreneur: she is the global CEO of Business Chicks, Australia’s largest business community for women and last year published her first book, Winging It.
We sat down with Emma in our tiny makeshift studio at Zara’s house to chat all things success, failure and building brands.
For more from Emma, you can buy her book here or follow her on Instagram.
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: A $3.2 million Youtube wedding
item.description:
HAPPPPY MONDAAAAAY!
On today's episode of Shameless: the two Youtube stars who got (fake?) married, our thoughts on the new season of The Bachelor Australia, and the popularisation of polyamory.
Mich recommended the latest ep of She's On The Money, 'A rookies guide to investing', here: https://podcasts.apple.com/au/podcast/shes-on-the-money/id1468033698 Zara recommended this pod interview with Ricky Gervais: https://samharris.org/podcasts/163-ricky-gervais/

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Georgia Love
item.description:
Happy, happy, happy Thursday! Today on the show we are joined by the one and only Georgia Love. You probably have all the background in the world on who Georgia Love is, but let us quickly recap: Georgia is a journalist, our former Bachelorette and television personality who is sunny and kind and one of the warmest people we have ever met.
In this episode we talk about everything from grief, to starring on reality TV and falling in love to what comes next.
For more from Georgia, you can find her on Instagram at @georgiealove. And us? Well, we’re @shamelesspodcast.
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: Rumours, smoke and fire
item.description:
Happy Monday beautiful people!
Coming up on today's episode: the Novak Djokovic rumours that just won't go away. Plus, is Masterchef doomed now that its three hosts have walked away? And how Diet Prada is achieving what mainstream media never could.
Mich recommended two things this week! The MCoBeauty Instant Brows pencil (here: https://modelco.com/shop/mcobeauty/instantbrows) and Grotti Lotti prints for your next impressive present (here: https://grottilotti.com.au).
Zara recommended the Phoebe Waller-Bridge/Fleabag episode of How To Fail with Elizabeth Day. Listen here: https://howtofail.podbean.com
Thanks to today's sponsor, White Runway, for making this episode of Shameless possible. If you have a special event coming up, check out their online boutique or visit the team in store for a personalised shopping experience. Oh, and don't forget you get TWENTY PERCENT OFF all full-priced items (!!!!) with the code 'SHAMELESS' at checkout, or by mentioning this podcast episode at your appointment: https://whiterunway.com.au/
Mich used copyright-free music from Chill Out Records for today's (very mediocre) remix.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: PJ Harding
item.description:
Happy Thursday, Shameless family!
Today we're sitting down with Polly 'PJ' Harding, one half of KIIS FM's Jase and PJ breakfast show. In this chat, we covered everything from moving overseas to pursue your passion, what it's like to have a story about your 'coregasm' go viral, and being asked to hone your best (or... worst) Aussie accent by watching episodes of Home and Away.
If you love Polly as much as we do, find her on Instagram @pjdeeday. We are @shamelesspodcast!
Thanks so much to Clinique for making this episode of Shameless possible. Personalise your skincare and check out Clinique ID - the custom blend hydrator - today: https://www.clinique.com.au/cliniqueid

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Georgie Dent
item.description:
Today on the show we have the warm, generous and stupidly clever Georgie Dent. Georgie is a former lawyer, a journalist, an old editor of ours and the author of the new and best-selling memoir, Breaking Badly.
At 24, things were going pretty good for Georgie. She’d landed a job at a prestigious Sydney law firm, was living with her boyfriend and had so much head of her. But, in her own words, she broke. By 25, Georgie was unemployed, back living with her parents and suffering such crippling anxiety that she ended up in a psychiatric hospital.
To quote the book’s own blurb, Breaking Badly is the story of a nervous breakdown in slow motion.
This is Georgie's story.
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Em Rusciano
item.description:
Today's In Conversation episode is with one firecracker of a human, Em Rusciano.
We adore Em for her wit and intelligence, but most of all her honesty and vulnerability. She is one of a kind and we hope you enjoy this chat about career, family and life in the public eye. Oh, and a note before we dive in - Em talks with her hands, which means you might hear some noises here and there! Just pretend you’re right there in the studio with us!
If you adore Em as much as we do, follow her on Instagram @emrusciano. You’ll find us at @shamelesspodcast!
You can also check out tickets for her new show, Rage and Rainbows, here.

item.title: Byron Bay Murfers
item.description:
Happy Monday! On today’s show: the strange furore around the re-imagination of Disney’s Ariel, how Taylor Swift’s fans are pushing her feud with Scooter Braun into dangerous territory and the Byron Bay influencers who graced the pages of the world’s best article in Vanity Fair.
Thanks so much to the very lovely Stephanie Alexopoulos for this week's remix! If you want to get involved and remix one of Zara's best sayings, please email your mp3 submission to hello@shamelessmediaco.com - we thank you in advance for the lols at her expense.
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

Happy Monday! On today’s show: the strange furore around the re-imagination of Disney’s Ariel, how Taylor Swift’s fans are pushing her feud with Scooter Braun into dangerous territory and the Byron Bay influencers who graced the pages of the world’s best article in Vanity Fair.


Thanks so much to the very lovely Stephanie Alexopoulos for this week's remix! If you want to get involved and remix one of Zara's best sayings, please email your mp3 submission to hello@shamelessmediaco.com - we thank you in advance for the lols at her expense.


Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Brooke Blurton
item.description:
Happy Thursday!
Today on the show we have the very lovely, very bubbly, Brooke Blurton. You may remember Brooke from her time on The Bachelor and The Bachelor in Paradise, but in truth, Brooke’s story is about far more than her short foray on reality TV.
Our conversation covers her childhood, her identity and her love of her job as a youth worker.
If you love Brooke as much as we do, find her on Instagram @brooke.blurton. We are @shamelesspodcast!
Thanks again to Urban You for sponsoring this episode of Shameless. Use the code SHAMELESS at checkout to receive $30 off your first clean! https://urbanyou.com.au/
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: Ruminations on an inferior dip
item.description:
WE BAAAAAAACK. It's been a two-week break but it feels like a lifetime lovely people. So, what's on the agenda today? How a couple of former AFL Footballers proved exactly why this podcast exists, the accusations that Taylor Swift is co-opting the gay rights movement and why the hell hummus and Keanu Reeves have gone viral.
Mich recommends Breaking Badly by Georgie Dent and Zara recommends More Than Enough by Elaine Welteroth.
To go in the running to win that killer winter getaway with Baby-G, click here!
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Flex Mami
item.description:
Happy Thursday, lovely Shameless listeners!
Today, we’re sitting down with the inimitable Flex Mami - a wildly talented DJ, television personality, podcaster and author. We sat down at her home in Sydney to talk about career, intersectional feminism, and harnessing your own unique voice.
Follow Flex Mami on Instagram @flex.mami and listen to her brilliant podcast, Bobo and Flex, on Apple Podcasts and Spotify.
Thanks so much to Nourished Life for sponsoring this episode of Shameless.

item.title: Stars are blind
item.description:

On today’s show: why do we care so much about Kim Kardashian’s spelling mistakes? Plus, the rise and rise of astrology amongst young women, and why an airplane flight and plate of beef has seen Emma Thompson be labelled a “first class hypocrite”.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jadé Tunchy
item.description:
Happy Thursday, Shameless family!
Today, we’re sitting down with the very witty, very warm Jadé Tuncdoruk - a woman who has garnered an audience of almost 500,000 on Instagram through her funny captions, stunning photography, and down-to-earth musings. We cover everything from bullying, to seeking psychological help and building a personal brand from the ground up.
Find Jadé on Instagram @jadetunchy and @therealjadetunchy. We are @shamelesspodcast.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Kate Wasley
item.description:
Happy Thursday you Shameless humans! On the show today we have the legend that is Kate Wasley. You might know Kate from her time as one half of AnyBody.co, a movement she co-founded that encouraged women to brace their bodies, no matter the size. As an in-demand model and influencer herself, Kate has graced the coveted pages of the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Edition in 2018.
But perhaps her most important role is the one she plays in our conversations about body image online. We caught up with Kate on her latest trip to Melbourne where, in her hotel room with her best friend Tahlia by her said, she proved - through kindness and no bullshit - how she’s built the career she has.
You can follow Kate on Instagram here.
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: The Veronicas
item.description:
Hello Shameless family!
Today we are joined by the powerhouses that make up The Veronicas - arguably Australia’s most recognisable female band. We caught up with twin sisters Jess and Lisa Origliasso in Brunswick to chat about the meaning behind their new hit single, Think Of Me, and what it’s like to become very very famous when you’re just teenagers.
Thanks so much to today's sponsors, Forever New, for making this episode possible.
Shameless is a production of Shameless Media.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Laura Byrne
item.description:
This week on the show, we are joined by the absolutely delightful Laura Byrne.
You might remember Laura from her time on The Bachelor, where she won Matty J’s heart and the affection of the country, too. Outside of reality television though, Laura runs Toni May, a jewellery company full of hand-crafted pieces that started selling at markets for a fun outside of her day job.
We meet a lot of people in this job, but we have to say, Laura is one of the kindest, warmest, most down to earth women we’ve had the pleasure of chatting to. We caught up with her in Sydney not long ago - just before she got engaged!!! - to talk all things love, business, miscarriage and pregnancy.
You can follow Laura at @ladyandacat on Instagram.
This episode was produced by Zara McDonald.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Natalie Fornasier
item.description:
Today, we are joined by a person who has influenced Zara and I more than any “Instagram influencer” or “YouTube vlogger” ever has. Her name is Natalie Fornasier, and she has 839 Instagram followers. Your eyebrows might be raised right now, and you might be wondering how a normal Sydney girl with a normal social media following could be so influential.
Well, last year, Natalie sat down with Byrdie.com.au for a story titled “I’m 24 and Living With Advanced Melanoma—This Is My Story”. Natalie’s words and insights in that interview were what informed our very last segment of Shameless in 2018, and what pushed Zara to change her own relationship with sun tanning forever.
Today, we sit down with Natalie, who is now 25, but still grappling with her stage four cancer diagnosis. We talk about friends, finding love, and what you can do to spread the word.
We have chosen to forgo an episode sponsor today, and have dedicated the episode to Call Time On Melanoma.
To support Call Time On Melanoma, visit www.calltimeonmelanoma.com.au, or follow them on Instagram @calltimeonmelanoma.
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews.

Today, we sit down with Natalie, who is now 25, but still grappling with her stage four cancer diagnosis. We talk about friends, finding love, and what you can do to spread the word.
We have chosen to forgo an episode sponsor today, and have dedicated the episode to Call Time On Melanoma.
To support Call Time On Melanoma, visit www.calltimeonmelanoma.com.au, or follow them on Instagram @calltimeonmelanoma.
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews.

Your eyebrows might be raised right now, and you might be wondering how a normal Sydney girl with a normal social media following could be so influential.


Well, last year, Natalie sat down with Byrdie.com.au for a story titled “I’m 24 and Living With Advanced Melanoma—This Is My Story”. item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Rowi Singh
item.description:
Happy In Conversation Thursday lovely people! On today's show, we are joined with Rowi Singh. It’s hard to condense what and who Rowi is in a quick soundbite, but we will give it a shot.
Rowi is an influencer, yes, but she’s not your average influencer. She might have more than a hundred thousand followers on Instagram, but she’s not about detox teas and teeth whitener. Instead, Rowi’s brand is her creativity. She’s a wildly talented makeup artist, who bluntly refuses to colour inside any of the lines. She’s also a proud Punjabi woman who is ready to call time on cultural appropriation, who is never afraid to embrace colour, and is unapologetic in both her feminism and her femininity.
This chat is political and candid and vivacious - just like the woman you see on Instagram and YouTube.
We hope you enjoy!
If you want to grab some beauty goodies from Sportsgirl, remember to use the code SHAMELESS20 for a sweet 20% off! https://sportsgirl.in/SPORTSGIRL__BEAUTY
This is episode was produced by Zara McDonald.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: DJ Tigerlily
item.description:
Haaaaappy Thursday friends! Wow, do we have a treat for you today.
If you’ve ever been to a nightclub, or a music festival, the chances are you know the name, but perhaps you don’t know the story behind one of our country’s most successful musical exports.
In this chat, we explore who DJ Tigerlily is - yes - but we also get to know Dara Hayes, the woman behind the elaborate wigs and costumes. You’ll find that Dara, the 27-year-old who lives with her boyfriend and their one-year-old Groodle, is enigmatic; a refreshing blend of passion, charm, and honesty.
Thank you so much to Shopback, today's episode sponsor. To redeem your exclusive $10 offer head to www.shopback.com.au/shameless.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Effie Kats
item.description:
Today we are joined by the force of nature that is Effie Kats. For those unfamiliar, Effie is a design powerhouse. She’s the brains behind her self-titled bespoke suiting brand, as well as Bayse Brand for perfectly cut basics and Dead End Lovers, the home of gorgeous jewellery.
But the road to here wasn’t an easy one. At 23, she created cult brand Zachary The Label. Four years later, she lost everything.
Follow Effie on Instagram @effiekats: https://www.instagram.com/effiekats/
Thanks so much to Bondi Boost for making this interview possible. Use code 'SHAMELESS' at checkout to receive 15% off your order: https://bondiboost.com.au/
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Tully Smyth
item.description:
If you don’t know Tully Smyth by name, we will bet you know her story. Rising to fast fame on Big Brother, Smyth found herself the centre of one of the original international and viral storms, after entering into a relationship with a fellow contestant while still having a girlfriend on the outside. Some six years later, Tully Smyth has proved to be far more than her Big Brother story. She is now an influencer, a content creator, a vocal advocate for mental health and people suffering from early onset Alzheimer's. Tully knows how to tell a story, and we can’t wait for you to hear the ones she has to tell today.
You can follow Tully on Instagram @tee_smyth and us @shamelesspocast. Enjoy!

item.description:
Hello and welcome to this In Conversation episode of Shameless. Today we are joined by one of the leading women in Australia's tech industry, Michelle Battersby. Michelle is the force behind Bumble Australia, and will be instrumental in the brands push into the Asia Pacific region. Here, we talk about the forces that shaped her from childhood, what drives her, and the machinations behind fostering a cult brand.
Follow Michelle on Instagram @michellebattersby, and check out Bumble on socials @bumble_australia.
See you on Monday friends! Thanks to Bellabox for making this episode possible.
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews.

item.title: Take a seat at our red table
item.description:
Happy Monday gorgeous Shameless family!
Coming up on today's show: why are drugs suddenly being used to market products to millennials? What should we take away from the Jordyn Woods red table talk? And, finally, how pop-culture and bi-erasure intersect.
Read Billi Fitzsimons' hilarious story on influencer invasions: https://www.mamamia.com.au/instagram-influencer/
Pop-culture is afraid of bisexuality: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2014/sep/23/popular-culture-afraid-of-bisexuality-john-constantine
Watch the 'Bi the way, we exist' TED Talk: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XMbfDV55kmc
Thanks so much to Goodness Me Box for being today's sponsor; use the code SHAMELESS to get your first box for just $15. Head to goodnessmebox.com, or find them @GoodnessMeBox on Insta and FB!
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews... who apologises once again for her ridiculously husky voice.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Jamila Rizvi
item.description:
This week on the show, there’s a little less of the dumb stuff because we are joined by the inimitable Jamila Rizvi. In her own words, Jamila is an author, presenter and political commentator. She is is author of the best-selling Not Just Lucky, a career manifesto for millennial women and The Motherhood, an anthology of letters about life with a newborn. Jamila is currently Editor-at-Large of the Nine Network’s Future Women where you may have heard her as host of their podcast Future Women Weekly.
You can follow her on Instagram here and Twitter here.

item.title: More MAFS madness
item.description:
Happy Monday beautiful people! Coming up on today's show: the strange rumour surrounding Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga, the Married At First Sight storyline that went far beyond the realms of entertainment and the money op-ed that stole our attention this week.

Why does it feel like everyone has more money than you, by Jen Doll: https://www.harpersbazaar.com/culture/features/a26091060/money-millennials-parents-career-success/
Majority of first-home buyers now use the bank of mum and dad, via Domain: https://www.domain.com.au/money-markets/majority-of-firsthome-buyers-now-use-bank-of-mum-and-dad-20180502-h0zjun-432274/
Follow us on Instagram @shamelesspodcast or join our Facebook group by searching for 'Shameless Podcast Community'.
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews.

item.title: The fall of a makeup mogul
item.description:
Happy Monday friends!
Coming up on today's episode: the protective brother trope on Married At First Sight, the fall of an Aussie makeup icon, and why Ariana Grande is being sued over a candle. Well, kind of.
Mich recommended the period tracking app Flo this week.
Read Katy Hall's incredible piece of journalism here: https://www.couriermail.com.au/entertainment/television/mafs-2019-jessika-powers-brother-rhyce-has-a-restraining-order-against-him-as-he-denies-abuse-claims/news-story/6acf8d81617df53ebf76e8031eaa867c
Read here for the New York Times' piece on fashion and copyright: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/20/business/kiini-bikini-lawsuit-ipek-irgit-solange-ferrarini.html
And then here for the Huffington Post on copycat fashion and the law: https://www.huffingtonpost.com.au/entry/fast-fashion-copycats_us_5b8967f9e4b0511db3d7def6
For tickets to our live show, keep an eye out on our Instagram (@shamelesspodcast) or in our Facebook group 'Shameless Podcast Community'!
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Carly Findlay
item.description:
Most people would introduce Carly as a disability advocate, and they'd be right, but she’s also so much more than that: she’s an author, a podcaster, and a generally wonderful human being. In this chat, which took place in the very trendy suburb of Brunswick, we talk about friendships and loneliness, what it's like to bump into your school bully, and the people who try to "cure" her genetic condition.
Buy Carly's marvellous new book Say Hello (really, it's amazing, do it right now) right here: https://www.booktopia.com.au/say-hello-carly-findlay/prod9781460755037.html
Follow Carly on Instagram here: https://www.instagram.com/carlyfindlay/?hl=en
And on Twitter here: https://twitter.com/carlyfindlay/
Until Monday, friends!
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews.

item.title: All hail Queen Anna
item.description:
It might be a public holiday but we are here and we are so happy to be. On today's show: The machinations of celebrity feuds, and why the one between Kim Kardashian and Taylor Swift is over for good. Plus, the icon that is Anna Wintour, and how trolling online will soon be considered illegal.
You can vote for the Aus Podcast awards here: https://bit.ly/2DCjaal
This episode was produced by Zara McDonald.

item.title: #UltraToneDeaf
item.description:
It's Monday! On today’s show: Chris Pratt is engaged after being single for what feels like two minutes, so why in the world do we care? Plus, the influencers abusing their power for no good and the UltraTune ads we are finally ready to fight back on.
This episode was produced by Zara McDonald.

item.title: To share or not to share
item.description:
Guess who's back, back again. We are back. Don't tell Zara I wrote this.
Guess who's back, guess who's back, guess who's back, guess who's back.
YEP! It's 2019 and we are keen to talk about a few things, like: Why is Em Rusciano mad? What in the WHAT is a v-string bikini? Does mummy blogging cross the line? And did Kendall Jenner just save the world with a Proactiv ad? (Hint for that last one: no.)
Em Rusciano's interview with Offspring is here. Bianca O'Neill on Beginning Boutique and body diversity is here. Mich's review of the v-string bikini will be posted in our FB group when it goes live. Join here. Christie Tate for the Washington Post is here, while Pandora Syke's column is here. We also talked about Darlena Cunha's writing for Sydney Morning Herald and Elizabeth Bastos for New York Times. And, finally, click here for Danielle Young's take on bad publicity and the Kardashians.
That's all for now! We will be dropping our In Conversation episode on Thursday. Until then, subscribe to our newsletter or follow us on Insta! BYE xxxxxx
This episode of Shameless was produced by Michelle Andrews.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: You guys!
item.description:
Before we say anything else, thank you. Thank you, thank you, thank you for listening to our podcast and supporting us in 2018. We love bringing you new content every week - it's not always easy, but it is so incredibly fulfilling and enjoyable.
We are now on a bit of a break until January 14. Until then, you can keep up to date on all things pop culture and celebrity in our Facebook Group 'Shameless Podcast Community', or by following us on Instagram @shamelesspodcast.
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews. Royalty free music is from Bensound.

item.title: Leave Love Actually alone
item.description:
Merry Christmas listener friends! We need to talk about Karl Stefanovic’s unceremonious dumping from TODAY, the Love Actually debate that’s making us feel slightly exhausted, and the tricky terrain of tanning culture.
Listen to Allison P. Davis on Longform here: https://longform.org/posts/longform-podcast-323-allison-p-davis I For those interested, here is Molly Ringwald’s piece revisiting The Breakfast Club, decades on: https://www.newyorker.com/culture/personal-history/what-about-the-breakfast-club-molly-ringwald-metoo-john-hughes-pretty-in-pink
Feel like you’ll miss us over the next fortnight? You can catch us on Instagram @shamelesspodcast or join our Facebook group by searching ‘Shameless Podcast Community’!
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews with royalty free music from BenSound.

item.title: Kendall Jenner’s favourite dress
item.description:
Well, well, well it's the second last episode of the year and what a year it's been.
On today’s show: The strange case of the Daily Telegraph trying to take on an influencer for doing their job, Kendall Jenner takes the red carpet in another naked dress and the Miss Universe controversy making international headlines.
For our last In Conversation episode of 2018, we're giving the mic to YOU! Record a voice message/ask a question and send it to shamelessthepodcast@gmail.com and tell us your name and where you are from. WE WANT TO HEAR FROM YOU.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Sarah Holloway
item.description:
Welcome back to our third interview episode of Shameless!
This week, we're joined by lawyer-turned-entrepreneur, Sarah Holloway. Sarah is the brains behind global tea brand Matcha Maiden and award-winning cafe Matcha Mylkbar. We chatted about her being adopted from South Korea as a baby, rejecting one of the most prestigious offers a lawyer can get, and working alongside her fiancé.
If you love Sarah as much as we do, you can follow her on Instagram @spoonful_of_sarah, or subscribe to her amazing podcast, Seize The Yay.
This episode of Shameless was produced by Michelle Andrews with royalty free music from Bensound.

item.title: The perfect Instagram wedding
item.description:
Happy Monday Shameless fam!
This week we need to talk about The Teacher's Pet, Instagram weddings, and the triumphant rise of Ariana Grande.
Want to support the TAC and push fellow Victorians to drive safely this Christmas? Visit the display in Southbank, right near the Meat + Wine Co.
We strongly recommend you read Caroline Overington's piece on The Teacher's Pet. Click here for Andrew Brown's take on everything that's wrong with weddings. And here for Kate Robertson's analysis of Ariana Grande's rise. And finally, The New York Times' breakdown of Grande's politics.
Want more of us? Follow Shameless on Instagram @shamelesspodcast, or hop into our private group by searching 'Shameless Podcast Community' on Facebook. Or subscribe to our newsletter, we are seriously everywhere.
Thank you to Urban You for making this episode possible. To receive $30 off your first clean, use the code Shameless30 at checkout.
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews with royalty free music from Bensound.

We strongly recommend you read Caroline Overington's piece on The Teacher's Pet. Click here for Andrew Brown's take on everything that's wrong with weddings. And here for Kate Robertson's analysis of Ariana Grande's rise. And finally, The New York Times' breakdown of Grande's politics.
Want more of us? Follow Shameless on Instagram @shamelesspodcast, or hop into our private group by searching 'Shameless Podcast Community' on Facebook. Or subscribe to our newsletter, we are seriously everywhere.

item.title: IN CONVERSATION: Olivia Rogers
item.description:
Welcome back to our very special In Conversation episode of Shameless.Today we are joined by the very talented Olivia Rogers, who you may well know as last year’s Miss Universe Australia. There is, you should know, far more to Liv than being a beauty queen. She’s a speech pathologist, this year’s VRC ambassador for the Melbourne Cup, an occasional model and owner of Melbourne’s cutest dog.
We think you'll love it (and her).
This episode was produced by Zara McDonald with royalty free music from Bensound.

On this ep we talk about the Diet Prada + Dolce and Gabbana scandal, why Roxy Jacenko has a hold on the Aussie media, and all about our obsession with The Bold Type.
Wanna subscribe to our newsletter? You can do so here (if that link doesn't work, you'll find it in our Insta bio).
Want to get behind the #OrangeCard? When you see someone speaking of a woman in a disrespectful way - online or otherwise - call it out! Hashtag #OrangeCard and get people talking.
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews, with royalty free music from BenSound.

item.title: Inside the Birdcage
item.description:
Oh my goodness WHAT A WEEK!
On this episode we're covering the bachelorettes who can't help but spread dangerous health advice, whether or not the Melbourne Cup Carnival is unethical (and our experience in the Birdcage) and, finally, the Victoria's Secret Catwalk.
RECOMMENDATIONS: This week, Mich recommended this episode of the The Tim Ferriss Show podcast with Seth Godin. Zara recommended the fiction book Normal People by Sally Rooney.
Oh, and we are launching a RECOMMENDATIONS NEWSLETTER. Weeeee. You can subscribe to that right here. If that link doesn't work (damn podcast app) head over to our Insta bio @shamelesspodcast - we will also put the link there.
To listen to Louise Adams' podcast, click here. Again, here is the fantastic piece on reaction culture written by Man Repeller's Haley Nahman.
Thank you so much for joining us for episode 35! Before we go - we’re a little independent podcast. It’s just Zara and I sitting in her family's office. So if you love Shameless and want to help us grow, you can do a few things: The first is click ‘subscribe’ on Apple Podcasts, that helps new listeners find our show every week..
The second thing is you can tell a friend! Invite them to our Facebook group, Shameless Celebrity Gossip, or let other people know about us on your Insta Story. Lastly, send them this episode if they need some smart celebrity news in their life.
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews, with royalty free music from BenSound.

item.title: The psychology of hate-following
item.description:
HAPPY MONDAY wonderful humans, boy do we have a show for you today.
First, we need to talk about J-Lo and that glittery green cape. Then, Charlie-Sheen-related-frustration makes Mich cry, and we look at the phenomenon of hate-following.
The piece Zara recommended on outrage culture is here. The No Filter episode about James Packer's life is here. The Cut on Tuesdays' episode on extremism is here. Listen to Tim Ferriss in conversation with Karlie Kloss here.
God this is gonna be a lotta links. Bear with us.
ALRIGHTY.
The New York Times' Anna Holmes on Charlie Sheen's misogyny. Vanity Fair's 2011 Charlie Sheen profile (written by Mark Seal). Tom Meagher's sentiment on Charlie Sheen's Australian visa is here.
Then we've got Rachel Siemens for Man Repeller on hate-following. Sophie Wilkinson for Grazia on the same topic. And, last but not least, Vice on why it might not be all that bad for us.
Thanks to Lou Lou Lips for making this episode of Shameless possible. Episode 34 was produced by Michelle Andrews, with royalty-free music from BenSound.
For anyone who is still reading and is therefore a VIP listener, thank you, thank you, thank you. You make our jobs a true joy and we couldn't do any of this without you x

item.title: Kayla Itsines and her $486 million
item.description:
Monday! Happy Monday! On today's show: How Kayla Itsines built a $400 million empire despite the controversies that shadow her fiance and business partner. Plus, the influencers who preach career advice in books, and why are women so obsessed with true crime?
You read about Zara's report on Kayla ripping off costumers here, and the AFR's Young Rich list here.
This week, Mich recommended Man Repeller and Zara recommended The Cut On Tuesdays.
For articles mentioned on the show:
Cameron Russell's TED Talk
Life lessons from Tim Minchin
Grisly Murders and Serial Killers? Ooh, Tell Me More from The New York Times
Why do we — women in particular — love true crime books?

item.title: Stalkers, paps, and liars
item.description:
Happy Monday lovers!
This week, we're talking about the evolution of Lady Gaga, the closure of Cosmo, and the ethics of the celebrity paparazzi.
This week Mich recommends watching Exposed: The case of Keli Lane on ABC iView.
Zara recommends this profile on Chrissy Teigen and this interview with the man who welcomed back Louis CK,
To read Allie Jones' take on whether Cosmo is "deeply feminist", click here. To read an interview with the woman who reinvigorated Cosmo, Amy Odell, click here.
Why We Need Tabloids, by Ryan Linkof in the New York Times.
Listen to Keira Knightley on the Awards Chatter Podcast.
This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews, with royalty free music from Bensound.

item.title: Crazy Rich Australians
item.description:
Good morning lovely people. Happy Monday! On this week's show: Taylor Swift finally gets political, why this year’s season of The Bachelorette is the lowest rating in history, and the Aussie socialites that are dripping with both money and narcissism.
This week, Zara recommended Longform's interview with Rebecca Traister and Michelle recommended Any Ordinary Day by Leigh Sales.
Wanna read what we spoke about in the pod? Links below.
Why celebrities wade into politics: https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2017/09/22/why-celebrities-wade-into-politics-and-why-people-listen-to-them-even-conservatives/?utm_term=.3d06a0f24d5e
The Social Set: https://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/celebrity/what-s-not-to-like-the-social-network-that-really-counts-20181008-p508c8.html
Thanks so much to STA Travel for sponsoring this episode of Shameless. This episode was produced by Zara McDonald, with royalty free music from BenSound.

item.title: The. Worst. Bachelor. Ever.
item.description:
Good morning to everyone except Nick Cummins!
Kidding, kidding. In all seriousness, though, what the HECK happened on The Bachelor last week? Plus, can you be a feminist and love rap music, and what's with the return of the noughties' biggest Hollywood stars? Mischa Barton and Lindsay Lohan are ev-er-y-where.
Our recommendations for the week: How To Be Perfect by Holly Wainwright and Nine Perfect Strangers by Liane Moriarty.
Wanna read what we spoke about in the pod? Links below.
Tricia Rose for The Guardian: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2012/jan/17/jay-z-bitch-rapper-hip-hop
Ann Friedman for The Cut: https://www.thecut.com/2013/07/blurring-the-lines-enjoying-maybe-sexist-music.html
The New York Times on women in the music industry: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/25/arts/music/music-industry-gender-study-women-artists-producers.html
Tirhakah Love for The Guardian: https://www.theguardian.com/music/2017/oct/19/post-malone-rockstar-numb-the-pain-with-the-money-how-hip-hop-turned-nihilistic
Jill Filipovic on women's public meltdowns: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2013/may/29/amanda-bynes-meltdown-why-we-watch
Thanks so much to STA Travel for sponsoring this episode of Shameless. This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews, with royalty free music from BenSound.

item.title: The case for worst dressed lists
item.description:
As always lovely people, happy Monday!
This week: Are WAG best and worst dressed lists inherently anti-feminist? Plus, the brands that are trying to sell products on the back of mental illness, and why the world is obsessed with actress Jameela Jamil.
Some stories we mentioned today:
The Anxiety That Binds - https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/11/style/anxiety-love-carmen-maria-machado.html
Why companies like Bumble and 7-Eleven are trying to sell you skin care and makeup - https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2018/9/27/17903530/beauty-bumble-7-eleven-spotify-expedia
Ways to Change the World: Jameela Jamil - https://www.channel4.com/news/ways-to-change-the-world-jameela-jamil

item.title: It’s time to talk about the Bachelor villains
item.description:
Hola! On this week's show: Did Chrissy Teigen finally give us an opportunity to talk about drinking alcohol in excess, the women whose reputations are ruined by their tenure on reality television and Cosmopolitan cover that’s generated more discussion than almost any other cover this year.
You can find Sali Hughes piece about the Tess Holliday cover here, and Wil Anderson's conversation with Jules Lund here.
To follow us on Instagram, click here. To join our wonderful little Facebook group, click here. If you guys could share a snap listening to this ep on your Instagram story, we would SO APPRECIATE IT. We can't tell you how much that helps us spread the word and grow our little baby pod. Thanks for always being so lovely and supportive. This episode was produced by Zara McDonald with royalty free music from Bensound.
See you next week!

item.title: The celebrity guide to splitting up
item.description:
It's Monday morning and while that means the weekly grind is churning again, we're happy to ease the pain with another episode.
On this week's show: Why everyone’s getting sick of The Bachelor, what on Earth do we do with men in the public eye who have fucked up, and the breakup statements so saccharine we feel a little queasy.
You can read Clementine Ford's piece on Louis C.K here, Dana Schwartz's piece on the same topic here and Tom Meagher's piece on the monster myth here. Also, here's Lena Dunham's column on break ups for Vogue.
To follow us on Instagram, click here. To join our wonderful little Facebook group, click here.
If you guys could share a snap listening to this ep on your Instagram story, we would SO APPRECIATE IT. We can't tell you how much that helps us spread the word and grow our little baby pod. Thanks for always being so lovely and supportive.
This episode was produced by Zara McDonald with royalty free music from Bensound. See you next week!

item.title: The tear-down of Tammy Hembrow
item.description:
Heyo! It's Monday. Happy Monday!
It's a big show for you and it starts where it obviously should: Is this year's Bachelor a tiny bit problematic? Mich says no, Zara says maybe. We also debrief on Four Corner's brilliant investigation in cosmetic surgery and influencers, and the subsequent response of our country's biggest beauty bloggers to the furore. If you're interested in watching, check it out here. Plus, the story that put Tammy Hembrow on the international stage this week - and not in a good way.
As always, you're so welcome to join the conversation in our Facebook group! Otherwise, you can follow Michelle on Instagram here, Zara on Instagram here or get in touch at shamelessthepodcast@gmail.com.
OH and we’re on Instagram now, too. Follow us here.
We're a tiny, little independent podcast who rely on YOU GUYS so others can find us. If you have the time, we'd love it if you could subscribe to the show.
This episode was produced by Zara McDonald with royalty free music from Bensound.

item.title: Sam, Tara and messy public break ups
item.description:
Happy Monday!
Of course, it wouldn't be a recap of this week without a pretty comprehensive about one of the ugliest reality TV break ups in recent memory: What is it about these allegations of emotional and physical abuse that make us so uncomfortable?
Plus, the messy, messy divorce between Brad and Angelina escalated this week as both leaked like crazy. Oh, and are anonymous gossip Instagram accounts good for the world or an exercise in bullying?
If you're interested, here's the piece Zara mentioned on male privilege and violence on the podcast: http://www.abc.net.au/triplej/programs/hack/challenging-the-mra-claim-of-a-domestic-violence-conspiracy/8632190
As always, you're so welcome to join the conversation in our Facebook group! Otherwise, you can follow Michelle on Instagram here, Zara on Instagram here or get in touch at shamelessthepodcast@gmail.com.
OH and we’re on Instagram now, too. Follow us here.
We're a tiny, little independent podcast who rely on YOU GUYS so others can find us. If you have the time, we'd love it if you could subscribe to the show.
This episode was produced by Zara McDonald with royalty free music from Bensound.

item.title: A message for wellness warriors
item.description:
Guess what! We back! After a month off regular programming, we've resumed our normal eps and woweeeee did we have some things to discuss.
Yes, once again, it's time to chat about wellness warriors and dangerous messages of some of the most influential. Plus, the moment Channel 10 inadvertently told a country of women they just weren't very funny and how the response to Demi Lovato's reported overdose shines a harsh light on how we consider celebrity addiction.
You can read Jane Caro's piece on women in Australian comedy here, Benjamin Law's piece on Lee Lin Chin here, watch Amy here and read the NYT profile on Gwyneth Paltrow here.
As always, you're so welcome to join the conversation in our Facebook group! Otherwise, you can follow Michelle on Instagram here, Zara on Instagram here or get in touch at shamelessthepodcast@gmail.com.
OH and we’re on Instagram now, too. Follow us here. Before we go: We're a tiny, little independent podcast who rely on YOU GUYS so others can find us. If you have the time, we'd love it if you could subscribe to the show.
This episode was produced by Zara McDonald with royalty free music from Bensound.

item.title: The evolution of Steph Claire Smith
item.description: Steph Claire Smith is well-known for her presence on Instagram, but how has her approach to the platform changed as her following has boomed? We get her onto the show to ask her about the finite details of a social media presence that demands engagement of young girls. PLUS! Sylvia Jeffreys called out Woman's Day this week for posting lies about her relationship, so how in the world do they get away with publishing utter lies? In the wake of Rebel Wilson's case struggling on appeal, we go deep on why tabloids can get away with lying. And, of course, the flammable state of Posh and Becks' marriage: What in the world is going on? You can watch the Media Watch video here on how magazines doctor images, and the piece on Broadly from a woman who once worked in women's magazines. As always, you're so welcome to join the conversation in our Facebook group! Otherwise, you can find us on Twitter, follow Michelle on Instagram here, Zara on Instagram here or get in touch at shamelessthepodcast@gmail.com. Oh oh oh oh and we’re on Instagram now, too. Follow us here. And before we go: We're a tiny, little independent podcast who rely on YOU GUYS so others can find us. If you have the time, we'd love it if you could subscribe to the show. This episode was produced by Zara McDonald with royalty free music from Bensound.

And, of course, the flammable state of Posh and Becks' marriage: What in the world is going on?

You can watch the Media Watch video here on how magazines doctor images, and the piece on Broadly from a woman who once worked in women's magazines.

As always, you're so welcome to join the conversation in our Facebook group! Otherwise, you can find us on Twitter, follow Michelle on Instagram here, Zara on Instagram here or get in touch at shamelessthepodcast@gmail.com.

Oh oh oh oh and we’re on Instagram now, too. Follow us here.

And before we go: We're a tiny, little independent podcast who rely on YOU GUYS so others can find us. If you have the time, we'd love it if you could subscribe to the show.

This episode was produced by Zara McDonald with royalty free music from Bensound.

item.title: Kate Spade and clickbait culture
item.description: Hello listener friends! Coming up on today's show: How did the media do in handling the tragic suicide of Kate Spade? The coverage was pretty deplorable if you ask us. Plus, does Miss America dumping the swimsuit section from their competitions mean pageants are feminist? AND we really need to deep dive into the strange underground world of female fitness influencers injecting themselves with steroids. If you would like to skip our segment on Kate Spade and suicide, please pick back up at 35m 15s. Help is always available at Lifeline on 13 11 14. Click here for Guy Raz's interview with Kate Spade on How I Built This. And here for Zara's Mamamia.com.au story on celebrities and mental health. item.title: Gotta sign that NDA
item.description: Don't mess with celebrities and their clandestine sex lives; such was the message that come through this week, thanks to Love Island. Contestant Natasha not-so-subtly hinted to spending "two nights" with old mate Justin Bieber, but she'll be damned if she tells us much more. So what's the deal with water-tight NDAs around both sex and abuse? Plus, Hugh Grant was married this week in a spectacularly low-key affair, so is he officially Britain's most reluctant celebrity? And of course, the crazy White House world welcoming Kim Kardashian into its throes. Send help. This is too much. As mentioned in the show, you can read all about the scandalous history of celebrity NDAs here, and Hugh Grant's full statement to the Leveson inquiry here. As always, you're so welcome to join the conversation in our Facebook group! Otherwise, you can find us on Twitter, follow Michelle on Instagram here, Zara on Instagram here or get in touch at shamelessthepodcast@gmail.com. Oh oh oh oh and we’re on Instagram now, too. Follow us here. And before we go: We're a tiny, little independent podcast who rely on YOU GUYS so others can find us. If you have the time, we'd love it if you could subscribe to the show. This episode was produced by Zara McDonald with royalty free music from Bensound.

item.title: Love Island Australia is white. Too white
item.description:
In case you missed it, 2Day FM radio star Em Rusciano isn't here to be meek and mild. The presenter and comedian has been at the centre of a media storm this week, and we can't help but feel like the entire debacle is a little bit gendered.
We also dive into what Love Island Australia will be like (... can we have just a TINY BIT of diversity, please?) and Johnny Depp's career, two years after he was accused of domestic violence against Amber Heard. Read/hear the New York Times' interview with the cast of Arrested Development here. The Sydney Morning Herald's scathing (and questionable) portrayal of Em Rusciano is here. Are you a member of our Shameless Celebrity Gossip Facebook group yet? If not, GET IN THERE. It's like the sisterhood of the travelling pants. Except with no pants. Just great chats. You can find us on Instagram here. Zara keeps telling everyone about that time I was on The Daily Mail for being "extremely intoxicated" and I don't appreciate it. Or, if you are shy/refuse to contribute to Zuckerberg's rise to global domination, email us at shamelessthepodcast@gmail.com. THANK YOU FOR LISTENING, YOUR SUPPORT MEANS THE WORLD. We still can't believe how supportive and lovely you have all been. Thank you, thank you, thank you. I'm going to stop being gushy and embarrassing now. This episode was produced by Michelle Andrews. Royalty free music from Bensound.
